Ffurſeiddio,) yſtŷmio: to form, to put into a method.
Ffuſto, dyrnu: to beat with a Flail, to thraſh.

div.head: FFW.
div.p: Ffwlbart: a Fitch or kind of a Weaſle ſo called.
Ffwrch:) the Twiſt of a man or woman.
Ffwŷr, niwed: a hurt or harm.

div.head: FFY.
div.p: Ffynnhonwŷs, ffynnon, gofer ffynnon: a Well, alſo the Earth which the Well watereth.
Ffynnhonell, ffynnon fechan: a little Well.
Ffŷrf, crŷff, prâff: firm, ſtrong, alſo thick.
Ffyrnigo: to wax crafty, to grow cruel.
Ffyſgiolin, drud, hefŷd hael: dear, alſo liberal.

div.head: GA.
div.p: Gadael, gadaw: to leave, to forſake.
Gadaledd, Anniweirdeb, anlladrwŷdd: Luxury, Laſciviouſneſs, Incontinence.
Gadales, puttain: a Harlot, a Whore.
Gafaelu, dal: to hold, to catch, to apprehend.
Gafaelus, gafaelgar, un â gafael ſiccr: having a ſure hold.
Gafl: the Lap, the inner part of the Thighs.
Gaflach, piccell, ſaeth: a Lance, a Dart.
Gaflaw, Brithŷll, gleiſiad ieuangc: a Trout, a young Salmon.
Gafr y Dŵr, mâth ar brŷ dŵfr: a certain Worm in the water.
Gagen, agen: a chap, a cleft.
Gagennu, agennu: to chop, or cleave.
Geiriog, Areithwr, un yn Llawn o eiriau: an Orator, or one full of words.
Gaith, dyrnod: a ſtroke, a blow.
Gâl:) a Goal, or a mark to play at.
Galaru: to Mourn, to Lament, alſo to Clide, or to be Clided.
Galon, alon, gelynion, Dieithraid: Enemies, Strangers.
Galwai, geilwad: he that calleth, a common Cryer.
Galwŷn:) a Gallons, or four Quarts.
Galwŷnaid, llonaid galwŷn: a Gallon full.
Gallu, gallael, gallel: to be able.
Gangylchwŷ, edrŷch tarrian: a Buckler, or Shield.
Ganthu, ganthudd, ganthŷnt: with them, in their Poſſeſſion, of them.
Gar, ger, yn agos: nigh, before, or in preſent.
Gar llaw, wrth law: hard by, juſt at hand.
Garbron, o flaen wŷneb: before, in preſence of.
Gargam: having wreſted knees or ſhanks.
Garan, y Crŷr llŵyd, y gwddw grug: a Crane or Hearn.
Garawŷs: Lent, or the ſeven weeks before Eaſter.
Garddwŷ, mâth ar Lyſieuŷn yn tyfu yn Caria: an herb or ſhrub growing in Caria.
Garm, Germain, Bloedd, Bonllef: a Clamour, an Outcry.
Garmwŷn, Garmwŷnion, gwŷr meirch, marchogion: Troopers, Horſemen, Knights.
Garth, bryn, mynŷdd: a Promontory, a Hill.
Lluarth, Y llê y gorffwŷſo llu, Gwerſŷll: a Camp where an Army lies.
Gaudŷ, tŷ Cachu: a Houſe of Office, or Jakes.
Gawr, Bonllef, trwſt: a Noiſe, a Shout, an Outcry.
Gawri, llefain: to ſhout or make a noiſe.

div.head: GE.
div.p: Gefail bydoli, a pair of pinchers.
Geirlyfr, llyfr o eiriau: a Dictionary.
Gelor, Elor: a Bier to carry dead Corps upon.
Gell, lliw gwinau: a Bay Colour.
Gellwng, gillwng, gollwng: to let looſe, to redeem, to abſolve.
Gellygbren, gellŷwŷdden, pren Erwning: a Pear-tree.
Gem, maen gwerth-fawr: a precious Stone called a Ruby.
Gemmog, llawn Cenn, garw gennog: rough, and full of ſcales.
Genau goeg: a Newt, an Efft an Aſcker.
Genfa, Gwenfa, gên ffrwŷn: a Barnacle ſee on a Horſe's Noſe, alſo the Bite of a Bridle.
Genni, cynwŷs neu ddal ynddo: to hold, to contain.
Geol,) Carchar: a Priſon, a Gaol.
Ger, gar: before, or in preſence.
Geran, gerain, crio, udo: to cry, to houl.
Germain, nadu, udo: to make a noiſe, to houl.
Gerwino: to grow fierce or cruel.
Geſtwng, giſtwng, goſtwng: to incline, to bow down, to alore.
Gewai, un Cûl iawn: one that is very lean.

div.head: GI.
div.p: GIach, mâth ar Geffylog, bychan, yſnitten: a Snipe or little Woodcock.
Gillwng: to let looſe, to abſolve.
Ginio, hifio: to pluck off the Wooll, to make bare, to teeſe.
Gwlân ginn, gulân wedi ei hifio: Wooll teeſed or pulled off.
Gingroen: a ſtinking thing (like a Toad-ſtooll,) called Toad-flax.
Gîſt, gîſtbridd, prîddgiſt bêdd: a Grave.

div.head: GL.
div.p: Glaiad, Tail gwartheg wedi ſychu: Cow-dung dryed up.
Glaif, bilwg, pladur, Crymman: a Hedge-bill, a Sithe, a Reaping-hook, a Sickle.
Glain, henw maen gwerthfawr: a precious Stone called a Ruby, alſo a Pearl.
Glann, Torlan: a Bank by a water ſide.
Glann y dŵr: the water ſide.
Glann y môr: the Sea-ſide, or Sea-ſhore.
Glaſu: to wax pale, to wax blue.
Glas-chwerthin, gwenu: to ſmile or laugh ſeemingly or privily.
Glâſtennen, mâth ar dderwen: the Scarlet Oak.
Glàſtorch, Blaidd neu Lwynog Ieuange: a little Wolf. or Fox.
Globyn,) Cronnell y bŷd, llun y bŷd: a Globe.
Gloddeſt, ymgeſtio neu ymrythu ar fwŷd neu ddiod: a Riot, or an exceſſive Eating or Drinking.
Gloes, Loes: a pang or pain; alſo an Extaſie.
Gloŷwi: to make bright, to clear up.
Glud: Bird-time, Dr. Davies ſaith, that it ſignifies alſo, ſtiff, ſtubborn, and patient.
Glŵth, barus, Rheibus: ravenous, gluttonous, devouring. Glythin, Glythineb, Bàr, Rhaib: Gluttony, Voracity.
Glŵth, mainge eſmwŷth i orwedd arni: a Couch.
Glynu: to ſtick, to hold faſt.
Glŷnn: a Grove or Wood; alſo a Dale.

div.head: GN.
div.p: Gnodawl, mewn arfer, arferawl: much in uſe, accuſtomed.
Gnottaf, yn fwŷa arferedig: Chiefly accuſtomed, moſt in uſe.
Gnif, gniff, Alaeth, (Trwbl,) poen, dolur: grief, trouble, labour, pain, affliction.
Gnottai, lloeren o amgŷlch y lleuad neu ſeren: a Circle about the Moon or Star.

div.head: GO.
div.p: Gobant, dŷffrŷn bychan: a little Valley or Dale.

Gobell, go-bell, hefyol Cyfrwŷ:
ſomewhat far; alſo a Saddle.
Gobr, gwobr, gobrwŷ, dobor, cyflog: a Reward, Wages, Stipeny.
Gobrwŷo, dobri, Talu Cyflog: to reward.
Gobrŷn, haeddedigaeth: a deſert, a merit.
Gobwŷllo, Pwŷllo, darparu, arlwŷo: to provide, to procure.
Gochawn, Cawn, Cael a wnawn: we ſhall have.
Gochel, gochelŷd, gochlyd, gwagelŷd: to beware, to ſhun or avoid.
Gochrwm, go gamm neu grwm: ſomewhat crooked.
Godech, llechfa, ymguddiad: a hiding or lurking.
Godechu, llechu, ymguddio: to lie hid, or to lurk.
Godechwr, llechwr, ymguddiwr: a Lurker, he that hideth himſelf, or lieth in wait.
Godor, Ymaros, Rhwŷſtr, gorphwŷs: delay, hinderance, intermiſſion.
Godorun, Terfŷſg, Nâd, Cythryfwl: a tumult, a noiſe, an uproar.
Godrig, ymaros, trigfa: delay, alſo habitation or dwelling.
Godwrf, godwrdd, terfyſg, trallod, cythryfwl: a tumult or uproar.
Goddaith, tân mawr, Eiriasdân: a great fire, a burning flame.
Goddef, dioddef: to bear, ſuffer or endure.
Goddeg, gofeg, meddwl neu ewyllŷs: one's mind or pleaſure.
Goddau, amcan, bwriad: an intent, purpoſe or deſign.
Goddiwedŷdd, diwedŷdd, diwedd dŷdd, tua 'r nôs: towards night, ſomewhat late, evening.
Goddiwes, gorddiwes, goddiweddŷd, dyfod o hŷd iun: to overtake.
Gofaniaeth, Celfyddŷd y gôf: the Craft or Trade of a Smith.

Gofeiliaint, gofalon, trymder:
cares, heavineſs, penſiveneſs, troubles.
Gofeg, meddwl neu ewyllŷs: one's mind or pleaſure.
Gofer, Gofer ffŷnnon: a Rivulet or Stream that runs out of a Well.
Goferu, rhedeg, diferu, llifo allan: to flow, to ſpring out, to diſtil.
Gofidiaw, gofidio, diodde gofid: to endure pain, to ach.
Gofidus: full of pains or aches.
Goflew, ſaeth-flew: the tender Hair that grows in the faces.
Gofron, brŷn bychan: a little Hill or Mountain.
Gofuned, adduned neu diofrŷd, hefŷd dymuniad: a Vow or Promiſe to God; alſo a Petition, a Requeſt.
Gofyged, myged: urddas, gogoniant: honour, glory.
Gofynag, gofynaig, diofrŷd, hefyd gobaith, ymddiried: Hope, Truſt; alſo a Vow.
Gogan-gerdd, dychan: a Satyr, a Satyrick Poem, a carping Song.
Gogawn, gwogawn, Crŷf, gwrol: ſtrong, manly.
Gogelŷd, gochelŷd: to beware, to defend ones ſelf.
Gogof, ogof: a Cave or Den.
Gogrŷn, gogrynnu: to ſift or ſierce.
Goguſa, Chware, (enterliwt:) to play an Enterlude.
Gogwŷdd: inclining, bending, a leaning of one ſide.
Gogwyddo: to incline, to bend, to lean ſide-wiſe.
Gogwŷs, gwŷs, gwŷddis: it is known.
Gogyfoed, or un oed, Cyfoedion: of the ſame age.

Gogyfurdd, Cydradd: equal,
the ſame Rank and Quality.
Gogyhŷd, gogŷd, or un hŷd: of equal length, Equinox.
Gogynydu, Cyhydu: to make of equal length.
Gogymraff, or un praffder: of the ſame or equal thickneſs.
Gohebu, Siarad: to ſpeak, to talk.
Gohir, ymaros, ymoedi: a delay, a lingering.
Gohir Ddadl, hir gyfraith: a tedious ſuit of Law.
Gohirlo, oedi. to delay, to prolong, to defer.
Gohybu, hybu: to recruite, to take courage.
Golaith, Angeu, hefyed lladdfa: Death; alſo a Slaughter.
Golchbren, golchffon: a waſhing Spatule, a Batting ſtaff.
Golchi: to waſh, alſo to beat.
Golchwraig, golchuries: a Waſher-woman, a Laundreſs.
Goleuo: to light, to give light.
Golfan, yderyn ŷ tô: a Sparrow.
Golinio, Curo ar glin: to beat with the Knee.
Goloſged, a fô gwedi goloſgi: that which is ſinged, or ſomething burned.
Golygawd, Tremmiad, gwelediad: a ſight, an aſpect.
Golygu: to behold, to regard, to overſee.
Golygus: ſeemly, fair to the Eye.
Golwrch, Blwch o bren (Bocs:) a Box made of Box-tree.
Golwŷth: a Raſher, or Collop of any ſort of fleſh.
Golvchwŷdol, goleichiawg, crefyddol, dwŷwol, duwiol: religious, devout, given to prayer.
Gollwng: to let looſe, to redeem, to abſolve.
Gommach, Caes: a Legg or Shank.
Gori: to grow into matter or Impoſthume, to corrupt in the fleſh.
Gor, uwch law, o flaen: above, higher, before.
Gorafun, gwarafun, gwrafun: to grudge, to forbid.
Gorair, Rhagferf, un o' rannau ymadrodd: a part of Speech called an Adverb.
Goralw, ymoralw, ymorol: to call often, to enquire after.
Gorchan, Swŷn, Swŷn-gân: a Charm or Inchantment.
Gorcheiniad, Swŷnwr: a Magician, an Inchanter.
Gorchaw, nai neu nith: a Nephew or Neece.
Gorcheifn, Gorcheiſnaint, neioedd, nithoedd: Nephews, Neeces.
Gorchfanad, gorchfanau, gorcharfanau, gên, cliccied gên: Jaws.
Gorchuddio, cuddio: to hide, to cover.
Gorchudd, Caead: a Lid or Cover.
Gorchwirio, gwirio, gwirhau: to atteſt, to verifie.
Gorchyfarwŷ, dechreunos: the Dusk of the Evening.
Gorchyflug, pla, Cornwŷd: a Plague or Peſtilence, an Affliction, a Torment.
Gorchymmŷn, Peri, erchi: a Precept, a Commandment.
Gorchmynnu, Gorchymmynnu: to command, to give a charge.
Gordd: a woodden Mallet or Hammer; alſo a Churn-ſtaff.
Gorddod, dyrnod Gordd: the ſtroke or knock of a Mallet; alſo a puſh or thruſt with a Churn-ſtaff.
Gordderch: a Concubine, a Miſs, a Baſtard, or an unlawful begotten Child.
Gordderchu: to commit fornication or adultery, to get Baſtards.
Gorddifanw, difanw, diflanedig: decaying, frail, fading, periſhing.

Gorddifer, defnynnu yn bryfur,
diſtyllio: to drop faſt, to diſtil.
Gorddigor, cyflwr, anſodd, gwiſg: ſtate, condition, habit, dreſs, equipage.
Gorddillwng, gillwng: to abſolve, to let looſe, to looſen.
Gorddin, diferlif, gwaedlif: a Flux, Iſſue, or Flowing.
Gorddineu, tywallt allan, llifo: to pour out, to iſſue, to flow.
Gorddiwes, goddiwes, dyfod o hud, dal, trechu: to overtake, to out do, to ſubdue, to compel.
Gorddor, drws bychan, Rhagddor: a Hatch, or little Door, a Poſtern.
Gorddwfn, dwfn, llyngclŷn, llŷn llyngcu, padell dŵr: a Deep, a Gulph, a Whirlepond, or Pool.
Gorddŵr▪ dŵr uchel, llanw dŵr: high-water, flood.
Gorddwŷ, trais, gormes, gwaſgfa: oppreſſion, tranſgreſſion.
Gorddwŷo, treiſio, gwaſgu, gormeſu: to preſs ſore, to oppreſs. to treſpaſs.
Gorddwŷn, gordd i yrru polion neu gerrig: a Mallet to drive Wood or Stone into the ground.
Gorddŷar, ſŵn, Rhuad, trwſt: a ſound, a roaring, a bellowing, a noiſe.
Gorddyfnu, annog, dwŷn ar gôf, arferu: to advertiſe, to perſwade, to accuſtom.
Gorddyfnaid, yr un a gorddyfnu: the ſame with gorddyfnu.
Gorddyfnaid gwaed, gollwng gwaed: to let blood, to bleed.
Goreilid, llwŷth trwm: a heavy burden, a grievance, a great load.
Goreilittio, greilidiaw, llwytho, bôd yn fauch: to burden, to be burdenſome or grievous, given to torment or vex.
Goreſgŷn, goſdegu, Trechu, Tynnu Tan draed: to vanquiſh, to ſubdue, to conquer, to bring under.
Goreſgynnŷdd, plentyn y gorwŷr: a great Grand-child.
Goreth: a Tent for a Wound.
Goreu, goreuon, y rhai goreu: the beſt, the chiefeſt.
Goreugwŷr, gore gwŷr, Pendefigion: Noblemen; alſo the Chief Maſters or Governours of a Common-wealth, or Pariſh.
Goreu, gwnaeth: he made it, he did it.
Gorewŷdd, Rhewŷdd, Trythyllwch, Anllad: Litchery, Letcherous, Luxury.
Gorfedd, gorwedd: to lye along, to lye down.

Gorfeddawd, Bêdd: a Grave.
a Sepulcher, a Tomb.
Gorferw, ammhuredd ar wyneb Crochan, amhuredd (Mettel:) the froth of boiling Liquor; alſo Droſs, the refuſe of Metal tried by the Fire.
Gorflawdd, Blawdd, Chwimwth, bŷan: ſwift, nimble, quick. fleet.
Gorflwch, (Cwppan) fel blŵch: a Cup like a Box.
Gorflychaid, (Cwppanaid:) a Cup full, a Diſh full.
Gorflwng, tauog, anfodlon, anfoddog, blin: auſtere, wayward, ſullen, contentleſs, diſcontented.
Gorfod, Trechu, Curo ynnill y maes: to vanquiſh, to overcome, to ſubdue, to conquer, to bring under.
Gorfod, gorfodaeth, y gamp: a Victory.
Gorfodawg, goreſgynnwr, hwn a aeth a'r maes: a Victorer, a Vanquiſher, a Conqueror, a Subduer.
Gorfodogi, Rhoi yn y Llaw ganol, hefŷd ynnill y maes: to Sequeſter, to put into ones hand, as indifferent; alſo to get the Victory, or win the Field.
Gorfodogaeth, ar farn, Tan farn, y farn a allom ei roddi fel y mynnom: Arbierament, the Judgment of Arbitrators.
Gorfoledd, llywenydd am ennill y maes: triumph, joy or gladneſs for the gaining of a Victory.
Gorfoleddu, llawenychu am ennill y maes: to triumph, to rejoice at the gaining of a Victory.
Gorfygu, gorchfygu: to overcome, to ſtifle, to choak up.
Gorfyn, gorfynt, cynghorfynt, cenfigen, cynfigen, Lîd: envy, malice.
Gorffeigio, gorchfygu: to overcome, to ſtifle.
Gorffwŷll, cynddaredd, ynfydrwŷdd, amhwŷllder: rage, folly, madneſs.
Gorffwyr, ffwŷr, Rhyfel, ymladd: War, a Fight, Strife, Controverſie, a Combat.
Gorffwŷſo, gorphwŷſo, gorffywŷs: to reſt, to take reſt, to leave off.
Gorhoen, llawenydd: joy, gladneſs, mirth, divertion.
Gorhewg, gwaſaidd neu (ſlafŷs,) croeſan, tra-hŷ neu (ſoſi:) ſlaviſh, ſaucy, ſcurrilous, foul-mouth'd.
Goriain, crio yn fynŷch, gweiddi yn aml: to cry often, to frequent bauling.
Gorllanw, llawn-fôr, pen llanw'r môr: full Sea, the height or top of a Flood.
Gorllenwi, llenwi: to fill, to to be filled, to flow.
Gorllwng, llyngcu: to ſwallow, eat up, to divour.
Gorllwŷdd, llwŷdd, llwŷddianr, cynnŷdd: proſperity, good luck, increaſe.
Gorllwŷn, calŷn, ymlid: to purſue, to follow after, to chaſe.
Gormail, Trais. gormes, trechiad: Oppreſſion, a Conqueſt, a Subduing, a bringing under.
Gormeilo, gorchfygu, trechu: to Conquer or overcome, to ſubdue, to bring under, to controul.
Gormes: a treſpaſs, an incroachment, an over-reaching.
Gormeſu: to treſpaſs, to oppreſs, to be burdenſome.
Gormeſol: burdenſome, given to treſpaſs. oppreſſive.
Gormod, gormodd, mwŷ na digon: too much, more than needs, ſuper fluity.
Gormwŷth, trymder meddwl, alaeth, Trymder calon: heavineſs, ſadneſs, grief, perplexity.
Gorober, Ober, anober, gwaelbeth, Pêth diwres: a thing of nothing, a ſorry or inconſiderable thing, a trifle.
Goror, cwrr, ymmŷl, mant, yftlŷs, mîn: a coaſt, a conſine, an edge, a brim, a border.
Gorpo, gorpho, gorfyddo gorfod, trechu: to Vanquiſh, to Overcome, to Subdue, to Conquer, to bring under.
Gorphell, ymhell, ymhell oddiwrth: afar off, at a diſtance.
Gorphen, dibennu, diweddu: to end, to finiſh, to conclude, to make an end, to accompliſh.
Gorphenhàf, gorphen hâf: the Month July, the fifth Month.
Gorpherchi, perchi, anrhydeddu: to honour, to reverence, to reſpect.
Gorpherŷgl, peryglus: dangerous, very dangerous, dubious, doubtful.
Gorphwŷſo: to reſt, to repoſe one ſelf, to leave off, to deſiſt.
Gorphwysfa: reſt, a place of reſt, a deſiſting.
Gorſefŷll, ſefyllian, aros, ſefyll yn ei lê: to ſubſiſt, to continue.
Gorſedd, eiſteddle: a Seat, a Throne, a Tribunal.
Gorſeddog, yn perthyn i Orſedd, neu eiſteddle: pertaining to a Seat or Throne.
Gorſin, (pôſt) drws, Rhinniog: a Door-poſt, a Door-ſill.
Gorthîr, y tîr uchaf: the higheſt ground.
Gortho, Cronglwŷd: the roof of a Houſe or Building.
Gorthoi, tôi: to Thatch, to Tile or Slate.
Gorthorch, Torch, Cadwŷn, Tid: a Collar, a Chain.
Gorthorri, torri ymmaith: to break or cut off.
Gorthorriant, torriad, adwŷ, bwlch: a fraction, a breach.
Gorthrech, trais, goreſcynfa, trechiad: Oppreſſion, Extortion, Victory, Conqueſt.
Gorthrechu, gwaſgu ar, trechu: to oppreſs, to overcome.
Gorthrŷch, gorthrychiad, delw, eulun: a Statue, or Image.
Gorthrymmu, gormeſu, trallodi: to wax heavy, to afflict, to oppreſs.
Gorthrymder, trallod, blinder, helbub: heavineſs, affliction, trouble, ſorrow.
Gorthywŷs, tywŷs, twŷſennau ŷd: Ears of Corn.
Goruch, goruwch, Uwchlaw, uchach: above, higher.
Gorugaw, gorchfygu: to overcome, to ſtifle.
Gorun, uwch nag: higher than, ſuperior to.
Gorwaered, gowaered, gwaered, goriwared: a deſcent, a precipice, a down-hill.
Gorwŷ, gorfu, gorchfygodd, trechodd: he overcame.
Gorwŷd, gorfuoſt, trechaiſt: thou haſt overcome.
Gorwŷdd, gorwŷddawd, ceffŷl: a Horſe, a Nag.
Gorwŷn, go wŷn, llwŷdwŷn: ſomewhat white, grey.
Gorwŷrain, Arwŷrain, cyſodi, eſgŷn, codi: to riſe, aſcend, exalt.
Gorymddwŷn, deall: to comprehend, to perceive.
Gorŷn, llinorŷn, pilorŷn: a pimple or wheal.
Goryſgwr, trais, gwaſgfa: a preſſing, a ſtraining; alſo oppreſſion, treſpaſs.
Gorŷw, gorfu, gorchfygodd, trechodd: he overcame, he ſubdued.
Gorŷw, gwnaeth, efe a wnaeth: he made, he did.
Goſeilio, ſeilio, ſylfaenu: to lay a foundation.
Goſpaith, paith, wedi ei adael, wedi ei anrheithio: forſaken, ſpoiled.
Goſeb, gwoſeb, rhodd tuag at fwyniant crefyddol: a Gift or Preſent beſtow'd for holy uſe.
Goſgedd, ffurf, gwêdd, yſtŷm: a form, a figure.
Goſgeddig, prydferth, hardd: beautiful, handſom, amiable.
Goſgordd, ceidwadaeth. (sir:) a Guard, a Train, a County, a Shire.
Goſgymmon, peth i ddechreu ac i gadw tân: Tinder, Small-coal, or anything for the kindling of a Fire.
Goſe, goſlef, oſlef: a voice or tone.
Goſod: to ſet, lay, or place.
Goſod, Deddf, Ordinhâad, cyfraith: a Statute, a Conſtitution, Ordinance.
Goſodau Dynion, Dynol Ordinhâdau: humane Ordinances.
Goſod, cyrchu am benn un: an aſſault, alſo to inſult.
Goſſon, gô ſon, brith ſŵn: an uncertain ſound.
Goſdeg mewn cerdd, cweiriad tannau: the aſſay or tryal that Muſicians uſe to make before they play.
Goſtegwr, yr hwn a archo oſdeg: a Cryer that demands ſilence.
Goſtwng: to deſcend, to humble, to make a Curchy.
Goſymddaith, goſymmaith, lluniaeth, ymborth: food, victuals.
Goſymddeithio, goſymmeithio, rhoddi ymborth: to Victual, to afford Proviſion.
Got, goth, balchder, hefŷd godinebwr: Pride; alſo an Adulterer.
Gowrni, Mâb y Nai: a Nephew's Son.

div.head: GR.
div.p: GRadell: an iron Plate to bake Cakes upon.
Graen, graendde, galarus, prudd: lamentable, mournful.
Grain, crain, gorwedd: to lye down.
Gran, Amrant y llygad: the Eye-lid.
Grawŷs, garawŷs: Lent, or the 45 days before Eaſter.
Gre, greon, diadell neu Lû o feirch neu geſig: a Herd of Horſes, or Stud of Marts.
Greawr, ceidwad gyrr neu fintai o Ynifeliaid: a Herdſman.
Grêal, llyfr yn cynnwys amrŷw (Hiſtoriau:) a certain Hiſtorical Book containing various Hiſtories.
Greddfu, cŷd-tyfu, cyd-eni: to grow together with one, to be born with one.
Gregar, Clwccian fal iâr: to Clock or Cackle as a Hen.
Grelŷnn, llŷnn i ddyfrhau Enifeiliaid: a Pool to water Cattle.
Grem, grwgnach, Rhingcian dannedd: a murmuring; alſo a craſhing or gnaſhing of the Teeth.
Gromial, Grymial, ymſennu, grwgnach: to ſcold, to murmure or mutter.
Greſynu, toſturio: to pity, to commiſerate.

Griffwn), màth ar Aderŷn, dŷn
trwŷngam fel pig gwalch: a Griphin; alſo a Man having a crooked Noſe like a Hawk's Bill.
Grill, Trwst hefyd Gridill: a Noiſe; alſo a Gridiron.
Grillian, ſynnio wrth daro y naill wrth y llall: to crack or craſh.
Grug i àr, Grug i air, Iâr y mynnŷdd: a Heath-Hen.
Grugionŷn, mywionŷn: an Ant, a Piſmire.
Grwgach, grwgnach: to murmure; alſo murmuring.
Grwnn▪ Cefn o dir: a Butt, a Ridge, a Land lying between two Furrows.
Grŵn, ochen, Cwŷnfan Colommen: Groaning, the Cooing of a Dove.
Grwŷth, grwŷtho, grwgnach, gwneuthur Trŵſt: a murmuring, a making a noiſe.
Grŷd, Ymdrech, Ymladd: a Conflict or Battle.
Grymio, bód yn gallu: to be able, of force and power.
Grymial, ymremial, ymſennu, grwgnach: to ſcold, to murmure, to mutter.
Gryngian, grwgnach, ſibrwd: to gruntle, to mutter.
Grŷr, Crŷr glàs, Crŷr llwŷd, gwddw grug: a Bird called a Heron, a Hearn or Crane.
Grŷw, Groaeg, iaith y groegwŷr: the Greek Tongue.

div.head: GW.
div.p: GWagelŷd, gochelŷd: to avoid, to ſhun.
Gwadn Efgid: the ſole of a Shooe.
Gwadn Troed: the ſole of the Foot.
Gwadnu: to ſet ſoles, to ſole.
Gwaedling; a flux of blood, alſo bleeding at the Noſe.
Gwaedogen, Pennygen; a Tript, a Chitterling.
Gwaederw, Erw'r gwaed; the field of blood.
Gwaed-raidd, Gwauwffon waedlud; a bloody Spear.
Gwâeg, a (Bwccl, Claſp:) a Buckle, a Claſp.
Gwaelbeth; a trifle, of ſmall value.
Gwaelod; a bottom, alſo the Dregs.
Gwaelodi; to bottom, alſo to ſettle or grow thick at the bottom.
Gwaell, gwahell, gwaell bren, a Skewer.
Gwaered, gorwared, gorinared; a diſcent, a down hill.
Gwaeſaf, arwaeſaf, (gwarant,) Cymmorth; a Warrant, alſo help.
Gwaethu, gwaethâu, gwaethygu; to grow worſe, to make worſe.
Gwaethl, cywaethl, cynnen, ymryſſon; ſtrife, debate.
Gwagelyd, gochelyd; to avoid, to ſhun.
Gwaglwŷf, mâth ar bren; Linden, or Teil tree.
Gwagſaw; vain, light, immodeſt, alſo careleſs.
Gwahell, gwaêll; a skewer, alſo a knitting-needle.
Gwahennu, gwahynnu, tywallt, gwâghau; to pour out, to empty.
Gweirio, Cyweirio gwair; to make hay.
Gweithred; a deed, a fact, an Action, an act.
Gwâl, Ile i orwedd; a place littered to lie upon.
Gwalc;) a Cock in the hat, a Gwalck.
Gwallaw, gwallawf, tynnu, tywallt allan; to draw, to pour out.
Gwallawgair, yw'r hawlwr a gollo ei hawll o wall; a Plaintiff that loſeth his Cauſe by reaſon of want.
Gwallofiad, Gwallawfwr, Trulliad, Gollyngwr Diod; a Drawer, a Butler, a Topſter.
Gwâllt; the hair of the head.
Gwammal, anwaſtad, anwadl; unſtable. wavering, inconſtant.
Gwân, piggiad, brâth; a prick, a piercing, a ſtab.
Gwânu, Trywanu, brathu trŵodd, pigo; to pierce or run through, to prick.
Gwanafog, gwŷnafog, (ſur) digllon; moroſe, froward, angry.
Gwaneg, dull neu ffŷrf; a figure or form.
Gwanegu, ffrydio, llifo; to ſpring up, to iſſue out, to flow.
Gwaredigenus, gwareddawg, trugarog, tyner; merciful, tender, mild.
Gwarr; the noddle, the nape of the neck.
Gwaradwydd, gwradwydd, cwilidd, anglod; a diſgrace.
Gwarafun, gorafun; to grudge, to forbid.
Gwarchad; to keep at home, to obſerve.
Gwarchodaeth, gwiliadwriaeth, cadwriaeth; watch and ward, cuſtody.
Gwarcheu; to ſhut in or pound
Gwarchen le; a pound for cattle.
Gwared, gwaredu; to deliver or defend.
Gwarthaf helm, crib (helm,) (top) yr hwylbren; the top of a Helmet, alſo the top of a Maſt.
Gwarthflawdd, blawdd, buan chwimmwth; nimble, quick, ſwift.
Gwaſg; the waſt of the middle.
Gaſgaru; to diſperſe, to ſpread abroad.
Gwaſgodi, cyſgodi; to ſhade, to ſhelter.
Gwaſod, buwch yn gofyn Tarw; a Cow that takes a Bull.
Gwaſtadedd, cyfiawnder; a plain ground, alſo equity.
Gwaſdatta, to reſt, or leave off.
Gwaſtraffu gwaſgaru, tanu; to diſſipate, to diſperſe.
Gwaſtrawd, un yn Edrych ar ôl Ceffylau; a Groom, an Hoſtler.
Gwaſtrawd afwyn, Un yn rheoli y flrwyn; he that ruleth the Bridle, a Foot man, a Laqucy, a Page of honour, a Poſtilion.
Gwatwar, gwatwor; to mock, to ſcoff at.
Gwatwargerdd, dychan; a laughing-ſtock, a ſcoff, a ſcurrillous ſong.
Gwawdŷdd, Un yn Canmol arall ar air neu gân; he that praiſeth another by word or ſong. Dr. Davies.
Gwawl, (gwal,) à Wall, a Trench, a Bulwark.
Gwawn, gwaith, y Pryf Coppyn; the Spider's web.
Gwawr, torriad y wawr; the break of day.
Gwawr, Gwr breiniol o ragorawl Rinwedd; a Noble Gentleman of excellent vertue.
Gwaŷw; a ſtitch or diſeaſe ſo called.
Gwaywawr, gŵr yn dwyn Gwaywffon neu (beic,) a Spearman, a Pikeman.
Gwccw; the voice of the Cuckow.
Gwê 'r Coppyn, gwehydercop; the Spider's web.
Gwêdd; form, likeneſs, favour, complexion, alſo a Team of Oxen or Horſes.
Gweddaidd; decent ſeemly, handſom, courteous, friendly, familiar.
Gweddill; Reliques, alſo to leave or ſpare.
Gweddwi; to become a Widower, or Widow.
Gwegil; the nape of the neck.
Gwehelyth, pen conedl; the ſtock of any Tribe, the top of a Family.
Gwehilion; refuſe, ſweepings, the worſt of Corn.
Gwehynnu, glanhau, tywallt; to empty, to pour out.
Gweilgi, y cefnfôr, cenllif; the Ocean, a Stream, a Flood
Gweilging, ffonn hîr; a long flaff.
Gweilig, gwîn-wrŷf, gwaſgbren i waſgu grawnwîn; a Wine preſs.
Gweilŷdd, gweili, gwâg, dirann; empty, void.
Gweini, gweinyddu, gwaſanaethu; to ſerve, to miniſter.
Gweinydd, gweiniad, gweinidog; a Miniſter, one that ſerveth.
Gweithred; an Action, an Act, a Deed, a Fact.
Gwelyddon, gwelygordd, Penn Cenedl; the Stock of a Family, the Top of a Kin.
Gwelyfan, Gwelyfod, yſtafell gwelu; a Bed-chamber, alſo a Coach.
Gwelygordd, Penn y Genedl; the Top of the Tribe.
Gwellt y Ddaiar, glaſwellt; green Graſs.
Gwellygiaw, goddeu gwall neu angen; to ſuffer want.
Gwener, Duwies Trythŷllferch, un o'r planedau; Venus.
Gwenfa, Genfa, gênddalfa; a Barnacle to ſet on a Horſe's Noſe.
Gwennol y gwŷdd; a Weaver's ſhuttle.
Gwengolo, mis medi; the month September.
Gwenheithgar, gwenheithus; flattering, given to flatter.
Gwenhwyſeg, Jaith-Gwent; the Dialect of Chepſtow formerly, and now of all South-Wales.
Gwenhwyſon, gwŷr-Gwent; the Inhabitants of South-Wales.
Gwep, wyneb, pig; countenance, face, bill.
Gweren; a Cake or lump of melted Tallow.
Gwerbl, Meſen, Caſtan gneuen; an Acorn, a Cheſnut.
Gwerchyr, Caead; a Cover, a Lid.
Gwerddyr, cylch yr arffed; the Groin.
Gwerin, pobl gyffredin; the common people.
Gwern, gwernlle; a Grove of Alders.
Gwernenlleſtr, hwylbren llong; the maſt of a ſhip.
Gwerſig; a little verſe or leſſon.
Gwerſu; to verſifie, to repeat verſes.
Gwersŷll, Gwersŷllt, ymgaſgliad llu o filwŷr, a hefyd bythau milwyr a wneler o Liain ar bolion, i letteua ynddynt ar y meusŷdd; a Camp, alſo a Tent to lye in.
Gweryd, daiar wedi ei chloddio i fynu; Earth caſt up.
Gweryru; to neigh or bray as a Horſe.
Gweſt, llettu cyffredin, llettu; an Inne, a Lodging.
Gweſtai, lletteuwr; a Gueſt, a Lodger.
Gweſtwr: a bold Gueſs, a ſmellfeaſt.
Gweſtifiant, llettŷ i geraint a chythrachwŷr; a Lodging for Friends and Kinſmen.
Gweſtl, gwyſtl; a Pawn, a pledge.
Gwewŷr, gwaŷw; a Diſeaſe called a Stitch.
Gŵg, dîg. cuchiad; wrath, anger, frowning.
Gwîb, myned o lê i lê; a wandering.
Gwibio, to wander, to go aſtray.
Gwibiad, gwibiadr, gwîbddyn, Rhodiennwr; a vagabond.
Gwîch, gwichian; a ſquealing, a ſqueeking.
Gwichiad, mâth ar byſgodyn; a fiſh called a Periwinkle.
Gwichet, drŵs cefn; a back door, a poſtern Gate.
Gwiddon, cawres, (wits;) a Witch, a Sorcereſs, a Gianteſs.
Gwîf, troſol haiarn: an Iron Bar.
Gwig, gwigfa, llwŷn o goed; a Grove or Wood.
Gwigyn, un yn bŷw yn y coed; one that lives in the Wood.
Gwîl, gwilff, gwilog, caſeg; a Mare.
Gwilym, mâth ar Aderyn; a certain Bird.
Gwill, gwilliad; a Lurker, a night Thief.
Gwimpl, Rhyw ddilledyn pen; a kind of veil or covering.
Gwingo; to kick, ſpurn, winch, or flinch.
Gwinllan, perllan o goed grawn-Wîn; a Vineyard.
Gwiſgadur, gwiſg; a dreſſer, alſo a dreſs.
Cnau gwiſgi; brown or ripe Nuts.
Gwiwdab, teilyngdod; Dignity, pertinacy, a purpoſe.
Gwladeidd-dra, gwladeiddrwŷdd, gwŷldra; clowniſhneſs, ruſticity, baſhfulneſs.
Gwleiddiadon, Cywleiddiadon, Cydwladwŷr; Country People, or of the ſame Country.
Gwledig, Brenin, gwr enwog; a King, alſo a Peer.
Gwlêdd; a Feaſt, a Banquet, moſt commonly uſed for Chriſtning dainties.
Gwlŷdd, llarriaidd, gwâr; mild, gentle, tender.
Gwlŷdd pen y tŷ; a herb called Chick-weed.
Gwneuthur; to do, to make, to commit.
Gwneddwyf, gwnaethum; I did do, I have done.
Gwneddyw, gwnaddoedd, gwnaeth; he made, he has done.
Gwnî, gwnîad; a ſeam, a ſowing.
Gwnnon, gwŷnnon, Pillwydd onn; dry Aſh cut in ſplinters.
Gwp, pîg Aderyn; the Bill of a Bird.
Gŵr a Man, alſo a Husband.
Gŵra; to ſeek or marry a Huſband.
Gŵr nôd, Gŵr Enwog; a man of note or fame.
Gŵr Dinod; a man of no account.
Gŵr-Rhîf, gŵr mewn Rhîf; a man Regiſtred or Enrolled.
Gŵr pŵŷs, gŵr newŷdd brîodi; a Bridegroom.
Gŵraf, yn llê gwrolaf; moſt valiant, moſt manly.
Gwrhàu, ymroddi, ymoſdwng, ymillwng; to ſurrender himſelf, to make homage, to promiſe fealty.
Gwrial, chwarae'r gŵr; to play the man.
Gwrachîaidd; like an old woman, doting.
Gwrâch y lludw: a Cheſlib or kitchin bob, a wood-lowſe.
Gwradwŷdd, gwaradwŷdd, diyſtyr, lliwied gorafŷn, Cywilŷdd; a Reproach.
Gwragen, dôl, dolen, dylyſtig; any thing that bends like a Bow.
Gwreigea; to ſeek or marry a Wife.
Gwreignith, gwraig fechan dlws; a pretty little Wife.
Gwraint; the worms in a hand.
Gwreinyn; a worm in the hand.
Gwrando, gwrandaw; to hear, to hearken.
Gŵrda; a good man, a noble man.
Gwreictra, Tynerwch, moethuſdra, tryrhillwch; tenderneſs, delicateneſs, wantonneſs.
Gwreiddio: to take root, to be rooted.
Gwrengyn, dŷn o iſel râdd; a mean man.
Gŵrhydri, gorhydri, Gwroldeb, Calondid; Manlineſs, Stoutneſs. Animoſity.
Gwrîd; Bluſhes, Fluſhes, high Colour in the Face.
Gwringell, Aml Symmudiad; often motion or moving.
Gwringhellu. Symmudo 'n Aml; to move often.
Gwriog, priodol ſerch; a married woman.
Gŵron, gŵr campus iawn; an Hero.
Gwrtaith; dung, lime, or marle for Lands.
Gwrteithio; to dung, lime, or marle Land.
Gwrth neu gwrthwŷneb; contrary-wiſe in oppoſition.
Gwrthbwŷth, talu ynôl, dial am ddial; like for like, as evil for evil.
Gwrth-drennydd, echdoe; the day before yeſterday.
Gwrthferu, gwrthfrŷd, adferu edfrŷd, dychwelyd; dychweliad; to reſtore, to return, alſo Reſtauration.
Gwrthgrî, dadl wrthwŷnebus; a contradiction, a gain-ſaying.
Gwrthlâdd, ſefyll yn erbyn; to reſiſt.
Gwrthmin, gwrthminiog, peth a blaen camm; having a crooked or bended point.
Gwrthneu, gwrthod; to reſiſt, to reject.
Gwrthrawd, llu'r gelynion; the Army of Enemies.
Gwrthrêd, rhedeg yn ôl; a running backward, a recourſe.
Gwrthrych, gwrthrychiad, delw neu eulun: an Image, Statue or Effigies.
Gwrthryn, lleſtŷr, rhwyſtro: to reſiſt, reſiſtance.
Gwrthwyneb: againſt, contrary, adverſity, an oppoſition.
Gwrthwynebu: to be againſt, to reſiſt, to oppoſe.
Gwrthŷf, wrthŷſ: to me, by me.
Gwrychîo, codi gwrŷch fel mochŷn: to raiſe up the briſtles.
Gwrŷgio, gŵrygio. angwanegu, tyfu, cryfhau: to increaſe, to grow, to ſtrengthen.
Gwrymfeirch, treſi ceffŷl: the harneſs of a Horſe.
Gŵſt, Clefyd, dolur: a diſeaſe, a ſickneſs.
Gŵyach. mâth ar for aderyn; a certain Sea-bird.
Gŵybedydd, un yn gwybod pethau i ddyfod: one that knews things to come.
Gwŷbyddiad, tyſtiolaeth am y peth a welodd: an Eye witniſs.
Gwŷch; neat finely dreſſed brave, gallent, alſo healed or grown well.
Gwŷchder; gayneſs in attire, neatneſs, alſo valour.
Gwychr, gwychyr, hoenus, llawen, calonnog: cheerful, couragious, ſtout.
Gwŷdrol, fel gwŷdr, gwydrog: glaſly like Glaſs.
Gŵydd neu tîr gŵydd: paſture ground that has been formerly plowed.
Gŵyddfil, gŵyddlwdn, anifail gwyllt; a wild beaſt.
Gŵyddo, gadel yn dîrgŵydd: to reſt Land, or leave it unploughed.
Gŵydd neu ŵydd bluog: a Gooſe.
Gŵydd neu o flaen llygaid; preſence.
Gwŷdd i wau ynddo, a Weaver's Loome.
Gŵydd neu gweuwr, gwehydd; a weaver.
Gwyddfa; Bêdd, carfiedig waith uwch ben bêdd; a tomb, a monument.
Gwŷddgŵn, cenawon llwynog neu flaidd: young Wolfs, or Foxes.
Gŵŷl neu ddŷdd gŵŷl; a holy day, a faſt.
Gŵŷlan; a Sea Gull, or Sea Gooſe.
Gwŷlio: to watch, to expect, to wait, to beware.
Gwŷll, gwàg yſprŷd: a Hag, Goblin or Ghoſt.
Gwŷll y nos: the Dusk of the Evening.
Gwŷllon, gwâg yſprydion: walking Spirits, Goblins,
Gwyll, blodau mês: the bloſſoms of Acorns.
Gwŷll Coed, Cyſgad Coed: the ſhade or darkneſs of Trees.
Gwylltio; to grow wild, to make wild.
Gwymmon, gwmmon, llyſiau'r mòr; Sea weed, or weed.
Gŵymp, tegwedd, hawddgar, glân iawn; fair, beautiful.
Gwŷn, anlladrwydd, gofid; luſt, an itching deſire, alſo pain or trouble.
Gwŷnio, gofidio; to torment, to pain, to grieve or anguiſh.
Gwynn y llygad; the white of the Eye.
Gwyn wy; the white of an Egg.
Gwynndwn, gwynndonn, gwndwn, tir heb erioed ei aridig; laid-ground, or Land never ploughed.
Gwynfydu, cynfigennu; to envy, ſaith Dr. Dav.

Gwyniad, mâth ar byſgodyn;
a Fiſh called a Whiting.
Gwynnygiaw, tywynnu: to wax clear, to ſhine, to appear.
Gŵyran, gwair yrail cnŵd: hay the latter crop.
Gwyrain, màth ar ŵydd: a kind of Gooſe.
Gŵyrennig, bywiog, blodeuog, iraidd; lively, florid:
Gwŷrn, clefyd y pryfed, cnofa: a diſeaſe cauſed by worms, the Colick.
Gŵyros, mâth a'r bren plann: a plant called private or prime print.
Gwyryf, gwŷrf, newydd: freſh, new, whole, incorrupt.
Gŵyryng, llau ynifeiliaid; Lice or Worms that Oxen breed.
Gwyſtleidiaeth, gwyſtloraeth: a pledge or pawn.
Gwŷſtn, llacc, egwan, diffrwyth: feeble, weak.
Gwyſtno, llaccàu, diffrwytho; to grow feeble or weak.
Gŵyth, gwythawd, gwythlonedd, gwythaint. dîg: anger, wrath.

div.head: G. Y.
div.p: Gylf, gylfin, pig aderyn: the bill of a Bird.
Gylfln hîr, a Bird called a Curlew.
Gynt: of old, in times paſt.
Gyrriad: a courſe, a forcing or driving.
Gyrth, a fô wedi eu gyrru neu curo; driven, beaten.
Gyrthiaw, cornio, hyrddio; to puſh, or butt like a Ram.
Gŷſp, cynddaredd ymmhen ceffyl: a Diſeaſe in a Horſes head, the ſtaggers.

div.head: HA.
div.p: Habrſiwn, pais ddur i rytolwr: a coat of Fence, a coat of Maile.
Hacnai,) a ollynger am gyflog i bawb: a hackney.
Hadef neu haddef, machlŷd: to ſet, or go down as the Sun.
Hadl, ar ſyrthio, braenllyd, llygredig, ruinous, decayed, rotten, corrupted.
Hadlu, pydru, braenu: to wax Rotten, to decay, to ruin.
Haddef, cartref: a home or habitation.
Haeach, Hayach, agos; almoſt, well nigh.
Haeddedigaeth, haeddiant: merit, deſert, alſo demerit.
Haen, Crychni mewn wyneb, a wrinkle in the Face.
Haerllug, rhŷdaer, taer ddigwylidd: Importunate ſaucy, impudent.
Haeru, taeru, to affirm, to aſſert.
Hâfâr, branar hâf: Land followed in Summer.
Hafarch, crŷf, gwrol: Strong, Stout, Luſty.
Hâſgan, carol hâf: a Sumner-Song a May-Song.
Hafal, cyflelŷb, or un râdd; like, equal.
Hafn,) porth, llong-borth: a Haven. a Port.
Hafod, hafotŷ; a Summers-dwelling. a Dayry-Houſe.
Hafr, hŷfr: a He-Goat that is gelded.
Hagen, etto, er hyn, yn wîr: yet, nevertheleſs, truly.
Haha, da a gwnaed: well done.
Hail, gweinidogaeth ar y bwrdd: Miniſter at the Table, waiting at Table.
Heilio, (offrymmu,) hefyd gollwng diod: to offer Sacrifice, alſo to draw drink.
Haint: a Diſeaſe, an Evil. Heinus heinllyd, clwyfus: diſeaſed, ſickly.
Haint y rhianedd, blodau gwragedd, mîſ-lîf: monthly-terms.
Halawg, Halog, aflendid, anlladrwydd: defiled, polluted.
Haldian, tithio, to trot, to ſhake, to jogg.
Hanbŵyllo, ſôn, dwyn ar gôſ: to make mention, to reremember.
Handid, hanfydded, bydded: let it be.
Handoedd, hanoedd, bu, fe fu: it has been, it was.
Handyfŷdd, Hanffydd, bŷdd: it will be.
Hanfod, ſylwedd, bod: eſſence, being, to be or exiſt.
Hanes; an intelligence, an account, Hiſtory.
Hanŷw, henyw, ie, ydiw, yw: is.
Hanbŷch, hanpŷch, henffŷch, gadewch i hynnŷ fôd: let it be ſo.
Hanneru: to divide in the middle.
Hanffwyf, na bawn i: that I might be, would I was.
Hanpwyf, na bawn i: that I was.
Hanffych neu hanphych well, jechyd, rhwydd-deb: hail, health, whole.
Harddu: to adorn, to beautifie, to dreſs.
Heulo: a ſunning, or a ſetting in the Sun.
Heulrhôd, (hett,) (cap,) (perwig:) a Hat, a Cap, a Periwigg, a Bongrace.
Hawl: an action, a claim to a thing.
Hawlwr, holwr, hawlblaid, cwŷnwr: a Plaintiff.
Haŷach, yn agos, agos, almoſt, well nigh.

div.head: H. E.
div.p: Heâr, Hyâr, hawdd ei aredig: eaſy to be ploughed, arable, plain.
Heb, eb ebŷr: ſaith he, ſaid ſhe.
Hebog, gwalch: a Hawk, a Faulker.
Hebogŷdd, gwalch geidwad; a Hawkner, a Falconer.
Heboîr, hebohîr, yn ddi ymaros: ſorthwith, without delay.
Hebrwng, hebrwn: to accompany ſome part of the way.
Heddychu: to pacifie, to make peace.
Heddyw, heiddiw; to day, this day.
Hefelŷdd, Elfŷdd, tebyg, like, to be compared.
Heiniâr, heniâr, Rhagddarpar neu arlwy o ŷd: proviſion of Corn.
Heiſlan, heiſyllr, heſſyllr, Rheſŷllt: a hatchel.
Heiſlanu, rynnu trw'r heſſyle: to hatchel Flax, Hemp, or Cotton.
Helbul, adfŷd, blinfŷd: trouble, adverſity, afflictions.
Heleŷd, helgud, hela 'n aml: to hunt often.
Heledd: a Wich, or Salt pits.
Helmog, un yn gwiſgo (helm:) that wears a Helmet.
Helynt; a courſe, or condition of Life.
Henefŷdd, henŷdd, cynghorwr, hefyd (aldremon,) henuriad: a Councellor, alſo an Alderman, an Elder.
Hendref, trêſhên: an old Town or Village.
Heng, haing, taflodiad yn arwyddo bygythiad: an interjection of threatning.
Heniâr, arlwy O ŷd: a proviſion of Corn.
Heol, buarth, ffordd fawr, hwŷlfa mewn Trêf: a Street, alſo a Court before a houſe.
Heppian: to nod, ſlumber, or take a nap.
Heretic,) dŷn Cyndyn yn neilltuo oddiwrth yr yſcrythŷr a chyfraith y deyrnas: a Heretick.
Heroyd, Cyrheuddŷd: to reach, or extend.
Herlod, bachgen bychan: a little Boy, a Lad.
Herlodŷn, dŷn-bychan: an Infant, a little Boy.
Herlodes, geneth fechan: a little Girl.

Herod, Cennad neu negeſwr, Arwyddfardd: an Embaſſador,
dor, a Herald at Arms.
Herw herwa, Rhodienna, o lê i lê: to ramble, to flie from place to place.
Herwr, Rhodiannwr: a Runnagate, a Eugitive.
Herrwm, (graen lledr:) the grain of Leather.
Hêſglif, llif ddwylaw: a long or two-handed Saw.
Hêſp, hŷſp: dryed up, alſo not giving milk.
Heſpin: an Ewe-Lamb of a year old.
Heſpwrn: a He-Lamb of a year old.
Heuelŷdd, hefelydd, elfydd, tebyg: alike, equal.
Heulor, preſeb, Rheſel: a Manger, a Rack.
Heulrhod, (hett:) pŷſt yr haul: a Hat, alſo the Sun-beams.
Heuſaff, gwiſgo (bwtties:) to put on Boots.
Heuſor, bugail gwartheg: a Herdſman, a Tender of Cattle.
Heuſor môch, ceidwod moch▪ a Swine-herd, a Swine-driver.

div.head: H. I.
div.p: Hidl i hidlo: a ſtrainer, a cullender.
Hidlo: to ſtrain through a ſtrainer.
Hifio: to pluck off Wooll, to make bare.
Hifflaid, llifo neu llenwi: to flow.
Hîl, Heppil: Off-ſpring, Progeny, Lineage, Poſterity.
Hilio neu heppilio: to multiply or increaſe.
Himp, Imp: a young graff or plant.
Hiniog, Rhiniog: a Threſhold, a Sill.
Hinon, hîn dêg: fair weather, dry weather.
Hiriant, ymaros: delay, prolonging of time.
Hirio, aros, Eſtŷn yn hwŷ: to prolong, to delay, to lengthen.
Hiraeth: a longing for a thing.
Hiraethu: to long for a thing.
Hîriai, Climmach hir o ddŷn: a tall ſlim fellow.
Hirwlŷdd, llarriaidd, tyner: mild, gentle, tender.

div.head: HO.
div.p: Hobelu, Neidio: to hop or leap.
Hoccrell, geneth fechan: a little Girl.
Hoccrellwr, godinebŵr, a wnelo anlladrwŷdd: an Adulterer.
Hoeden merch yſgafn (puttain:) a light Houſwife, a Harlot.
Hoedl, Enioes: life, time of life.
Hoedli, hîr oeſi: to live long.
Hoenŷn, hwŷnŷn, Rhownŷn: the Hair of the Tail.
Hoewal, hoewel, dŵr arafedd: ſlow water.
Hoffi: to delight in, to love.
Hoffiain, hoffi: to delight in, to love.
Hogg, hoggŷn: of an indifferent bigneſs.
Hôllt: a Cleſt, a ſplit, a cragg.
Honcian, hongcian: to wag or ſtir.
Hôr, hoten, horod, llau môch: Swines Lice.
Hort, llaſhenw, hefyd bwraw bai heb achos: a nick-name, alſo a falſe accuſation.
Hortio, gwradwyddo goganu: to revile, retract or reproach.
Hott, hottan, (hetr, cap:) a Hat, a Cap.
Hoŷw, tlŵs, tecclus, treſnus: pretty, neat. well-faſhioned.

div.head: H. U.
div.p: Huelŷdd, yr hwn a lyffetheirio; he that fettereth.
Hûc, hûg, hûgan: a Cloak, alſo a covering.
Huccan, gŵylan lŵyd: a Sea Mew, Cob, or Gall.
Hûdlath, gwialen Twyllwr neu hudolwr: a Jugler's Wand or Rod.
Hûg, hugan: a Cloak, alſo a covering.
Hugl groen: a Rattle to fright Horſes, &c.
Humman, humig, hummog, (pêl denis:) a Tennis-ball.
Hûn: a ſlumber or little nap.
Hungôs, coſi drwy gŵſg: a clawing or ſcratching is a ſleep.
Huppŷnt, byrr ruthr; a brunt, a ſudden aſſault.
Hûr, cyflog: a reward, wages or hire.
Hurtr, llawr byrddau: a boarded floor.

div.head: H. W.
div.p: Hŵf, mâth ar (hwd:) a Hood, alſo a Cowle.
Hwpp, Prawf, Ymgais: an Attempt or Enterprize.
Hwrdd neu gwth: a joſtling or thruſting.
Hwrrwg: a little ſwelling, a lump.
Hwſmon: a husbandman, alſo a thriſty man.
Hwſtr, anynad, anhywaith, anhynaws: moroſe, froward.
Hoſwi: a houſewife, a thrifty woman.
Hwt, flei, i ffordd, ymaith: fie fie, away, get thee hence.
Hwy neu hwŷnr, hwynt-hwy: they, them.
Hŵŷl llong: the Sail of a Ship.
Hŵyl neu iechŷd: health, diſpoſition of body.
Hwylbren: the Maſt of a Ship.
Hwŷnŷn, hoenyn, Rhawnŷn: the hair of an Ox or Horſes tail.

div.head: HY.
div.p: Hŷar, hêar, hawdd ei aredig: eaſie to be plowed.
Hŷawdledd, ffraethder: eloquence, readineſs in ſpeaking.
Hŷbarch, Sŷdd iw berchi: to be honoured or reverenced.
Hyblŷg, hawdd ei blygu, Yſtwyth: flexible, apt to bend, tractable.
Hyborth, hawdd ei borthi: eaſie to be fed.
Hychgrug, Clefyd gwddw: a Squinzy in the Throat.
Hyd neu hyd at: even to, until.
Hydawdd, a ellir ei doddi: that may be melted.
Hydr, hŷ, gwrol: bold, ſtout, valiant.
Hydraeth, a eller ei fynegi: that my be declared.
Hydraîdd, hawdd ei drwŷddo neu dyllu: penetrable, that may be pierced.
Hydraul, hawdd ei wiſgo allan: that may be eaſily worn out.
Hydreſn, wedi ei dreſnu yn ddâ: well-order'd.
Hydŵf, un Jeuangc yn tyfu: a growing youth, or plant.
Hydwŷll, hawd ei dwyllo: apt or ſubject to be deceiv'd.
Hŷdd, carw: a Deer, a Buck.
Hyddal, hawdd ei gynnwys neu ddal: eaſie to be comprehended.
Hyddellt, hawdd ei ddelltu neu hollti: that which is eaſily ſlit or cloven.
Hyddfrê, hyddfrêf, hydref: the month October.
Hyddgan, hyddgant, carw: a Deer a Buck.
Hyddgen, croen y carw côch: the skin of a rid or fallow Deer.
Hyddaif, hawdd ei ddeifio: eaſily ſinged.
Hyddŷſg: teachable, eaſie to be taught.
Hyfaeth, hawdd ei faethu: eaſily nouriſht.
Hyfed, hawdd ei fedi: eaſie to be reaped.
Hyfriw, hawdd ei dorri, brau: eaſily broken or crummed.
Hyfrwŷn, trymder, prŷdd-der: ſadneſs, penſiveneſs, heavineſs.
Hygaredd, hawddgarwch, hefyd duwioldeb: amiableneſs, also piety.
Hygawdd, hawdd ei ddigio: eaſily offended.
Hyglyd, hawdd ei gludo: eaſie to be carried.
Hygno, hawdd ei gnoi: eaſily chewed, or chammed.
Hygôf, cofus: memorable, what we well remember.
Hygwŷmp, hawdd yw godymmu: apt to fall.
Hygŷrch, cyrchedigle, cynlleid-fawl-lê: a place much reſorted.
Hyhud, hawdd ŷw dwyllo: eaſily deceived.
Hyloſg, hawd ei loſgs: combuſtible, eaſily burned.
Hŷll: horrid, cruel, alſo ugly or ill-favoured.
Hyllu: to disfigure or make ugly.
Hylldrawu, rhoi mewn dychryn: to put in a fright, to amaze.
Hylldrem, golygiad hull: a cruel aſpect or look.
Hylldremmio, edrych yn wŷllt: to look wildly.
Hynaf, heneiddiaf: moſt antient or oldeſt.
Hynefŷdd, hênuriad: a Senator, an Elder.
Hynaws, llariaidd, gwâr: mild, tender, indulgent, meek.
Hyrddu, hyrddio: to drive in with force, to thruſt in.
Hyſôn, nchel ei ſŵn: loud, ſhrill, ringing.
Hyttŷnt, taith, rhedfa, a journey, a courſe, a race.
Hyttynt y dwfr, rhedfa'r dwfr: Water-courſe.
Hywedd, dôf, hyweth: tame, accuſtom'd to the yoke.
Hyweddu, dofi: to tame, to pacifie.
Hywerth, hawdd ei werthu: vendable, eaſie to be ſold.
Hywŷſtl, hawdd ei wŷſtlo; eaſie to be pawn'd or pledg'd.

div.head: I. A.
div.p: I: to, alſo I or me.
Iâen, ychydig iâ a little piece of Ice.
Iaccwn, arwydd Rhyfal, llumman: a warlike Enſign, a Standard.
Iâch neu iachus: ſound or healthy.
Iâd: the Temple of the head.
Iâr Orllydd, iâr yn eiſtedd ar ŵyau: a Hen that ſits on Eggs.
Iâr wŷnt, Aderyn paradwys: the Bird of Paradice.
Iâr goed, iâr wŷdd: a Pheaſant.
Iarllâeth, a perthyno i Iarll: an Earldom.
Iâs: a boiling or bubling, alſo violent cold.

div.head: ID.
div.p: Iddwf, tân iddwf: St. Anthonies fire.

div.head: IE.
div.p: Ierthi, irai: a goad to drive Oxen or Cattle with.
Ierwŷdd, iâr y mynŷdd: a Moore-hen.
Iewaint, ieuaint, ieuengtyd: youth, or youthful age.
Iewais, clywais, hefyd cefais: I heard, alſo I found, I had.

div.head: IG.
div.p: IGian: to yex or hick, the hick-cock.

div.head: IM.
div.p: IMp, Impŷn: a graff, a plant.

div.head: IN.
div.p:
Ing, ingder, cyfing, cyfyngder.
caethder, cledi: anguiſh, agony, miſery, alſo narrow, ſtrait.

div.head: IO.
div.p: Iolwch, diolwch, dyiolwch, gweddi, diolch: Thankſgiving, Prayer.
Iolwrch, gwŷdr, hefŷd Coed: Glaſs, alſo Wood.
Ior: Arglwydd, llywŷdd: the Lord, Governour.
Iorth, eorth, yſtig, yſtud, dyfal: ſtudious, diligent.

div.head: IR.
div.p: Ireiddio: to poliſh, to adorn or make ſmooth and freſh.
Irai, ire: a Goad or Rod to drive Oxen or Horſes.
Irdang, irdangc, ſyndod: aſtoniſhment, amazement, inſenſibleneſs.
Irdangu, ſynnu: to ſtupifie, to make ſenſeleſs.

div.head: IS.
div.p: Iſelu, ymoſtwng, goſtwng: to humble, to bring down.
Iſaf: the loweſt, meaneſt, or moſt baſe.
Iſamer, dygiawdr arfau, hefyd (yſgwiar:) a Squire, alſo Armour-bearer.
Iſgîl, yſgîl, wrth yſgîl: behind a Horſe-back.
Iſgilio: to ride before one on the ſame Horſe.

div.head: LA.
div.p: LAb, dyrnod: a ſtroke, a blow, a ſtripe.

div.head: LLA.
div.p: Llabi, llabwſt: a great clouterly fellow.
Llabyddio, curo a cherig: to ſtone, or beat with ſtones.
Llacc, rhŷdd, hefŷd clâf; looſe, ſlack, alſo ſickly.
Llaccâu: to ſlacken, to grow looſe, alſo to droop or decline.
Llâd (grâs,) dawn, daioni: grace, gift, benefit, goodneſs.
Lladmer, lladmerŷdd, cyfieuthŷdd, dehenglwr: an Interpreter.
Lleiddiad, lladdwr: a ſlayer, a killer.
Llaeſodr, llaeſod: litter for Cattle to lye upon.
Llafar: a vowel, alſo a voice.
Llafaru: to ſpeak, or make a noiſe.
Llafn: a blade of a knife, ſword, &c.
Llafurio; to labour, to work, to play the Husbandman, to till the ground.
Llai, lliw tywŷll-rŷdd: a Brown Colour.
Llaib, llyfiad: a licking or lapping.
Lleibio, llepian: to lick or lap.
Llaid, prîdd, tomm: clay, dirt, mud.
Llaid, clefyd ar draed ynifeiliaid: a Diſeaſe on the feet of Cattle proceeding from the dirt that flicks between their Claws.
Llain, yn lle llafn, neu cleddyf: a Sword, a Sword-blade, a blade.
Lleiſio: to ſound, to make a noiſe.
Lleithio: to grow wet or moiſt.
Llallogan, gwradwydd or tu ôl: a backbiting.
Llamſach, llammu, (downſio:) to jump, hop or skip, to dance.
Llamfachus, teſach, mylyſtod: full of leaping and dancing.
Llamdwŷo, dwŷn pêth o lê i lê: to carry a thing from place to place.
Llamhidŷdd, math ar byſgodŷn, hefyd downiwr ar Râff: a Lobſter Fiſh or Crevis, alſo a Rope-dancer.
Llamhidŷddiaeth, gwneuthuriad mynudiau i ddynwared: a geſturing, acting after as an Ape.
Llamprai, llyſywen bendoll: an Eel called a Lampril.
Llann: a Church or Temple, alſo a Church-yard, a yard.
Llannerch: a diſtinct place or piece of ground.
Llanaſtru, diſtrŷwio, chwalu: to waſt, to diſperſe.
Llarp: a rag, a renteâ piece.
Llarŷaf, llareiddiaf, addfwynaf: mildeſt, meekeſt, gentleſt.
Llaſwŷr, neu pſallwŷr: the Pſalter or Pſalms.
Llâth i (feſur) tîr neu goed: a rod, perch, or pole to meaſure Timber or Land with.
Llathen: a yard containing three foot.
Llath, llathen, llathaid, un llathen o hŷd: a yard long, or one yard in length.
Llathlud, Llathrud, trais arferched: a violent taking away of Women, alſo a Rape.
Llathru, tywynnu, diſgleirio: to ſhine, to glitter.
Llattai, un yn gwneuthyr lletteiaeth: a Pander, a Bawd, a Meſſenger between two Lovers.
Llatteirwŷdd, llatteiaeth: Rawdery, meſſages between Lovers.
Llawch, llochi: a gentle entreating or handling.
Llawd, llodig: a Sow is ſo term'd when ſhe ſeeks a Boar.
Llawdr, clôs: a pair of Breeches,
Llawdwn, llaw tan anaf: a lame or maimed hand.
Llawenu, llawenhau, llawenychu: to rejoice, to be merry.
Llawen-chwedl, newydd dâ yr Efengyl: Glad-tydings, the Goſpel.
Llawlŷw, hegl gam aradr: a plough-tail or handle.
Llawr: a floor, alſo the face of the Earth.
Llawrfaes, llannercho dîr: a plat of ground.
Llawrodd, cyflog am waith wages for work.
Llawrwŷdd, math ar bren: the Laurel-tree.
Llawrŷdd, llofrŷdd (mwrdwrwr:) a murderer, a manſlayer.
Llawruddiawg, gwaedlyd, chwanog i lâdd: bloody-handed, bloody-minded.

div.head: LLE.
div.p: Lleas, marwolaeth, hetvd lladdfa: death, alſo a flaughter.
Lleawdr, lleawr: darllenŷdd, darllenwr: a Reader.
Llêch neu bwrdd correg: a ſtone-table.
Llêch-Iafar, adlais carreg: an eccho from Rocks or Stones.
Llêch neu ymguddfa: a covert, or hiding-place.
Llechwedd: the ſide of a Hill.
Llêdu: to make wider, to grow wider.
Lledach, o genedl wael: of an ignoble Lineage or Deſcent.
Lledewigwſt, clwy'r marchogion: Hammorrhoides or Piles.
Lledfegyn, annifail a wneir o wŷllt yn ddof: any wild creature that is tamed.
Lledfrŷd, lledfrydedd, ynfy. drwydd: dotage, ſolly.
Llediaith: corrupt and defiled ſpeech barbariſm.
Lledlef gair amherffaith, an imperfect word.
Lledpai, cam, gŵŷr, anwadal. askew, awry, oblique alſo unſtable.
Lledpeio, gwaethygu, gogwyddo: to decay, to decline.
Lledpeirwŷdd, gogwyddiad, lle serth: declining, the ſteepineſs or ſhelving of a hill.
Lledpen, yſtlus y pen: the ſide of the head.
Lledrin, o ledr neu groen: of Leather, or of a Hide.
Lledrŷn: a little piece of Leather.
Lledrith, lled a rhîth: a phantaſie, hypocriſie,
Lledrithiog, yn llawn twyll a rhagrith: full of deceitful tricks.
Lledrŷw, anfoneddigeiddrwydd: baſeneſs of birth, ignobleneſs.
Lleddf, gŵŷr, ar ŵŷrni: oblique, awry, askew, warped.
Lleddfu, gŵŷro: to warp or grow crooked.
Llêf: a voice, a cry, a ſhout.
Llefain: to cry, or bawl out.
Llefair, fe a ſieryd, hefyd, ſiaradus: he will ſpeak, alſo talkative.
Craig lefair, craig yn attebleiſio: a Rock that ecchoes.
Llefais, gweŷddais allan: I cryed out.
Lleferthin, lleferthin, diog, ſwrth: lazy, ſluggiſh.
Lleferŷdd, harad: a voice, a talk.
Llefenau, llefnau, y lwŷnau: the loins.
Llefrithen, llyfrithen: a kind of a ſwelling in the Eye-lid.
Llegeſt, mâth ar byſgodŷn: a fiſh called Paurcontrell, or many feet.
Llehâu, goſod mewn llê: to place.
Lleian, un heb golli morwyndod, y neb a gedwo ei forwyndod er duwiolder, hefyd eiſtedd-fa eſgob, &c. a Veſtal Virgin, a Nun, a Virgin for Religion ſake, alſo a See, or the ſeat of a Biſhop, &c.
Lleianaeth, byw yn unig heb priodi: the ſingle life of Virgins.
Lleibio, llyfu: to lick, to lap.
Lleigiaw, diengŷd, ffoi: to fly or eſcape.
Lleigiad, un yn diſgwyl ymddiffynfa: he that looks for refuge.
Lleihâu, gwneuthur yn llai, treilio: to leſſen, to diminiſh.
Lleiſio: to make a noiſe, note or tone.
Llên, dŷſg, dyſgeidiaeth: learning, literature, diſcipline.
Gwŷr llên, gwŷr o ddŷſg, yſgolheigion: learned men, Scholars.
Llenn, hiliad uwchben, hefyd (cwrtens) a vail, alſo curtains.
Llenlliain: a Table-cloth, a fine ſheet.
Llerr: a kind of weed is Corn.
Llerw, eiddil, lleges, diccra: ſlender, weak, puny.
Llêſu, lleſhâu: to benefit, to profit, to do good.
Lleſgâu, llêſghau: to languiſh, to grow ſicker and ſicker.
Lleſmeirio: to fall into a trance, to ſwoon.
Lletpai, gŵŷr, Camm: oblique, crooked, askew, awry, warped.
Llethr, llechwedd: the ſide of a Hill.
Llethrid. mellten: a flaſh of Lightning.
Llettring, lled-dring, gris, Cam. fform Yſgol: a ſtair or ſtep, a ſtep of a Ladder.
Llettyu, lletteua: to Lodge, to Inn.
Llettywr, lletteuwr: a Gueſt, a Lodger.
Lleuer, lleufer, llefer, Goleu, Canwill: a Light, a Candle.
Lleueru, tywynnu, goleuo: to ſhine, to give light.
Lleurwŷdd, goleurwŷdd, Goleuad: Light, an Inlightning.
Llewa, bwyta neu yfed yn rheibus: to eat or drink greedily.
Llewych, llewyrch: light, brightneſs, a ſhining.
Llewŷg, lleſmair: a trance, a ſwoon.
Llewygu, lleſmeirio: to ſwoon, to fall in a trance.
Llewyr, llefŷr, goleu: a light or ſhining.
Llewŷrn, rân ellŷll: Will-with-the-wiſh, a night walking fire.
Lleŷg, y nêb na bo ŵr eglwŷ. ſig: a Lay-man.

div.head: LLI
div.p: Lliain amdo: a ſhroud or winding-ſheet.
Llios, lliaws, tyrfa, llawer, llû: a multitude, alſo many.
Llidio: to envy, to bear malice, alſo to ſmart or ache.
Llidiog: malicious, ſpitiful, alſo very ſore.
Llidiowgrwydd: envy, malice, alſo the torment in a ſore.
Llîf: a flood, a deluge, alſo a ſaw.
Llifddwr: llifeiriant: a Flood, an Inundation.
Llifeirio: to over-flow, or cover with water.
Llifo neu lliwo: to dye or colour.
Llîf ddûr: a file, a raſp.
Llifianu, llifio a llîf ddur: to file, to raſp.
Llifaid, llifed, wadi llifo neu mînlymmu: grounded or ſharpened in the edge.
Llîn neu llinnyn: a Line or Coard.
Llinell, main Linnyn: a little Line.
Llinnellu, llainio, Rhigoli: to deliniate, to draw a Line.
Llindag, llindagu, Tagu: a choaking or hanging.
Lliniaru: to wax mild or gentle.
Llinor, llinorŷn: a wheal, puſh or pimple.
Llios, llioſŷdd, llioſog, Tyrfa: a multitude.
Llippa: ſoft, limber, flagging, hanging down.
Llippau: to flag, to grow limber.
Lliprŷn: a sni • le or flagging ſhrimp.
Llîth iw darllain: a Leſſen to be read.
Llîth neu hudoliaeth: a Bait, an allurement, an enticement.
Llithio neu denu: to allure or entice.
Lîth neu fwŷd gwlŷb: a maſh of wet Victuals.
Lliwns a lliwiog: of a deep Colour.
Lliwed, Cenedl, popl, llu: a A Nation, a People; alſo an Army, a Troop, a Generation.
Lliwied, lliwio: to grudge, to upbraid.

div.head: LLO.
div.p: Llocc, Corlan: a Sheepcoat or fold.
Lloccio, gyrru i gongl neu gorlan: to drive into a corner or ſold.
Lloches: a hole to bide in, a lurking-place.
Llochi: to ſtroke gently with the hand, to intreat kindly.
Llodig, hŵch Lodig: a Sow ſeeking a Boar.
Llodr, llawdr, Clôs: a pair of Breeches.
Lloeren, lleuad fechan: a ſmall Moon.
Lloerig, gorphwyllog ar rŷw Amſer or lleuad: Lunatick, Frantick.
Llofi, dylofi: to let or draw through the hand.
Lloflen, llawf fechan: a little band.
Llofrudd, llawrudd (murdwrwr:) a murderer, a man-ſlayer.
Lloft:) a Loft or upper Room.
Llogail, Y Logail tan y bargod: the Beam that is under the Eaves of a Houſe.
Llonni: to grow merry or chearful
Llongborth, Porth y môr: a Sea-Port.
Llonyddu: to make quiet, to grow quiet.
Llorf, llyrf, (Pibau, pibellau,) offerŷn Cerdd: a Pipe or Pipes, a Flute, a Muſical-in-ſtrument.
Llorfdant, Tant offerŷn Cerdd: a ſtring of a Muſical-inſtrument.
Llorp, Crimmog, Coes: a Shin, Shank or Leg.
Lloſgach, Godineb neu aflendid anwllad-rwydd rhwng cerraint: Inceſt.
Lloſgyrnog, Cynffonog: tailed, or having a Tail.
Lloſt, yr un a gwauwffon: a Spear, a Lance, a Javelin.
Llowrydden, Llawrwydden, Llawr-wŷdd, mâth ar brenn the Laurel-Tree.
Lloweth, dòf: brought up by hand, tame.
Llowgiſt, Cîſt Law: a little hand-cheſt.
Llowion, llofion, llywion llîn neu. gywarch: the refuſe of Hemp or Flax.

div.head: LLU.
div.p: Lhuchfa: a drift or heap of Snow.
Lluchio: to fall down plentifully as Snow or Hail.
Lluwch: heaps of Snow, fleaks of Snow.
Lluchŷnt, Rhuthr diſymmwth: a moſt ſudden violence, an aſſault.
Lluddias, lluddio, lleſtair, rhwŷſtro: to hinder, to fruſtrate.
Lludſt, bŵth Bugail, a hefyd Gwerſŷll: a Shepherd's Cottage, alſo a Tent.
Llueſlu, goſod gwerſŷll: to pitch a Tent.
Llûg, goleu, hefyd y Cornwŷd: Light, alſo the Peſtilence.
Llugis, y peth a rotho oleuni: that which gives light.
Lluganu, tacclu arfan: to dreſs, amend or repair Armour.
Llugenŷdd, gwenuthurwr Arfau: a maker of Armour.
Llumman, (Baner) Milwŷr: a Standard, Banner, Enſign or Flag.
Llummanog, (Banerog:) decked with Flags or Banners.
Llumbren, Llumwydden, Troed neu ffon (Baner:) the Staff or bandle of a Flag.
Llûn: an Effigy, Figure or ſhape.
Llunio: to form, figure, or cut out.
Lluniedŷdd, lluniŵr: he that faſhioneth or cutteth out.
Lluniawd, Lluniodr, ffurf new Reol▪ a Form or Rule.
Lluniathu, darparu: to ordain or provide.
Llurig, pais ddûr, gwîſg rhyfel: a Coat of Fence, a Shirt of Mail.
Llurigawg, mewn gwîſg lluryg: armed with a Brigandine or Coat of Mail.
Lluttrod, Clai, Lludw, Lleiſw: Clay, Aſhes, Lye.
Lluttrodi, diwŷno: to ſoil, to wax dirty.
Lluŷdd, llû, Gwerſŷll, arferiad i bêth: an Army, alſo a Camp, a Tent, an Exerciſe.
Llugg, mân bryfed mewn Caws: little Worms that breed in Cheeſe.
Lluydda, Codi Rhyfel: to levy War.

div.head: LLW.
div.p: Llŵch, ſefydlŷnn, pwll: a Lake or ſtanding Water.
Llwdn, llwdwn: the Young of any thing, a Foal.
Llwfr neu llwrf, digalon: ſottiſh, heartleſs.
Llyfrhâu: to become heartleſs or ſottiſh.
Llwrw, Trêth, hefyd yn wŷſg: a Tax, alſo Forward.
Llwŷbreiddio, hwŷluſo: to direct in the way.
Llwŷbro: to walk, to make paths.
Llwŷdo: to wax gray, to make gray, to grow mouldy.
Llŵŷdd, llwŷddiant: proſperity, happineſs, good luck.
Llwŷf, llwŷfen, llwŷfanen, llwyfwŷdden: an Elm-tree.
Llwyfan Menn, llwyfan Certwŷn: the body of a Cart.
Llŵyfennau, llefanau, llyfenau, Lwŷnau: the Loins.
Llwŷgaw, diffygio, blino: to fail or be weary.
Llŵŷn o goed: a Wood or Grove.
Llwyrŵŷs, Cymmanfa Gyffredin: a common Aſſembly.

div.head: LLY.
div.p: Llychwin, wedi eu diwŷno: ſoiled, duſtied.

Llydaw, henw man yn ffraingo lle y mac Cymru yn bŷw:
Brittain in France.
Llyfenau, llwŷfenau, Lwŷnau, aelodau: the Loins.
Llyfnhâu: to make ſmooth, to plain.
Llyfrŵr: a Scrivener, a Book-writer, a Regiſter.
Llyfferthin, llefferthin, diog, llwrf: ſlothful, ſluggiſh.
Llŷg, lleŷg, pòb gŵr na bò ŵr eglwyſig: a Layman.
Llŷg, lluŷg, mân bryfed mewn Caws: Worms in Chuſe.
Llygadog, llygeidiog: full of Eyes or holes.
Llygliw, lliw tywŷll: a dusky colour.
Llŷn neu pôb math ar Ddîod a ſugn: any ſort of Drink or Liquor.
Llynn o ddŵr: a Pool of Water, a Mare of Water.
Llynn-grangc, chwarren, dyfaden wŷllt: a Wen or the like ſwelling.
Llyngcoes, Yr ymgrafu at Anifeiliaid: the Scratches or Spaven on Cattle.
Llyngŷr, llynger: the Worms in Children.
Llŷn, haint llun, Clefŷd hawdd ei Gael, Plâ, Cornwŷd: a contagious Diſeaſe, a Peſtileuce, a Plague.
Llynwyn, llynn o ddŵr: a Damm, a ſtanding Pool.
Llyrŷ neu llwrw, Trethu: to tax.
Llŷs neu dŷ Brenin: a Court, a Palace.
Llŷs. llyſiant, Gwrthodiad: a rejecting, refuſing or forſaking.
Llyſu, Gwrthod: to reject, to refuſe.
Llyſdâd, Tâd ynghyfraith: a Step-father, or Father-in-law.
Lysfab, mâb ynghyfraith: a Step-ſon or Son-in-law.
Llysfam, mam ynghyfraith: a Step-mother or Mother-in-law.
Llyſdyn, llyſdin, Dinas y Cedwir Brenhinllis ynddi: a City where a King's Court is kept.
Llŷsg, gwialen bâch: a little Rod.
Llyſgbren neu llyſbren, gwialen-ffon: a Rod or little Staff.
Llyſieua, hel llyſie: to gather Herbs.
Môr-ly-ſowen: a Conger, or a large Sea-Eel.
Llythi, pyſgod môr: a kind of Sea-Fiſh.
Llŷthr, llythŷr: a Letter, an Epiſtle.
Llythyr Cymmyn: the laſt Will and Teſtament.
Llyu, llyfu: to lick or lap.
Llŷw llong, durŷn llong: the Stern of a Ship.
Llyw neu llywŷdd: a Ruler, a Governour.
Llywiawdr, Rheolŵr: a Ruler, a Governour.
Llyw neu lluniaeth: food, ſubſiſtance, neceſſaries.
Llywio neu llywodraethu: to Rule, to Govern.
Llywio neu bryſuro: to hurry or rid away.
Llywio neu guro: to beat haſtily.
Llywodraeth: Rule, Government, alſo good ordering of matters.
Llywŷ, têg, gwŷn, diſglaer: fair, white, ſplendid.

div.head: MA.
div.p: Maban, Baban: a little Child, an Infant.
Mabolaeth, mebŷd, maboed Ifangc: infancy, childiſhneſs, youth.
Mab aillt, Caeth-wâs: a Captive, a Bondman.
Mabwŷs, Mabwyſiad, Mabgynwŷs, Cymerŷd eſtron yn fàb: Adoption.
Mabcaingc, Caingc, Cangen: a Bough, a Branch.
Mabddŷſg, yr hyn a ddyſog dŷn ôi Grŷd: that which one learns from his Cradle.
Mâblygad, Canwŷll y llygad: the Pupil or Apple of the Eye.
Mabddall, un a aned yn ddall: one that is born blind.
Mabcath, Câth bâch: a Catling oy young Cat.
Mabcorn, Mepcŷrn: the inward part of a Horn.
Mabſant, ſaint perthynol i blwŷf: a Saint proper to a Pariſh.
Maccaid, prŷf a elwir Mîldroed: a Palmer-worm.
Machdeŷrn, pen llywŷdd: a Monarch, an Emperour.
Maccrell, pyſgodyn mwŷ na phenhwŷgŷn: a Mackrel.
Y fâd felen, ſarph wenwŷnllud iawn: a Baſilisk, a Cockatrice.
Madarch, Madarchen, bwŷd y llyllon: a Muſhroom or Toad-ſteel.
Madien, madiain, urddas: honour, honoured, alſo good, bountiful.
Madrondod, medrondod, mydrondod, madryndod, hurtni, ſyndod: giddineſs, aſtoniſhment.
Madruddŷn, Modruddŷn: a Cartilage, a Griſtle.
Madruddyn y Cefn: the Marow of the back.
Madwŷs, madws: compleat time, fulneſs of time.
Maddeu: to leave, to forſake, to ſpare, alſo to forgive, to pardon.
I mae: there is, there be, there are.
Maelio, enill ar beth: to gain or make profit.
Maelier, (Marſiandwr,) ynnillwr: a Merchant, a gainer.
Mael, Malen, dur, haiarn: Steel, Iron.
Maen blîf, (bŵlet, Bowl:) a Bullet, a Bowl.
Maen Clais, Maen mynor, Carreg nâdd frîth wenlas: a Marble-ſtone.
Maen Ehed, nen Ehedfaen, Carreg a dŷn atti: a Load-ſtone.
Maen gwnn, (bwlet:) a Leaden Plummet with Iron Pikes.
Maen Cawod, pellen mellten: a Thunder-bolt.
Maenol, maenor, Trêfrad, Arglwyddiaeth, Tyddŷn: a Poſſeſſion or Inheritance, a Manner or Farm.
Maenglawdd, Clodfa gerrig: a Quarry of Stones, a Stone-wall.
Maer y Biſwail Hafodŵr: a Dairy-Man.
Maeres, Maerones, Maerwraig, hafodwraig, llaeth-wraig: a Dairy-Woman.
Maerdŷ, Hafodty: a Summerhabitation to make Cheeſe and Butter.
Maeſa, ymladd, rhyfela: to fight, to make War.
Maethgen, maeddu, Baergen, Curo: a beating.
Magiaid, Maccaid, prŷfed a elwir mîl-droed: a Palmerworm.
Magl, mann dû, neu (blottŷn) Nôd i adnabod peth wrtho: a blot or blur.
Magnel, mangnel, offerŷn i ddiniſtrio Caerau Trefydd, &c. an Engine to batter down Walls.
Magu: to bring up, to nurſe up, to breed.
Magwŷ, yr hwn a fagwyd: what, which is nouriſhed.
Magŵŷr: a Row, the Cuts of Hay in Reeks or Stacks.
Maint: quantity, the bigneſs of a thing.
Mal, fal neu fel: as, even as.
Mâl, darn o arian: a piece of Money.
Mâl, neu mâlu: a grinding at Mill.
Malc, grwnn o dîr, hefyd hŵch: A Ridge of Ground, two Furrows, alſo a Sow.
Malu: to grind in a Mill.
Malur, Maluria, Malurio, prîdd y wâl: Hills caſt up by Earth-Moles.
Malurio, neu wiſgo allan: to wear, waſte or conſume.
Mall haint, triſtwch, helbul: ſorrow, heavineſs, vexation.
Mam, mammog, wâth ar glŵŷf: a Diſeaſe called the Mother.
Mammog neu dafad gyfeb: an Ewe with young.
Mamŵŷdd, hên ŵŷd: an old Gooſe.
Mamŵŷs, lleſtr Plant: the Mother or Matrice in a Woman, alſo Motherhood.
Manŷd: little ſmall Grains of Corn.
Mann, llê: a place, alſo a Note or Mark.
Mannu, gwneuthur Argraffiad neu Nod: to make an impreſſion.
Mann geni: a Mole on the body.
Mannad, Agalen o ymenyn: a Print of Butter.
Manach, Mynach, gŵr yn bŷw yn neilltuol er mwŷn duwioldeb: a Monk.
Manaches, dyneſs yn bŷw yn unig ag yn neilltuol er duwioldeb: a Nun.
Mângant, mân-gann, peillied gwŷn: white or fine Flower.
Mangnel, offerŷn Rhyfel i ddryllio gwalie: a Ramm, or War-like Engine to batter down Walls.
Mangre, Pentre: a place, a poor little Village.
Manon neu Banon, Brenhines: a Queen.
Manrhed, Rhiain: a Maid or Virgin.
Manſon, grwgnach: a murmuring, to murmure.
Mantawl, mantol, Clorian:) Scales or Ballance.
Mantell diod: the Mantle of Drink.
Manwŷaidd, manwêaidd manweidd, dyſgedig, doeth, Cyfrwys, hefyd Tenneu, main: ſubtle, alſo fine, ſmall.
Manwl, manol, dyfal, gofalus: diligent, careful.
Maran, gleiſiad, hefyd Maccrell: a Salmon, alſo a Mackrel.
Marchoges, merch yn marchogaeth: a Woman riding on Horſe-back.
Marchawglu, llu o wŷr meirch: a Troop of Horſe.
Marchgen, Croen Ceffŷl: a Horſe's-Skin or Hide.
Marchnatta: to merchandiſe, to buy, ſell, a Chapman in a Market.
Mars, Terfynau gwlâd: Marches or Borders of a Country.
Marw: to die or depart life.
Marwddŷdd, Dŷdd barn am glefŷd: a Critical day.
Marwfîs, mis marwol: a dead month.
Marwolaethu, marwhau, llâdd, marw: to kill, to mortifie, alſo to die.
Marwerŷdd, môrwerŷdd, môr y werddon: the Iriſh-Seas.
Marwdonn, mardwn croen pen: the Scurf of the Head, Dandroff.
Marwnad, neu Cywŷdd marnad: an Epitaph, an Elegy.
Maſnach, prynu a gwerthu: to merchandiſe, chapmanſhip.
Maſwedd neu eſmwŷth: ſoftneſs or ſmoothneſs.
Mattras:) a Matreſs, a Flaggmatt, a Bed-matt.
Mau, yr elddo fi: mine, my.
Mawr bŷd, mawr Jawn: very great or large.
Mawredigrwŷdd, gwroldeb, Calondid: valiantneſs of heart, magnanimity.
Mawreddog, uchel o râdd: great, noble, honourable.
Mawrfrydig, mawrfrydus, hŷ, wynebuchel: ſtout-hearted, magnanimous.
Mawrwrieth, gwaſgwchder, Coegni: greatneſs of mind, magnanimity.

div.head: ME.
div.p: Medel, llu o fedelwŷr: a company of Reapers.
Medr neu medriff: he can, he knoweth how.
Medru, medryd: to underſtand how to do a thing.
Medrus, o ddâ ymddygiad: mannerly, well accompliſhed.
Medwaledd, modwaledd, mydwaledd, Fraethder, hefyd Jaith: Eloquence, alſo Language.
Mêdd: Mead or Drink made of Honey.
Meddu: to poſſeſs, to enjoy, to own.
Mêddwr, meddianwr: a Poſſeſſor or Owner.
Meddwi: to make drunk, to be drunk.
Meddwl: a mind, thought or intention.
Meddylio, meddyliaid: to think, to ſuppoſe, to mind.
Meddyginiaethu: to heal by Chyrurgery, alſo to play the Chyrurgeon.
Meddyglynn, Metheglŷn: a kind of drink made of Wort, Spices and Honey.
Megidŷdd, un yn magu: a Nouriſher, a Feeder, a Nurſer.
Megis, megŷs, meis: as, even as, as it were.
Mehin: the Fat properly of Bacon or Pork.
Mehinawr, llawn mehin neu fraſder: Fat, full of Fatneſs.
Meichiad, un yn Cadw môch: a Swineherd.
Meidrol, diwedd, gorffen, cyfamod: finite, limited, determined, finiſhed, ended.
Anfeidrol, diddarfodedig, hefŷd di Rîfedig: infinite.
Meigrŷn, dolur mewn pen: the Meagrim.
Meilierŷdd, melierŷdd, hedŷdd neu Ehedŷdd: a Lark.
Meilwn, meinedd coes: the ſmall of the Leg.
Meiri, mwŷnâg un maer: Rulers, Mayors.
Mêis, megis: even as, as it were.
Meiſgyn, gwŷfyn, prŷf a fwytu ddillad: a Moth.
Meithrin: to nouriſh, to bring up, to nurſe.
Meitŷn, mitŷn, (mynud) o amſer: a Minute of Time.
Meiwyr, arfogion, gwŷr arfog: Armed Men.
Melerth, y gibws: a Kibe on the Heel, or Chilblane on the Hand.
Melgorn, melgrange, crachdardd pen: a ſcald in the Head.
Meilina, cerdotta o felin i felin: to beg from Mill to Mill.
Melrŷrch, y gibws: a Kibe or Chilblane.
Melynwŷ: the yolk of an Egg.
Meneſtr, profwr gwîn, yfwr gwîn: a Wine-Taſter, a Wine-Bibber.
Menybr, carn, troed neu ddwrn arf: the Hilt, Haft or Handle of a Weapon.
Merion: the beſt or innermoſt Marrow.
Merinwr, moriwr: a Mariter, a Seaman.
Merch: a Daughter, alſo a Woman.
Merlŷs, mâth ar lyſieuŷn yn tyfu yn y dwfr: an Herb growing in the water.
Merllŷnn, dwr ſafedig: a ſtanding Lake or Pool.
Merwerŷdd, Rhuad y môr: the great noiſe or raging of the Sea.
Merwin, merwindod: a ſmart in the Fingers end occaſioned by a violent Cold.
Merwino: to ache or ſmart violently.
Merŷdd, Anifail tew: a fatted Beaſt.
Mêrddrain, drain a dyfo ar Lan dwfr: Thorns growing by the Water ſide.
Meryw, mâth ar bren: the Juniper-tree.
Meſyrŷd, llawnder o fês: Plenty of Acorns.
Meſtig, maſtig, gwlêdd: a Feaſt or Banquet.
Mettelus: what is good Metal, alſo metalſome.
Methl, magliad, twŷll: an enſnaring, a deceiving.
Methlu, maglu, twyllo: to intangle, to deceive.
Methu: to decay, to fail, alſo to periſh.
Methineb, methiantrwydd: a defect, a decay.
Meu, mau, fy eiddo i: my, mine.
Meudwŷ, gŵr unig crefŷddol: a Hermit.
Mewian: to cry like a Cat.

div.head: MI.
div.p: Miccws, ffroen, neu gafn piſtil: the cock of a ſpout, or waterpipe.
Milŷn, anifel bychan: a little Beaſt.
Mileinio: to wax ſtubborn or obſtinate.
Milldir ffreinig, Tair milldir ſeiſnig: a League.
Minws, mîndene: a little Lip or thin Lip.
Minial, ſymmud y gwefuſau: to move ones Lips.
Mingammu: to make a wry Mouth.
Miod, Bara miod, Teiſenau Tênneuon o fara (offrwm:) thin Cakes of Bread made formerly for Offerings.
Miſglwŷf, haint y Rhianod: the monthly Terms or Flowers of Women.
Miſwrn, Cyſgod dros wyneb: a Veil over the face.

div.head: MO.
div.p: Mochyria, hychian fal hŵch: to grunt as a Sow.
Mochdyn, Gwyfyn, prŷf a fwŷrû ddillad: a Moth.
Modrwŷog: Ringed or duked with Rings.
Modruddyn y Cefn: the Marrow of the Back.
Modur, Brenin, llywydd: a King, a Ruler.
Môdd: a manner, form or faſhion.
Moeldês, gwrês yr haul: the Heat of the Sun.
Moelrhon, môrhwch, mâth ar byſgodŷn: a Sea-Fiſh called a Porpoiſe.
Moes neu dôd i mi: do thou give me.
Mogelŷd, Ymogelŷd, gochelŷd: to beware, to take heed.
Môl llygaid: the white ſcurf of the Eyes.
Moli llyged, to gather ſcurf in Eyes.
Molach, Clôd, mawl: Praiſe or Commendation.
Moled, lliain pen: a Linnen-Hood, Veil or Cover for the Head.
Moleſtu, Aflonyddu: to vex, to trouble.
Monochen, (pwdingen) hallt: the ſmall Gut or Chitterling ſalted.
Monni, ſorri: to be angry or diſpleaſed.
Monnŷn, cyndyn, pendew, gwrthnŷſig: moroſe, froward.
Gwelwch mor drŷgarog iw duw: ſee how merciful is God.
Môr tawch, y Cefn-fôr: the main Sea, the Ocean.
Mor-rudd neu morudd, y môr côch: the Red Sea.
Morad, môr-rad, Ardreth blynyddawl oddiar y môr: Cuſtoms or yearly Revenues by Sea.
Môrben, brŷn a ſò a'i gornel yn y môr: a Hill lying out as an Elbow of Land in the Sea.
Mor câth, pyſgodŷn môr: a Fiſh called a Ray, Sknit or Skate
Mordeiff, mordeat, moriŵr: a Seaman or Mariner.
Môrdrai: the Ebbing of the Sea.
Mordwy, Rhuad y môr: the noiſe or raging of the Sea.
Mordwyo, morio, (hwŷlio) llong: to ſail a Ship.
Moreb, (porth,) y môr: a Port or Heaven.
Môr-rŷd, caingc o fôr, traeth: an Arm of the Sea, a Channel or Ditch.

Morfa: a Moor or finniſh place
which the Sea over-flows.
Morfil: a Sea Monſter, a Whale, Job 7. 12.
Môrgerwŷn, llyngclŷnn: a Gulph in the Sea.
Morgyllell, mâth ar byſgodyn: a Sea Cut or Cuttle-fiſh.
Morthwylio: to hammer, to beat with a Hammer.
Môr-wennol: a Martinet, the ſecond kind of Swallows.
Môrwerŷdd, môr y werddon: the Iriſh Sea.
Morwŷſiaid, clŷch y dwfr: bubbles of water.
Motlai, mwttlai, o amrŷw Liwiau: of divers Colours.

div.head: MU.
div.p: MU, (meſur) yn Cynwys chwarter (Tunnell:) a certain Meaſure containing the fourth part of a Tun.
Muchudd, Carreg ddu: the Stone called Jeat.
Mûd neu gludiad: the carriage of houſhold-goods upon removing from one houſe or place to another.
Mudo: to remove or carry houſe-hold-goods.
Mûl, gŵyl, anu, gwirion: baſhful, modeſt, ſimple.
Mûl neu anifail a'i naturiacth rhwng Ceſtŷl ac Aſlŷn: a Mule.
Mulfran: a little Diver or Didapper, alſo a Cormorant.
Muner Tywŷſog: a Prince, a Lord.
Munud, munudyn, amnaid: a Nod or Beck.
Munud awr: a Minute of an Hour.
Muriwr: a Wall-builder, a Brick-layer, a Maſon.
Murddŷn: the Ruines of any old Building.
Murn, Cyfrſang, Cudd, (mwrdwr) Cuddiedig: a hidden Murder.

div.head: MW.
div.p: Mŵd, Crîb tŷ, Cronglwyd: the Roof of a Houſe.
Mwdwl: a Cock or Stack of Hay, &c.
Mwdylu: to make a Cock or Stack.
Mygu neu attal anadl: to ſtop the Breath, ſtifle or ſmother.
Mwgdarth, mygydarth, mygdarth, Angar, Tarth, niwl: a Vapor, Smoak, a Fog.
Mŵn, Cran, hefyd maneg: a a Glove, alſo the Eye of a Needle, &c.
Mŵn: any ſort of Metal that is digged, Mine of Metal.
Mwng: the Mane of a Horſe.
Mwngial, grwgnach: to mutter, to murmur, to ſpeak through the Teeth.
Mwnwgl, gwddwf: a Neck or Throat.
Mwnwgl y troad: the Inſtep of the Foot.
Mŵs, drewllŷd: ſtinking, ramiſh, goatiſh, rank.
Mŵth y rhŷdd, Diſymmwth: immediately, out of hand.
Mwtlai, o amrŷw Liwiau: of divers Colours.
Mwyhau: to increaſe, to make greater.
Mŵŷd: moiſtening, or ſteeping in Water.
Mwydo: to moiſten or ſteep in Water.
Mwŷdion, mwŷddionŷn: the pith or heart of Herbs or Shrubs.
Mwŷglo: to grow warm or hot.
Mwŷn, mŵn: any Metal that is digged out of the Earth, a Mineral.
Mwŷs neu amwŷs, amheuŷs, gair dau dewll: doubtful, equivocate.
Mŵŷs, Rhŷw fâth ar leſtr, hefyd Rhŷw (feſur:) a certain Veſſel, alſo a kind of meaſure.
Mwys bara, (baſged i gario) neu i gadw bara: a Basket to keep or carry Bread In.

div.head: MY.
div.p: MYchdeŷrn, (Emprwr,) llywŷd: a Monarch or Emperor.
Mydwaledd, Cymhendod, doethder, Jaith: Eloquence, alſo a Speech or Language.
Mygr, hardd, hyfrŷdd, Tegwiadd: fair, ſplendid, beautiful.
Mygu: to ſmoak, alſo to flifle or ſmother to death.
Mygŷdarth, Mygdarth, mŵg Tarth, niwl, angar: a Vapor or Smoak, a Fog.
Mymrŷn: the leaſt that may be.
Myn: an Adverb, of ſwearing, by.
Mynag, adroddiad, mynegiad, Cyhoeddiad: a Narration, a Report of a thing.
Mynegai, dangoſwr, dangoſeg: he that declareth or reporteth, alſo an Index.
Mynagfŷs, Bŷs yr uwd: the Fore-finger.
Mynawg, mwŷn, llednais: courteous, generous, mild.
Mynawgrwŷdd, mynogi, mwŷnder: courteouſneſs, generoſity, mildneſs.
Mynci: a Horſe-Collar made of Wood.
Myneſtr, Meneſtr, llymeitiwr gwîn: a Wine-taſter or Bibber.
Myngus, dywedyd Trwŷ'r trwŷn: ſpeaking through the Noſe.
Myngial, mwngial, mwmlian: to ſpeak through the Teeth or Noſe, to mutter.
Mynnu: to be willing, alſo to ſeek, to have or get a thing.
Mynwair, Myngwair, Mynwaur: a Horſes Collar made of Hay, Straw, Leather or Linnen.
Mynyglog, Clefŷd gwddw: a Diſeaſe in the Throat called the Quinzy.
Mŷr, mor, hefŷd morgrugun: Sea, alſo Ant or Piſmire.
Myrŷdd, merŷdd, ynifail tew: a fat Beaſt.
Myſgu, dattod, gillwng: to unbind, to looſe.
Myſſaing, ſathru, mathru: to tread or trample upon.
Myſtrŷch, mîſ-ddrŷch, bloder merched, hefyd un o un mîs o oedran: the monthly Terms or Flowers, alſo of a month old.
Mylwŷnog: a Cow that gives no Milk.

div.head: NA.
div.p: NA, nac: not, neither, no, than.
Nâd: a noiſe, a ſound, a cry.
Nadu: to make a noiſe, to cry.
Maddu, naddial: to cut, hew or chop.
Nag ê: no, not, neither, in no wiſe.
Mâg, nagca, maccâd: a denial, a refuſal.
Negŷdd, negŷf, yr hwn a wado, neu a wrthodo: a Denyer, a Refuſer.
Negyddiaeth, negyfaeth, gwrthodiad, naccâd: a denial, a refuſal.
Naill: other one or the other.
Nam, bai, Camwedd: a fault, a ſin.
Namyn, namn, onid, oddigerth: unleſs, except, wanting but.
Nannaill, nid yr un orddau: neither.
Nawais, Naw o weiſion: nine male Servants.
Nawd neu nâd: a cry, a noiſe.

div.head: NE.
div.p: Nêb, nebawd: no body, alſo any body.
Neblech, nid yn unlle: no where.
Nebun, rhywun: ſome one, a certain one.
Neddai, neddŷf, neddu: a crooked Hatchet.
Negŷdd, negŷf, negŷfaeth: gwadwr, yr hwn a wado: a Denier.
Neidr y dŵr: a Water ſnake.
Neifion, môr a dŵr: Seas and Waters.
Neithiwŷr, neithiwr: laſt night, yeſterday in the evening.
Nenn: the Roof of an Houſe.
Nenbren: the uppermoſt Beam in a Roof.
Neodr, nid yr un o'r ddau: neither.
Neſſu, neſſâu: to draw near, to approach.
Neued, neuedd, neufedd, hiraeth: a longing or earneſt deſire.
Neuo, hiraethu: to long, to covet, to deſire earneſtly.

div.head: NI.
div.p: Midr, nidri, attal, Rhwyſtr: intangling, hindering.
Nidro, Rhwŷſtro: to intangle, to incumber.
Nifwl, Niwl: a Fog, a Miſt.
Nigus, crŷch, crychog, ffrwmpiedig: wrinkled, crumpled, rivled.
Nithlen, Cynfas nithio: a Fan or Sheet to winnow Corn with.
Niwlen, niwl: a Miſt or Fog.

div.head: NO.
div.p: Nodd, ſugŷn coed neu Lyſiau: the Sap or Juice of Trees or Herbs.
Noddi, ymddiffŷn, gwared: to protect, or defend.

Noddfa, nawddlê, ymddffynle:
a Refuge, a Sanctuary.
Noethi: to make bare or naked.
Nôs-ŵŷl: the Eve of a Feaſt.
Noſwŷlio: to leave work for that day, alſo to keep the Eve of a Feaſt.

div.head: NW.
div.p: NWŷf: vigour, luſtineſs, wantonneſs, luſt, amour.

div.head: NY.
div.p: Nŷch, nychdod: Conſumption, languiſhing, pining away.
Nychu: to pine away, to languiſh.

div.head: OB.
div.p: Obediw, perthŷnaſau Claddedigaeth: Funeral Rites and Ceremonies.
Ober, gober, gwober, Cyflog: a Reward.
Obleid, oblegid: for, becauſe, becauſe of.
Obrŷ, draw: below, underneath, alſo there, at a diſtance.

div.head: OC. OCH.
div.p: Ochr: an Edge or Rim of any thing, alſo the ſide of a Hill.
Ochri: to make a Rim or Edge.

div.head: OD.
div.p: Odli, Cyſoni, Cŷdleiſio: to ſound alike.
Oddf, oddfyn, hwrtwg, hefŷd ſiobŷn: a Wheal or Pimple, a Bunch.

div.head: OE.
div.p: Oerchwedl, drŵg newŷdd: an ill news.
Oeri: to grow cold, to cool.
Oes neu ydiw: there is, alſo is there.
Oes neu enioes: an Age or term of life.
Oeſŷdd, oeſwr, henawgŵr: an Antient man.

div.head: OF.
div.p: Ofera: to be idle, to follow vanity.
Oferddŷn, oferwr: an idle drunken ſottiſh fellow.
Oferwaith: a vain work, labour in vain.
Ofregedd: playing the fool, acting as a Child.
Ofynag, Gofynag, dymmŷno bôd, ewillyſio bôd: a deſire or wiſh.
Offeren, gwaſanaeth yr Eglwys: a Maſs, the Service of the Church.
Offeru: to make Inſtruments, to furniſh with Inſtruments.
Offrwm) an Oblation or Sacrifice, an Offering.

div.head: OG.
div.p: Ogawr, gogawr, ŷd neu wair addfedd a pharod iw dori: ſtanding Corn or Hay &c. ripe and ready for cutting.
Ogfaen, ogfaenen, Grawn y drain gwŷnion: the Berries of white Thorns.

div.head: OI.
div.p: OI, oian, (o brâf:) beiday, well done.

div.head: OL.
div.p: ôl: the pit or impreſſion of any thing laid on.
ôl Traed: the tract or impreſſion of the feet.
Olaf: hindmoſt or laſt of all.
Olewŷdden, math ar bren: the Olive Branch or Tree.
Olrhain: to ſeek out as a Hound doth, to follow or purſue the Tracks.
Olrhewr, Olrhenŷdd, olrhenwr: a diligent Searcher or Seeker out, one that follows the Tracks.
Olwŷnn, agos i wŷn: almoſt white, ſhort of white.

div.head: ON.
div.p: O honŷnt: from them, of them, out of them.
Ongl, Congl. an Angle or Corner.
Ongŷr, paſtwn, Troſtan, ffon fawr bigog: a Spear.
Onid, ond: unleſs, but, if not.

div.head: OR.
div.p: ôr, brô: a Coaſt or Border.
Orgraph, y Gelfyddŷd o yſgrifenu yn gywir: Orthography.
Oriau, nâd, gwaedd, Trŵſt: clamours, alſo hours.
Orian, oriain, goriain, mynŷch weiddi: to cry often.
Orig, awr fach: a ſhort hour
Orlludd, y Cŷw yn yr wŷ: the Chick in the Egge.
Orneſt, ymladd rhwng dan: a Duel or Fight between two.
Orſin, bache drŵs neu Lidiatt: the Hinge of a Door or Gate.
Orun, gorun, uwch, amgenach: ſuperiour, higher.
Oſb, llu, hefyd llettenwr: an Hoaſt, alſo a Gueſt or Lodger.
Oſbion, yſb, llettuwr, gweſtwr: a Gueſt.
Oſbarth, Doſbarth, gwahan, chwâl: diſtinction, diviſion.
Oſeb, Rhôdd i dduwiol ddeunydd: a Gift properly given to Holy Vſe.
Oſgedd, Goſgedd, Trefn, harddwch: from, ſemblance, favour.
Oſgl, Cangen. deilen: a Bough, alſo the Leaf of a Tree.
Oſglog, Canghenog, deiliog: full of Leafs or Boughs.
Oſgoi: to go afide, to withdraw.
Osgŷd, Oſged, Oſgud, nou, phîol, Cawg: a Baſon or Bowl.
Oſôn, Goſon, ſŵn bychan: a little ſound.

div.head: OW.
div.p: OW! a doleful word, alas! woe is me!

div.head: PA.
div.p: Pabaeth pabyddiaeth: the Papacy or Popes Dignity.
Pabell, (caban) o liain ar bolion: a Tent or Pavilion.
Paidio, peidio: to ceaſe, to leave off.
Paill, peillio: to flower or ſiſt Meal.
Pais: a Petticoat, alſo a Doublet.
Paiſg, pesgift: he ſhall or will feed.
Paith, peithiawg, anrhaith, gwall, iwŷn: deſerted, ſpoiled, waſted, deſtroyed.
Pâl, rhaw: a Spade, a Shovel.
Palu: to dig up Earth with a Spade.
Paladr, padal, cŷff o bren, bonŷn llyſieuŷn, pŷſt yr haul: a Spear, ſtaff, alſo the Trunk of a Tree, alſo the ſtalk of a Flower, alſo the Sun-beam.
Paledrŷdd, un a wnelo ſaethau: a Fletcher.

Palalwŷ, palawŷſ, math ar
bren: a Linden or Teil-tree.
Palas.) lius brennin: a King's Court, a Pallace.
Palf, cledr llaw: the palm of the hand.
Palfod, dyrnod a chledr llaw: a ſtroke with an open hand.
Palfu, palfalu, teimlo tan ddwlo: to handle gently, to ſtroke, to feel with the hand.
Palffrai. tŷ têg, plaſdŷ, a Palfrey or ſtately Houſe.
Pali, fidan, lliain main: Silk, or very fine Linnen-cloth.
Palmidwŷdd, palmwŷdd, math ar goed: Palm-trees.
Palmwydden, palmidwydden, math ar bren: a Palm-tree.
Palu: to dig the Earth with a Spade.
Pall, llygredigaeth: lack, failing, defect, an Eclipſe.
Pan neu pa amſer: when, what time.
Pann brethŷn: a Fulling of Cloth.
Pannu, pannylu: to be made lower, to dent, to indent.
Pannwl: a lower ground, a hollowneſs or bottom.
Pannylu: to be made lower or hollower.
Pâr, ffon hîr, paſtwn: a Spear, a Lance.
Pâr, dau gymar: a pair or couple.
Parhâu: to perſevere, to laſt and endure.
Paradwys: lle difyrrwch: a Paradice, a place of Pleaſure.
Parag: rhag pabeth: becauſe of what.
Pared: a Wall of an Houſe.
Parwyden: a Wall, alſo the thin Flank.
Parotoi: to prepare, to make ready.

Parri, llu o ddefaid neu o enifeiliaid:
a Flock, a Herd.
Parth, parthed, parthred, perthrŷd, rhan: a part.
Parth a, parth ar, tua: towards.
Parthu, rhannu: to divide or part.
Parſel, nôd i ſaethu atto: a mark to ſhoot Arrows at.
Pâs, peſwch: a Chin cough, a Cough.
Pâſg, bwŷd peſgi: the food for fattening of Cattle.
Paſgwch, llwdnhwch tew: a fat Hog or Swine.
Pathew, math ar lygoden: a Dormouſe.
Pauo, peuo, torri yn fŷr: to break ſhort, to aſpire to.
Pawl: a ſtake, poſt or prop, alſo a pile.
Polioni: to ſit ſtakes or piles in the ground.
Pawen: a Hand, alſo the Paw or Foot of a Beaſt.
Pawr, pori: the feeding of Cattle.

div.head: PE.
div.p: Pebŷll, bythau o liain ar bolion: Tents, Pavilions.
Pebylliaw, goſod pebbŷll, lluedda: to Encamp, to pitch Tents.
Pedeſtr, peddeſtr, gŵr traed: a Footman.
Pedeſtrig, peddeſtrig, a berthyno i ŵr traed, hefŷd, myned neu rodio: belonging to a Footman, alſo a going or walking.
Pedrain, cluniau: the Buttocks or Hanches.
Pedrogl, pedrongl, pedwar cornelog: having four Angles or Corners, a Quadrate.
Pedryael, brô, godre gwlàd, ochor, ymmul, mîn: a Coaſt, or Borders, a Ridge, an Edge.
Pedryſal. petrual, pedwar ochrog, pedwar cornelog: a ſquare Valley, any thing that is four-ſquare.
Pedryfan, pedryfannoedd bŷd, pedwar rhan bŷd: the four parts of the World.
Pedryging, y tû mewn ir llaw, cleder y llaw: the Palm or Inner part of the Hand.
Pedrylaw, hylaw, deheuig, (ſgwâr:) handy, dexterous, ſquare.
Pedryollt, pedwar hôllt, pedair dellten: cleft or ſplit into four parts.
Pefr, (pur,) têg, gwŷch: fine, fair, pure.
Pefredd, tegwch, glendid, harddwch: Fairneſs, Beauty, Elegancy.
Pefychu, caeth anadlu: to breath ſhort, to aſpire.
Pefŷr, cyfarth fel cî neu lwynog: to bark, yelp or cry like a Dog or Fox.
