Peidio: to ceaſe, to leave off, to deſiſt.
Peillio, to ſift the Flower out of Meal.
Peinioel, bara peinioel, bara ammŷd, bara gwenith trwyddo: Houſhold-Bread made of Wheat.
Peiriane, offerŷn, (organ:) an Inſtrument, an Organ.
Peithŷn, peithynen, yſglatas: a Slate or Tyle.
Peithŷn y gwŷdd: the Weaver's Reed.
Pelen, pêl fechan: a little Ball.
Pelgip, yſgrafell i daro pêl: a Battle-door, a Racket.
Pelŷdr yr haul, pŷſt yr haul: the Beams of the Sun.
Pellder: long diſtance of place, length of time.
Pellennigrŵydd, pellter: long diſtance of place.
Pellhâu: to remove afar off, to prolong.
Pellen: a bottom of Yarn, a Clew, a Ball, a Pill.
Pen yn erfid, ymryfuſedd, anghydfod: contention.
Pennarth, pennardd, brŷn a'i gornel yn y môr: a Promontory.
Penbleth: with plaited Hair or Head.
Pen oenedl: the top of the Kin.
Penci, pyſgodŷn môr, môr gî: a Dog-fiſh.
Penciwdod, (duwe, capten,) ſwŷddog (ledio:) a Captain, a General of an Army, a Leader, a Duke.
Penclwm, carn arf: a Hilt, Haft or Handle.
Pencnaw, pencno, clymiad yr eſgŷrn, gîe'r cymmalan: the Joynts of the Bones, where they are joined together with Sinews.
Pencnud, twyſwr bleiddied: the leader of Wolves.
Pency feiſtedd, ucha eiſteddfa: the Chief Seat or Palace.
Pendefig: a Prince, Primate or Noble-man.
Pendodi, goſodiad wrth, rhoddiad at: added or join'd to.
Pendoll, pendyllog: having a Head full of holes.
Pendro: Giddineſs or Dizzineſs in the Heads of Beaſts, which cauſe 'em to whirle, rowl and turn round.
Penddar, penddaredd, clefŷd pen: a Diſeaſe which cauſes a ſwimming of the Head with a kind of miſtineſs or ſparkling of the Eyes.
Penelino: to puſh or beat with the Elbow.
Penfar, pennor, penwer: a little Gate, a Poſtern, alſo a Muzzle.
Penfeddwdod: a Giddineſs or Dizzineſs in the Head.
Penffeftr, arad, hefŷd rheffyn twŷſo: a Plough, alſo a Collar or Halter for a Horſe.
Penffeſtin, gwîſg haiarn i ben gŵr: a Helmet or Head-piece.
Penffeſtiniawg, a wiſgo benffeſtin: that weareth a Helmet.
Penffrwŷn: an Ornament for a Horſes Head, an Head ſtall.
Pengrychedd, pengrychni: Curlneſs of the Hair.
Penguwch, gwallt goſod: counterfeit Hair, a Top-knot, a Periwig.
Penhwŷad, pyſgodŷn dŵr crouw: a fiſh called a Pike.
Penioel, bara penioel, bara tylwyth: Houſhold Bread.
Penllad, llâd, y dâ pennaf: the chiefeſt good.
Penloŷn: a little Bird called a Titmouſe.
Penlliain, gwîſg pen i ffeiriadau gŷnt: an Ornament which of old time Prieſts did wear on their Heads.
Penllwydni: horineſs or whiteneſs of Hair.
Pennaig, goreuon y llu: the chief or beſt of the Flock.
Pennawr, pennor, gwîſg pen: an Ornament wore on the Head.
Pennill: a pannel of Graſs, a ſlave of a Song.
Pennod: a Chapter, alſo a certain mark made in the end of any thing.
Pennodi: to appoint, alſo to mark the end of any thing.
Pennor, penfar, penwar, (mwſel,) ſtôl ben: a Head-ſtall, a Muzzle.
Penrhaith, y tyngwr penaf neu gyntaf: he that takes firſt an Oath, the Foreman of a Jury.
Penrhe, penrhwym, gwîſg pen merch: a Hood or Veil that Women wore on their Heads.
Penrhŷn, brŷn a'i ymul yn y môr: a Promontory.
Penſêl, twŷſog, pendefig: a Prince, a Primate, he that has the great Seal.
Pentan: the Chimney-corner, the back of the fire.
Penteulu: the Chief or Head of a Family, alſo a Steward.
Pentŷ: a Pent-houſe, or a Shed added to a Houſe.
Penwiſg, gwiſg pen: an Ornament or Dreſs for the Head.
Penwn, (baner:) a Banner, Standard, Enſign or Flag.
Peppreth, peppru, rhonſach, dwndrio: to babble or that, to chirp as Birds.
Pereiddio: to ſweeten or grow mellow.
Peren, peranen, gerllygen, rwnningen: a Pear.
Perced, rhwyd pyſgotta: a kind of Net for Fiſhing.
Perchen, perchennog: the Poſſeſſor or Owner of any thing.
Pererin, dŷn dieithr ar ei ſwrneu: a Pilgrim.
Y pwynt perfedd, canol, canol-flaen: the Center, or middle Point.
Y berfeddwlâd, cannolwlâd: the middle Country.
Perfigedd, pryfigedd, enofa ar ynifeilied: a Diſeaſe with Worms in Cattle, a vehement ach in wringing of the Guts, as if they were gnawn with Worms.
Periddaint, paraſant: they made, they bid.
Periglor, gŵr eglwyſig: a Pariſh-Prieſt or Curate.
Pêrlewig, lleſmair trwy lawenŷdd: a pleaſant Extaſie.
Perſondod, perſonoliaeth: a Rectory, a Benefice, alſo perſonality.
Pert:) dapper or delicate, fine, gallant, brisk.
Perwŷl, amcan, bwrriad, llawn frŷd: a reſolution, purpoſe or intent.
Perŷf, Perŷd, Brenin, Arglwŷdd: a King or Lord.
Perŷddon, afon Ddyfrdwŷ: the River Dee.
Peryglor, gŵr Eglwfig: a Pariſh Prieſt.
Peſgi: to ſeed, to make fat.
Peſtel:) a Peſtle to bray in a Mortar.
Petrual, (ſgwâr:) a ſquare plat of ground, alſo any ſquare thing.
Peuo, deheuo, anadlu: to breathe out, to pant.
Peu, peues, man, llê, Trigfa, gwlâd: a Habitation, a Dwelling, a Cottage, alſo a Country.
Peuſŷd, peuſŷth, Clymiad neu aſiad Coed ynghŷd: a faſtning of boards together, called in Joyner's Craft, a Swallow, Dove or Culver tail.

div.head: PI.
div.p: Pîb, pîbell: a Pipe, a Flagellet, alſo looſeneſs in the Belly.
Pibo: to purge or have thin Stools.
Piplŷd: given to looſeneſs or purging.
Piccel, pîg ſaeth, hefyd magwŷr: a Dart, a Pile.
Piccio:) to caſt or ſhoot Darts to pick.
Pîg aderŷn: the Bill of a Bird.
Pig neu flaen llymder: the point or nib of any thing.
Piglaw, gwlaw mawr: a heavy Rain or Shower.
Pîl: a rind, bark, ſhell or pill.
Pilionen: a thin rind, pill or bark.
Pildin, bildin: a galling between the Legs.
Pilen, pilionen, brettyn: a Rag or Clout.
Piler, Colofn: a Colum, a Pillar.
Pilig, Cawg, golch-leſtr, ffroen padell yr ymmenydd: a Baſon, a Laver, the Brain Tunnel, a Funnel.
Pilŷn, pilys, Cerpyn, brettyn: a Rag, a Clout.
Pilwrn, ſaeth fain hîr: a Javelin or Dart of five foot long and a half, having a Steel head nine Inches long.
Pill, Cadernid: a Fortreſs, a place of defence.
Pill, boncŷff, Cŷff, pawl: a Log of a Tree, a Stock of a Tree, a Stake.
Pinn:) a Pen, alſo a Pin.
Pipre, pibiad: the looſneſs of the Belly.
Piſgen, piſgŵŷdden, math ar bren: a Linden or Teil Tree.
Piſo:) to make water, to piſs.
Piw, bron, Têth, pwrs llaeth: a Breaſt, Teat, Pap or Udder.

div.head: PL.
div.p: Pleidio: to take part with one ſide or other.
Plegŷd, plaid: part, ſide or party.
Plethu: to plait or braid, alſo to extangle.
Pliant, bliant, lliain main: fine Linnen Cloth.
Pluccan, mân blu: fine Feathers or Down.
Plûo: to pluck off the Feathers.
Plymmen, lleſter plwm: a a Leaden Veſſel, a Maſs of Lead, a Ciſtern.
Plyccrôth morwŷn, Rhan or bol: part of the Belly.
Plŷg: a wrinkle or fold, a bending.
Plŷmlwŷd, plymnwŷd, Rhyfel, ymladd: a War, Battle or Conflict.

div.head: PO.
div.p: PO, gan ba faint: by how much.
Poed, boed, bydded: let it be, ſo be it.
Porphor, lliw aſgell y chwîl: Purple.
Por treiad, (patrwm:) a Pattern, a Portraicture, a Specimen, à Model.
Porth, ymborth, porthiant: aſſiſtance, alſo ſubſiſtence.
Porth, Ilidiart, drŵs: a Gate, a Door.
Porthewlis, Cwŷmp dŵr: a great fall of Water from an high place.
Porthoriaeth: the Office of a Door-keeper, Porteridge.
Porthlâdd, porthfa, porth: a Port or Haven.
Porthwŷs: a Ferry-man, a Landwaiter, a Tide-waiter.
Porth, porthiant, ymborth: a ſubſiſtence, food.
Porthmon: a Drover, alſo a Merchant.
Poſiâr, Jâr dew frâs: a fat Hen.
Pothan, pothon, Cenau blaidd: a young Wolf.

div.head: PR.
div.p: Praidd, llu o ddefaid, hefyd (yſbail:) a Flock of Sheep, alſo a Spoil.
Preiddiawr, preiddiwr, (yſbeiliwr:) a Robber, a Spoiler.
Preiddiad, dwŷn neu lladratta: a ſpoiling, robbing or forraging.
Prain, llŷs Brenin: a King's Court or Palace.
Prawf, praw: a proof, an experience.
Pregethol: pertaining to an Aſſembly, meet to preach.
Prenfol, prennol: a little Coffer or Casket, a Deal or Wainſcotbox.
Prês: Braſs, alſo haſt and ſpeedmaking.
Preſen, Cydrycholdeb, gŵŷdd neu oflaen wyneb: preſence.
Preſen, yr oes breſennol: the preſent Age.
Preſtledd, doeth ymadrodd: a a ſubtle point of reaſoning, witty ſayings.
Preſwyliaw, aros, Tario, Trigo: to dwell, to ſtay.
Prew, gwlâd: a Country a Province.
Prido, gwyſtlo: to give a pledge.
Priddell, Tywarchen: a hard Clod, a Clod or Lump of Earth.
Priddfaen: a Brick or Tile of that nature.
Priddgiſt, pot prîdd: an Earthen Veſſel.
Prîf, permaf, Cyntaf, goref: firſt, principal.
Prîf, y dŷdd Cyntaf or lleuad, yr euraid Rifedi: the firſt day of the Moon, the Golden Number.
Prinhâu: to grow ſcarce, to decreaſe, to diminiſh.
Prinpan, Dadleu: to reaſon, to diſpute, to argue.
Priodol: proper, alſo the Married ſtate.
Priodoli, meddianu: to poſſiſs or make a thing one's own.
Prol:) rhag y madrodd chawryddiaeth: a Prologue.
Proliad, ye hwn a ddywedo'r prol: he that ſpeaks the Prologue.
Propriaid, Gwŷbed mân: little Flies like Gnats.
Prûdd: prudent, grave, ſerious, alſo heavy, ſad, melancholy.
Prŷd, gwêdd, môdd, yſtŷm: form, ſhape, countenance, alſo beautiful
Prydwen, llun, delw: a figure, image, form or ſhape.
Prŷd, amſer, cyfleu: time, ſeaſon, alſo opportunity.
Prŷd o fwŷd: a meal's meat.
Pryderu, gofalu: to cark and care.
Prydu, prydyddu: to make Verſis, to play the Poet.
Pryfedog, pryfedus, llawn o bryfed: full of Vermine or Worms.
Pryfedu, magu pryfed: to breed Worms.
Prŷ'r Dail: a Palmer or Cankerworm.
Pryfigedd, persigedd, gwŷrn, llynger, pryfed y perfedd: the Worms in the Guts.
Pryffwnt, pryffynt, enwedig, penaf: eſpecial, chiefeſt.
Prynu: to buy, alſo to redeem.
Prynwr, pryniawdr: a Redeemer, a Buyer.
Prŷs, pryſg, pryſgoed, coedwig, coedfa coedlwŷn, coed plann, plan goed: a Grove, a Nurſery of young Trees.
Pryſeddu, aros. trigo: to dwell, to ſtay.
Pryſwylio, preſwŷlio, aros, tario: to dwell.

div.head: PU.
div.p: Pûch, ewyllus, dymmuniad: a deſire, a wiſh.
Pucho, dymmuno, ewŷllyſio: to wiſh or deſire.
Punt: a pound or twenty ſhillings.
Puntr, puntur (penſel:) the Pen or Pencil of a Painter.
Puror, peraidd-leiſiwr: an harmonious or pleaſant Tuner.
Putteinio: to play the Whore, to play the Rogue, to commit Adultery or Fornication.

div.head: PW.
div.p: Pylu: to wax dull or blunt.
Pwmpl, pen hoel: a Boſs of a Nail or Bridle.

Pwngi, pelorŷn, chwſigen: a
puſh or bliſter, alſo a pock.
Pwngc, blaen, (nôt:) a point, a note.
Pyngcio: to ſign deſcantly, to joyn in harmony.
Pwŷll, ſynwŷr, doethineb: ſenſe, diſcretion, prudence.
Pwŷllo, yſtyried: to conſider, to deliberate.
Pwŷntio, peſgi: to make fat, or to be fatted.
Pwŷnel: an Aglet or Tag of a Point.
Pwŷs: a pound weight, a weight.
Pwŷth, cyflog, gwerth: a reward or price.

div.head: PY.
div.p: Pydio, peryglu: to be in danger, to encounter.
Pydew: a Pit, a muddy Water.
Pylgain, plygain neu Canniad y Ceiliog, hefŷd gwahaniad ŷ dŷdd ar nôs: Cocks-crowing, alſo the Twilight.
Pyllawg, pyllog: Leaky or full of Leaks.
Pynner, pwŷs, baich, pwn: a weight, burden or pack.
Pynnoreg, yſtrodur bwnn: a Pannel, a Pack-ſaddle.
Pynfarch, march pwn, hefyd ſyrthiad dŵr: a Portcullis, alſo a Pack-horſe.

div.head: RA.
div.p: Rhagbron, gerbron: before or in preſence.
Rhagflaenu, achub y blaen: to prevent.
Rhaglaw, penadur, llywodraethwr: a Ruler, Governour or Preſident.
Rhaglawiaeth, penaduriaeth, Rheolaeth: Government, Rule or Preſidency.
Rhaglith, Rhagymadrodd, y llith flaena: a preface.
Rhacgno, Cyngor, hefyd Rhybŷdd: Advice, Counſel, alſo premeditation.
Rhagod, attal, rhwyſtro: to hinder, to ſtay, alſo an impediment.
Rhagor, rhagoriaeth: preheminence, difference, exceeding, excellence.
Rhagorgamp: a perfect work of Vertue, a Deed well done.
Rhagtal, ffunen, gwîſg talcen: a Frontlet, or Forehead-cloth.
Rhagu, gwrthwŷnebu, gwadu: to contradict, alſo to deny.
Rhaiadr, ffrŵd chwyrn, ſyrthiad dŵr: a Cataract or great downfal of Water.
Rhaiadru, syrthio i lawr yn erchill: to fall down violently.
Rhaidd, ffon hîr bigog: a Spear, a Lance.
Rheiddiawr, Cariwr rhaid: he that carries a Spear.
Rheiddun, yr un a rhaidd: a Spear.
Rhaith, Twng, llŵ, adduned: an Oath, a Vow.
Rhammant, thammanta: devination by ſimple Ceremonies.
Rhandir: a Lot or Hereditary part.
Rhandwy, rhan: a portion or part.
Rhafgl: an Inſtrument to ſhave Wood with, alſo a Grater.
Rhawd, (Trŵp,) Cynŷlleidfa: a Troop, a Company.
Rhawn, rhownyn: the Hair of a Horſe's Tail.

div.head: RHE.
div.p: Rhebŷdd, jor, Llywŷdd, Arglwydd: a Governour, a Lord.
Rhedegfain, rhedegfan: to run up and down.
Rhedweli, gwythen fawr y gwddw: the great Throat-Veins.
Rhefawg, gwden, Tîd, Cadwŷn: a Wythe, a Chain.
Rhefr, Twll tîn: the Fundament or Arſe-hole.
Rhefrwŷm, caledwch yn y bol: a hardneſs or binding in the body, Coſtiveneſs.
Rheiddiawr, a gafio ffon hîr: a Spear-man, a Pike-man.
Rhemmwth, dŷn rheibus: a Glutton, a greedy Fellow.
Rhên, Arglwydd: a Lord, a Peer.
Rhengcio, gwanahau: to make into Rank.
Rhethr, rhethren, paſtwn, ffon ddwylaw: a Spear, a Lance.
Rhethrawr, yr hwn a gario baſtwn: a Spear-man.
Rheufedd, rhefedd, cyfoeth, galluogrwŷdd: wealth, riches, ability, plenty.
Rhewin, dîg, a hefyd anhrheithio: anger, alſo to ruine.
Rhî, Arglwŷdd, gwr enwog: a Lord, Peer, Baron.
Rhiaidd, rhieddawg, uchel, boneddigedd, hael: noble, generous.
Rhial, rheiol, perthynol i frenin, Breiniol: Royal, Noble.
Rhiallu, y rhifedi 100000. ſef Can-mîl: a hundred thouſand.
Rhiawdr, Arglwŷdd, gŵr mawr: a Lord, a Baron.
Rhidio, ymgymharu rhwng ceirw: to rut in Rutting-time.
Rhieni: Parents, Anceſtors, alſo an Off-ſpring, Poſterity.
Rhifwnt, melynliw, aurliw: a yellow or golden Colour.
Rhigwm: a long Tale or Story.
Rhill, gwana, rhês, rheſter: a Rank or Order.
Rhîn, rhinwedd, rhyfeddod, dirgelwch: a ſecret, a myſtery.
Rhingc, rhingcŷn: a noiſe, a craſhing, a gnaſhing.
Rhingcian, rhiccian: to make a noiſe, to craſh, to gnaſh.
Rhingŷll, ſwŷddog: an Officer, a Sergeant, a Purſevant, a Common Cryer.
Rhisgŷn, rhiſglyn: the Bark of a Tree.
Rhiſtŷll, Crîb i gribo Ceffŷl: a Horſe-comb, a Curry-comb.
Rhiſtyllio, Cribo Ceflŷl: to curry a Horſe.
Rhîth: an Apparition, a form, alſo a pretence, the genital ſeed.

div.head: RHO.
div.p: RHoccas, llangc: a young Man in his growing years.
Rhôch, bonlle, bloedd, oernad: a noiſe, a rearing.
Rhodiad, rhod-ddŷn, rhodienwr: a Walker, alſo a Vagabond.
Rhodienna: to walk about, to range.
Rhodiennwr: a Walker about, a Ranger.
Rhodl, rhodol, rhwŷf i rwyfo Cafn ar ddŵr: an Oar.
Rhodreſus, rhodreſlud: given to boaſting or bragging.
Rhôn, ffon hir bîgog: a Spear, a Lance.

div.head: RHU.
div.p: Rhuchen, croen teneu: a thin Skin, alſo the Web in the Eye.
Rhuchio, gogrynu: to ſift or ſieve.
Rhuddo: to grow Red or Ruddy.
Rhuddell, rhuddel, nôd, llythrenau cochion: a Rubrick, ſo called, becauſe printed in Red Letters: a Ruddy Stone to mark Sheep with, Red Oaker.
Rhudden, nôd côch: a Red Mark.
Rhuddin, rhudding, calon pren: the heart or ſoundeſt part of a Tree.
Rhuddfaog, rhuddfawg, rhuddfoawg, côch, o liw gwaedlud: Reddiſh, of a bloody colour.
Rhugl groen, Hugl groen: a Rattle made with Stones in a dry'd undreſſed Skin to fright Horſes, &c.
Rhuglo: to ſhovel Dirt or Mire together.
Rhull, hael, bŷan, amhwyllog liberal, ſwift, haſty, raſh.
Rhummen, bol, potten, cîlſafn: the Paunch, alſo the Cud.
Rhuppai, Heiſlan, rheſullt: an Iron Comb to kemb Flax or Hemp with.
Rhûs, mynediad yn ôl: a leaping or skipping back.

Rhuſo: to leap or skip back, to
ſtand ſtill as an ill qualified Horſe will do in defiance of his Rider.
Rhut, mâth ar Lyſieun: the herb Rue.
Rhuthr: an aſſault or leaping upon.
Rhuthro: to aſſault or ruſh upon.
Rhuwch, gogr rhuwch: a Sieve, a Sierce, a Colander or Strainer.

div.head: RHW.
div.p: Rhwmp, Taradr, ebill: an Auger or Wimble.
Rhangc, chwrniad mewn cwſg: the Snoar that one makes in his ſleep.
Rhwnſi, math ar geffyl: a kind of Horſe.
Rhythu: to make wide or open.
Rhwŷ, rhwyf, llawer iawn, gormodedd, Brenin, penandur: a King, a Chief Commander, a General of an Army, abundance, too much.
Rhwyddhâu: to proſper, to make ready or eaſie.
Rhwŷf, rhwŷf-ffon. rhwyf-lath, rhwyf i rwyfo cafn ar ddŵr: an Oar to row a Boat.
Rhwyfwr: a Water-man, one that Roweth.
Rhwŷl, llŷs neu dŷ mawr: a Vallace.
Rhwŷllog, Tyllog: Latticewiſe, like a Net or Window.

div.head: RHY.
div.p: Rhybuch, enwyllus, dymmuniad: a deſire, a wiſh.
Rhybucho, ewyllyſio, dymmuno: to deſire, to wiſh.
Rhybwŷth, pwŷth, cyſtog, gwerth, (prîs:) wages, reward, the price or value of a thing.
Rhŷch: a Furrow, a Rean between two Butts of plowed Land.
Rhychdir, Tir a ellir ei Aredig: Arable-ground.
Rhychor: the Right hand Ox that draweth.
Rhydain, carw ieuaingc: a Hind Calf, a young Deer.
Rhyderig, Hwch ryderig neu Lodig: a Sow that deſires the Boar.
Rhŷddhau: to ſet free, to ſet at liberty, alſo to looſe, undo or untie.
Rhyfela, rhyfelu: to war, a a warring.
Rhyferthwy, dryccin, llifeirion: a Storm or Tempeſt, alſo a Deluge or Inundation.
Rhyfŷg, balchder, Coegni, gormod o hyfder: Pride, Arrogance, Preſumption.
Rhyfygu, balchio, coeghau, mynd yn rhŷ hŷ: to preſume.
Rhyfygus, balch, coeglud, rhŷ hŷ: proud, preſumptuous, arrogant.
Rhygen: one grain of Rye, or one ſtanding corn of Rye.
Rhygiŷdd, rhygluddiant, rhygluddiad, haeddedigaeth, haeddiant: merit.
Rhyglyddu, haeddu, rhyngu bôdd: to deſerve, alſo to give content.
Rhygn, nôd i goffa neu i gadw Cyfri: a Score made with Chalk, or the like.
Rhygnbren, pren hacciog i gadw cyfri: a piece of Board to ſcore upon, a Score.
Rhygŷlch, Cylch: a Compaſs, a Courſe.
Rhygyngog: given to amble or pace.
Rhymanta: to follow Soothſayings, to divine by gathering of Water and Sand on a certain night.
Rhŷnn, rhyndod: a very great Cold, extremity of Cold.
Rhynnu: to ſuffer extreme Cold, to be frozen with Cold.
Rhynnawd, rhynnawdd, ychydig: ſome, a few, not many.
Rhyngu bôdd: to pleaſe, to give content.
Rhŷodres, rhodres: a babling or prating.
Rhyſgŷr, rhuthr, cais: an aſſault, an endeavour.
Rhyſodŷn, marworŷn: a Coal of fire.
Rhyſwr, Campwr: a Champion, a Wreſtler, a Heroe.
Rhŷw: ſomewhat, ſomething, ſome body, ſome one.
Rhŷw, rhywogaeth: a Stock, Race or Lineage.
Rhywiog: generous, mild, gentle, fine, not courſe.
Rhyweilydd, gweilydd, ofer, gwâg: vain, empty.

div.head: SA.
div.p: Sadell, yſtrodur bwn: a Pannel or Pack-ſaddle.
Saethu: to ſhoot with an A row.
Saethyddiaeth: the Art of Shooting or Arching.
Safnrhythu: to extend or dilate one's Mouth.
Safnog: having a great or wide Mouth, mouthed.
Saffrymmog: of or like Saffron, yellow.
Saffwy, ffon hîr bigog: a Lance, a Spear.
Said, ſeidŷn: a Tang, or that part that goeth into the Haſt of any Weapon or Tool.
Saig: a Diſh or Meſs of Meat.
Seigio: to provide and dreſs Diſhes of Meat.
Seilio, ſylfaenu: to lay a Foundation.
Seilddar, cynhalbren, polŷn: a prop, alſo a pile driven into the Earth.
Sannu, ſynnu: to be ſtupified or amazed.
Sang: a preſſing, a ſtraining, a treading.
Sengi, ſangu: to preſs, to ſtrain, to tread.
Sarritt, anghwanegiad, yr hŷn fo tros ben: an addition, the overplus, what is given over and above weight or meaſure.
Sarrugŷn, go ſarrug: ſomewhat obſtinate or ſtubborn.
Sâs, mawr, uchel, enwog: great, eminent.
Sathar, ſeri ſathr, anghenaifîl ai gorph fel dŷn, a'i draed fel traed gafr, a chŷrn ar ei ben: a Satyre.
Saw, ſâf, ſafiad, ſefydle: a ſtation.
Sawd, rhyfel, ymladd: War, a Conflict or Battle.
Sawdl, ſowdwl: the heel of the foot.
Sawdurio, aſio ynghŷd: to joyn or faſten together, to ſolder.
Sawdd, ſuddiad, myned tan ddŵr: a plunging or dipping into, a ſinking under water.
Soddi, ſuddo: to plunge or dip into, a ſinking dead.
Sawell, Cêg (limneu:) the paſſage of a Chimney.
Sawr, ſafr, ſawŷr, rhogleu, hefŷd blâs: ſavour, taſt, alſo a ſmell.
Sawrio: to ſavour or taſt, alſo to ſmell.

div.head: SE.
div.p: Sebach, bychan Jawn: very ſmall or little.
Sechi, ſachu: to ſtuff or fill up a ſack.
Sêf, ys êf: to wit, that is.
Sefnig: the Weaſand-pipe, the mouth of the Wind pipe.
Sefyllfa: a ſtanding place, a ſtation.
Sefydlu, goſod, gwaſtatau: to place, to eſtabliſh.
Sefydlog: conſtant, firm, ſure ſtanding, eſtabliſhed.
Sefrdân, ſyfrdan, peuffol, ynfŷd: giddy-brain'd, ſtupid.
Seibiant, ſegura: ceaſing from labour or buſineſs.
Seimio: to yield Greaſe, to drop Greaſe.
Seinio, ſynio: to make a ſound.
Seirch, offer Ceffyl, Cyfrwŷ: the Harneſs of a Horſe, a Saddle.
Seithugio, gwneuthyr yn ofer: to diſappoint, to fruſtrate, to do in vain.
Seithugiaeth, oferedd, aflwyddiant: diſappointment, a fruſtrating.
Sêl, gwiliad, edrychiad: an eſpying, a Watch.
Selu, edrych, gwilio: to eſpy, to watch.
Selwr, Gwiliwr, edrychwr, golygwr: an Eſpyer, a Scout-watch, alſo a beholder or viewer.
Seldrem, dyrnaid, polltid: a handful, a bundle.
Selgyngian, iſel gyngian, ſiarad yn arafedd, grwgnach: to ſpeak ſoftly, alſo to mutter or murmur.
Semlant, ſymlant, wŷneprŷd, golygiad: countenance, aſpect.
Seneddr, Tyrfa, hefyd penaduriaeth yr iddewon: a Synod, an Aſſembly, alſo the Sanhedrim amongſt the Jews.
Seneddwr, uchel gynghorwr: a Senator or high Councellor.
Sengi, ſang: to preſs, to tread or trample.
Senw, anrhydedd, budd, Cynnudd: honour, alſo profit, benefit.
Serch, puttain, Godinebydd: a Concubine, alſo an Adulterer.
Serchu: to love, to affect or fancy.
Serfŷll, dibŷn, ſiomgar, ar ſyrthio: like to fall, decay or periſh.
Setrigl, ſienigl, drylliedig, rhwygiedig: torn, broken or bruiſed ſmall.
Serthallt: a precipice or great downfall.
Serthedd, gwrthŷn eiriau, diflaſdod: leudneſs, vain or leud diſcourſes, alſo ſteep, dangerous, ready to fall.
Serthair, Cabledd, dywedyd yn ddrwg am dduw: Blaſphemy.

div.head: SI.
div.p: SI, ſŵn: a noiſe, a hiſſing.
Siad, Iâd: the Head, the top of the Head.
Siaff, mâb Arglwydd: a Lord's Son.
Siamp, man geni, nôd ar gorph, brychni Croen: a Mark, a Mole, a Freckle, alſo a blemiſh on the body.
Siampler, patrwm: a Pattern, a Sample.
Siapri, Cellwer: merry words or conceits, a Jeſt.
Siarad: to ſpeak, talk or diſcourſe.
Siaradwr: a talkative Man, of many words.
Sibrwd, ſiſial, grwgnach yn iſel: a low burring noiſe.
Siccio: to ſtir or rub Linnen in the Lather or Waſhing-Tub.
Siccrhau: to confirm, to eſtabliſh, to aſſure, to certifie.
Sider, Ridens, hefyd Carpiau o frethŷn: Fringe, alſo Wollen Rags.
Sideru, brwŷdo, dryllio, rhwygo: to make holes, to make a thing all to Rags.
Siderog, tyllog, rhwyllog, ſitrachog: full of holes or Fringes.
Sieff, nai fâb chwaer: a Siſter's Son.
Sigo, yſſigo: to cruſh or bruiſe.
Silophr, plwm coch: Red-lead or Vermilion.
Sillafu, cyſylltu ſillafau: to joyn ſyllables.
Simmera: to play, to trifle away one's time.
Simmwr, math ar ddilledŷn gŵr enwog: a Mantle ſuch as Knights of the Garter wear.
Sin, Teml lle 'Cleddir brenhinoedd, hefyd luſeni: a Temple where Kings are buried, alſo Alms.
Sinidr, ſinidro, baw gefail: Droſs or Refuſe of Metal tryed by the fire.
Sinobl, plwm Côch, mwŷn Côch: Red-lead or Vermilion.
Siſyfwl, ſibrwd, ſiſial. grwgnach: whiſpering, muttering.

div.head: SO.
div.p: SOccŷn, hoccŷn, hogŷn: one of an indifferent bigneſs, ſomething under the middle ſtature.
Soegen, ſoeglud, mwydlud: moiſt, that is ſteeped or watered.
Somm, ſiom: a ſhamm or deceit.
Sommi, ſiommi: to ſhamm or deceive.
Somgar, ſiomgar: deceitful, diverſe in conditions.
Somgarwch, ſiomgarwch: peeviſhneſs, diverſeneſs to pleaſe, waywardneſs.
Sôn: a ſound, a rumour, alſo mention.
Sonio, ſynio: to ſound or make a noiſe.
Soniawr, ſyniog: loud, making a great noiſe.
Soppen, (bwndel:) a bundle of. Straw or Hay, &c.
Sorri: to be angry or diſpleaſed.

div.head: SU.
div.p:
SUecan: the ſmalleſt Drink made of Maide, alſo a Drink
made of Vinegar and Water.
Sûd, ſutt: a form, ſhape, faſhion, method.
Suddiant, ſuddiad, boddiad: a drowning or ſinking.
Sung-for: Quick-ſands or Shelves in the Water.
Sûo: to bring aſleep, to lull aſleep.

div.head: SW.
div.p: Swllr, Tryſor y Brenin: a King's Exchequer or Treaſure.
Swlldŷ, ſylldŷ, Tryſor-dŷ'r Brenin: the Exchequer.
Swmbwl: a prick or point ſet in a Goad to prick Oxen forward.
Symbylu, ſymlu: to prick or ſpur.
Swrn, morthwŷl bychan, blagurŷn o goed, egwŷd y Troed: a little Hammer, a little twig of a ſhrub, the Lock of the foot.
Swrn, tippŷn, ychydig, pêth: ſomewhat, a little while, a little.
Syrnŷn, ychydig amſer: a little while.
Syrthni: a ſlothful heavineſs or dulneſs.
Swŷddog, ſwŷddwr: an Officer, a Magiſtrate.
Swŷf, ſwŷfen, hufen, (burum:) Cream, Barm, Yeſt.
Swŷn: an Inchantment, a Remedy by Inchantment.
Swŷno: to enchant, alſo to bleſs, to heal.

div.head: SY.
div.p: Sŷ, ſŷdd: is, or that which is.
Syberw, (ſobor,) balch, hael: ſober, alſo proud, liberal, bounteous.

Sybwb, ys wb wb, (ffei ffei:)
fit, fie, away, get thee hence.
Sybwll, pwll: a Woirlpit, a Gulph.
Sychu: to dry, to wax dry, to wither.
Sychedfod, ſyched mawr: a great thirſt.
Sŷdd: is, or that which is.
Syddŷn, Eſſyddŷn, Yſſyddŷn, Tyddŷn: a Tenement.
Syflyd, ſylfyd: to move or to be moved.
Syfrdandod, ſyndod, hurni: a dulneſs or ſtupidity.
Syganai, efe a ddywedodd: he ſaid.
Sygn, arwŷdd nefawl: a Coeleſtial ſign.
Sylw, ſulw, golygiad: ſight, a viſion.
Syllu, ſylliaw, craffu, gweled: to behold, lo regard.
Symlyn, Cydafel, (ffŵl:) a Fool, an Idiot.
Symlen, ffolog: a She-fool or Idiot.
Symlogen, putain fechan: a little Harlot.
Symlu, ſymbylu: to prick or ſpar.
Synnio:) to ſound or make a noiſe.
Synnu: to amaze, to wax dull or ſtupid.
Synna, wele, creffwch, gwelwch: behold, to.
Synniaw, gweled, teimlo, deall, diodde: to perceive, to ful, to ſuffer.
Syndal, lliain main: fine linnen Cloth.
Syrth, y perfedd, y Coluddion: the Bowels, Inwards or Intrails.
Sŷth: ſtiff, ſturdy, alſo bolt upright.
Sythu: to grow ſtiff, alſo to erect upwards.
Syw, hardd, gwŷch, hefyd doeth, dyſgedig: elegant, handſom, alſo wiſe, learned.
Sywidw, Yſwidw, Yſwigw, Aderŷn bychan, gwâs y drŷw: a little Bird called a Titmouſe or Nunn.

div.head: TA.
div.p: TAbar, hugan neu golch laes: a long Coat or Cloak.
Tabwrdd, offerŷn Cerdd: a Timbrel, a Taber.
Taccl, ſaeth: an Arrow, Shaft or Dart.
Tacclau, ſaethau, harddiadau: Darts, alſo Ornaments.
Tacclu, taccluſo: to adorn, alſo to amend.
Tachwedd neu twyſgen, rhŷw faint: a quantity, a reſidue, ſomething.
Tachweddu, diweddu, gorffen: to conſummate, to end.
Tadogi, tadu, gwared rhai oddiwrth gam: to protect or defend them that are falſly accuſed, alſo to father.
Tadwys, tâd, a enillo enifail: a Father, or that which begets among Beaſts.
Taen, taenell, taniad glybaniaeth: a ſprinkling about.
Taenu, tanu: to ſcatter or ſpread abroad.
Taeog, afreolus, creulon: rude, inhumane, villanous, ſullen.
Taer-wrŷs, ymryſon: a great Conflict or Contention.
Tafarnwr:) a Vintner, alſo an Ale-houſe-keeper.
Tafell: a piece or ſlice of any thing.
Tafellu: to cut to ſlices or pieces.
Taflu: to throw, caſt or fling.
Taflod: a Garret, a Loft or Scaffold.
Taflod y genau: the roof or pallat of the mouth.
Taflodiad: an Interjection, a part of ſpeech.

Tafodiog, a fo Rhŷgŷl ei dafod: that is well ſpoken, or hath skill in ſeveral Languages,
alſo a Pleader or Solicitor.
Tafodogaeth,) dadleuaeth: Advocature, or the Office of a Pleader.
Teithio: to take a Journey, or ride a Circuit.
Talog, talcen uchel: having a large forehead.
Talfort, y bwrdd ucha mewn neuodd: the upper Table in a Hall or Room.
Talaith, coronbleth o Lyſiau gerddi, &c. a Garland, a Coronet.
Taleithio, Coroni, hardd drwſio'r pen: to Crown, to ſet a Garland on.
Talbos, edrŷch tarian: a Shield or Buckler.
Talch, rhynion: Groats or great Oat-meal.
Tâl, dŷn. Cudŷn talcen: a Top-knot, a Womans Tower.
Talm, rhan pêth, (ſbâs:) a ſpace, ſome, a part.
Talmu, dyfod yn agos, tynnutua'r diwedd: to approach, or draw near the end.
Talwas, edrych tarian: a Shield or Buckler.
Talwrn, llawr bychan, gwelu gardd: a little floor, a bed in a Garden.
Tam, tammaid: a bit or mouthful.
Tammeidio: to cut in morſels or bits.
Tandawd, eiries o dân: a great fire or flame.
Tandde, llîd tanbaid, tardd o wrês: an Inflammation.
Tanlliw, newydd, hefŷd poethi: growing hot, alſo new.
Tancwd, croen cŵd y dirgelwch: the outward skin of a man or beaſts Cods.
Tangnefeddu, heddychu: to make peace, to reconcile.
Tant: a bow ſtring, the ſtring of a muſick Inſtrument.
Tanter, carwr merched: a Wooer or Suiter to Women.
Tanſadd, rhan fechan: a little pot.
Tapin, tapina, hiliad, brethŷn lluniog i wiſgo (ſiambrau:) Tapeſtry, alſo a covering.
Taradr, ebill carn trô: a wimble or piercer.
Tarddellu, berwi megis dŵr y môr ar wynt uchel: to boil or bubble up like the Seas in a ſtorm.
Tarfu, chwalu, tanu: to ſcatter or diſperſe.
Tarfuran, gwâg yſprŷd, bwbach: a Viſion, a Phantaſie.
Tarrian, pren crwn megis caead crochan a drantol wrtho, iw ddal mewn llaw aſſwf i dderbŷn neu droi heibio ddyrnodiaur gelŷn wrth ymladd: a Shield or Buckler.
Tario: to dwell, to ſtay, to remain.
Tarleiſio, atebleiſio: to eccho, or ſound again.
Tarlwng, tarlwngc, darlwngc, traflwnge, trangcell, llwngc: a draught, a draught of drink.
Tau, tewi a wna ef, efe a daw: he will hold his peace.
Tewi: to hold ones peace, or be ſilent.
Tawch, môr tawch, y môr côch: the Red Sea.
Tawdd: a melting, alſo it will melt.
Tawl,) toll, hefŷd gadawiad heibio: a Tole, alſo a Ceſſation.
Toli, tolio, tolli, treilio: to make leſs, to wax leſs.
Toliad, arbedus, eiriachol, cynnil: hard, niggard, near.
Tolo, pwŷs o bwŷſau: a pound weight.
Tawlbwrdd, bwrdd o faen, bwrdd cyfrif: a Table of Stone, a counting Table.

div.head: TE.
div.p: Tegan: a Jewel, alſo a bauble or toy for Children.
Tegwch: beauty, clearneſs, ſerenity, fairneſs, fair weather.
Tegychu: to beautifie, to adorn, alſo to clear up, or become fair weather.
Teghau: to beautifie, &c. alſo to pacifie.
Teilyngu: to vouchſafe, to think worthy.
Teimladwy: palpable, that may be handled, or felt with the hand.
Teimlo: to feel with the hand.
Teisban, brethŷn llawn lluniau' hefyd y madrŷddun rhwng y ffroenau: a Tapeſtry, alſo the Griſtle that parts the Noſtrils.
Teithi gwraig, miſglwŷf merch: the monthly flowers of women.
Teithio: to take a Journey, to travel.
Têl, telaid, meſur o ŷd vn Neheubarth, o wŷth (chwart) Cymreig, neu 16 ſeifnig: a certain meaſure of Corn in South-Wales containing ſixteen Engliſh quarts.
Telaid, telediw, haeddedigawl, hardd, hawddgar: worthy, fair, beautiful, comely.
Telediwrwŷdd, teilyngdod, hawddgarwch, uchel-fraint: dignity, comelineſs, ſightlineſs.
Teledo, henw Dinas yn hyſbaen: the City Toledo in Spain.
Tenau: thin, ſlender, lean, alſo rare.
Teneuhâu: to make thin or ſlender, alſo to make ſcarce.
Tenllif, gwe o Lîn a gwlân: Linſie-Wolſie.
Tennŷn: a Cord, a String, a Halter.
Têr, glân. hardd, (pûr:) pure, clean, neat.
Teru, glânhau, (pûro:) to purifie, to make clean.
Terŷdd, bŷan, chwimmwth, hefŷd llŷm: ſwift, nimble, alſo ſharp.
Terch, torch: a Collar, a Chain.
Terfenŷdd, gwaſod: a Cow deſiring a Bull.
Terfŷn: a Land-mark, a Bound, a Partition.

Terfynu: to ſit a Bound, to limit,
to partition between, alſo to end.
Terfyſg, helbul, Cyffro, Cythryfwl: a Tumult, an Inſurrection, Diſturbance.
Terfyſgu, Cyffroi: to diſturb to make a Sedition or Tumult.
Terrig ar fodlau: Dirt on one's beels.
Terrwŷn, crŷf, hŷ, poethlud: ſtrong, bold, alſo hot.
Terŷdr, puſt yr haul: the Sun beams.
Terŷll, cuchiog, yfrywiog ei olwg: of a frowning and cruel looks.
Tês: the heat of the Sun-ſhire.
Teſach: to ſport and play the wagg, gadding.
Teſtyn: an Epigraph, an Inſcription or Title, alſo an Argument, a ſcoff or mocking-ſtock, a Text.
Teuluwriaeth, trefn luſendai: houſhold order or government.
Teuluedd, teluedd, heddwch, Cyttundeb: peace, concord.
Tewder, tewdwr, tewedd: thickneſs, groſneſs, fatneſs.
Tewhâu, tewychu: to fatten or wax fat, to thicken.
Tewdws, y twrr Tewdws: the ſeven Stars called Pleiades.
Tewi: to be ſilent, to hold one's peace.
Teyrn, brenin, hefyd gorthymŵr: a King, a Tyrant.
Teŷrnaſu: to rule or govern a Kingdom.
Teŷrnwialen, gwialen Brenin yn arwyddo Brenhinfraint: a Scepter.

div.head: TI.
div.p: Tingc:) a tinkle or blow on a Bell, Pot or Kettle.
Tindroed, henw aderŷn bychan: a little Bird called a Diver, Didapper, Arſefoot.
Tinfigl y gŵys, ſigl tîn y gwŷs: a Bird called a Wagtail.
Tiol, diol, ol: a track or footſtep.
Tîr: Land, an Inheritance, a Farm or Tenement.
Tiriog, cyfaethog o dîr: rich in Land.
Tiriogaeth, y tîr a berthyno i drê neu ddinas neu lus: a Territory.
Tirio, dyfod i dîr: to land or come aſhore.
Tirio fel mochŷn: to dig up the Earth like Swine.
Tirf, bywiog, buan, tew: lively, quick, fat.
Titten, diden: a Breaſt or Tett.
Titiaid, propriaid, gwŷbed mân: little Flies like Gnats.
Titl,) teſtŷn, neu henw llyfr: a Title or Inſcription.
Titriwr, Didryfwr, dŷn neilltuol er mwŷn duwioldeb: a Religious man, a Hermite.

div.head: T. L.
div.p: Tlodi neu gwneuthur yn dylawd: to impoveriſh.
Tlŵs neu proppor: pretty, pleaſant, amiable.

div.head: TO.
div.p: Tôo: the Tyle or Thatch of a Houſe.
To yſgafn, magwŷr: a Lay or Pile.
Tocc, (het, capp:) a Hat or Cap.
Toddaid, math ar gerdd: a kind of Verſe.
Toes-dwrr: a maſs or lump of Dough.
Toeſi: to become doughy, to make Dough.
Tolbwrdd, bwrdd chwaryddiaeth: a pair of Tables or Cheſboard.
Tolo, pwŷs o bwŷſau: a pound weight.
Tolcio: to make bollow, to dent.
Tolcio fel hwrdd: to butt like a Ram.
Tolchen o waed: a clot of blood.
Tolgorn, mâth ar ffon gam: a crooked ſtaff that the Auguns uſed in pointing the Quarters of the Firmament.
Tolli: to take Toll or Cuſtom.
Tommi, gwneuthŷryn domlud: to beſpatter with dirt, to dung.
Tôn: a note, tune or accent.
Tonn: a wave, a ſurface, an outſide.
Tonnog: full of ſurges or waves, alſo heady, dogged.
Tonnen: the skin, alſo a ſhell, or outſide of any thing.
Tonniar, (plangc,) ton dwr: a Board or Plank, alſo a Wave.
Topp:) a Top to play with.
Topp:) the height or top of any thing.
Tor, toron, toryn, cochl, hugan: a Cloak, a Coat, a Mantle.
Toronog: wearing a Coat or Cloak.
Torr, torriad: a fraction, breaking or dividing, a cut, a ceſſation, education, alſo a taming or breaking of a Horſe, alſo the belly.
Torrog: gore bellied, great with young.
Torrogi: to conceive, to become with young.
Torchi: to wreath, twiſt or wrap.
Torrfynyglu, torri pen oddiar gorph: to behead or cut off the head, alſo to hurl or throw down headlong.
Torrgoch, math ar byſgodŷn: a Fiſh called a Rochet.
Torrllwŷth: a Litter of Piggs, or Puppies, &c.
Torpell, tolchen: a lump or clot of any thick matter.
Torſtain, boliog, ceſtiog: groſs about the middle.
Toſtedd: ſeverity, alſo a Diſeaſe called the Stone.

div.head: T. R.
div.p: Trablawdd, bywiog iawn: very ſwift or nimble.
Trabludd, cyffro, cythryfwl: diſturbance, tumult, war, conflict.
Trachwrês, tragwrês, gormod gwrês: too much heat.
Tradwŷ: three days hence, three days after.
Traeth: the Sands bordering upon the Sea.
Traethawd, ymadrodd: a Treatiſe or Diſcourſe.
Trafaelu, poeni, gweithio; to labour, to work.
Traflwng, traflwnge, llwngc mawr: a great draught or ſwallow.
Traflŷngcu, mawr lyngcu: to ſwallow extreamly.
Trafod, helbul, poen, ymladdfa: labour, trouble, alſo a conflict or battle.
Trafodi, ymryſon, ymladd: to ſtrive, to fight.
Trafferthu: to trouble or be troubled, to cark and care.
Trafferthus: full of troubles and buſineſs.
Tragor, llawer iawn, gormodedd: ſuperfluity, exceſſiveneſs, abundance.
Tragywŷddoli: to perpetuate, to make immortal or eternal.
Traha, balchder, coegni, diffeithwch: contempt, arrogance, pride, the higheſt injury.
Trahaus, trahawg, balch, coeglud, diyſtur o eraill: proud, that deſpiſeth others.
Trai: a decreaſe, alſo the ebbing of the Sea.
Treio: to decreaſe, to diminiſh, to ebb.
Traian: a Joynture, or third part.
Traidd, mynediad heibio, trwodd neu troſodd: a carrying or conveying over, a paſſing by.
Treiddio, myned heibio, trwodd neu troſodd: to paſs, to convey over.
Treillio, ymgreinio, rholio: roll or tumble.
Train, buchedd, (cwrs) bŷwoliath dŷn, llercian: converſation, alſo a lingring or delaying.
Trais: oppreſſion, rapine, a raviſh, a rape
Treiſio: to raviſh, to commit a Rape, to oppreſs.
Traith, ymadrodd: a Treatiſe or Diſcourſe.
Trallodi: to diſturb, to vex or trouble.
Tramgwŷdd: a ſlip, ſlide or fall, a misfortune.
Tramgwŷddo: to fall, ſlip or ſlide, to meet with misfortunes.
Tramor, tros y môr: beyond Seas.
Tramwŷ: to frequent, to go often.
Trang, trangc, trangcadigaeth, marwolaeth: End, Death.
Trengi, trengu, marw: to end, to die.
Trannoeth, y foru mêdd Dr. Davies: to morrow, the day following.
Trâs, traſau, carenŷdd, ceraint: Kindred, Alliance.
Traſol, yn deirŷd i lawer: having many Kindred or Alliance.
Traſerch, gormod ſerch, colledig ſerch: too much love, loſt love.
Traſeifiad, yn parhau, yn aros yn ddiyſgog: abiding ſtill or firmly, perpetual.
Treulio, gwario: to ſpend, to waſt or conſume.
Trawd, trawdd, cerddediad, troediad: a walking, a pace.
Traws, trawſedd, yr hyn ſŷdd ar draws: croſs, overthwart.
Trawſwch, blew'r welfl uchaf: the Muſtache, the hair on the upper lip.
Trebl,) trifflŷg: threefold, alſo the Treble in Muſick.
Trecc, offerŷn, hefyd tacluſrwydd: an Ornament, alſo an Inſtrument or Tool.
Trefan: a little Town or Village.
Trefad, trigfa, annedd, hefyd aros: an abode or dwelling, a Houſe or Cottage, alſo to dwell or abide.
Trêftâd, treftadaeth, etifeddiaeth, cynhyſgaeth: Patrimony, Inheritance.
Treftadol, etifeddol, perthŷn i etifeddiaeth: pertaining to Inheritance or Succeſſion.
Trefred, trefad, cartref: one's houſe or abode.
Trefnu: to order, direct or diſpoſe.
Trefnus: well appointed, decent, in good order.
Treigl, treingl: a Revolution, a Rolling or Tumbling.
Treiglo, treinglo: to roll or tumble.
Treiglad, treigl ddŷn, treingl ddŷn: a Vagabond, a Wanderer.
Treiſiad, buſtach, hefyd gorthrymwr: a Bullock, alſo an Oppreſſor.
Trem, drem, golygiad, craffiad: an aſpect or countenance.
Tremyniad, delw neu lun yſbrŷd, ellŷll: a Viſion or Phantaſie.
Trennŷdd, tranoeth: two days hence, the next day after tomorrow.
Três, poen, helbul: labour, buſineſs, trouble.
Treſtl: a Dreſſer or Kitchin-Table, any ſmall movable Table.
Trewyn, athrywŷn: to part or ſeparate them that fight.
Trigo: to dwell, to ſtay, to remain, alſo to ſtarve or die.
Trigiâs, trigiant, cartref, trigfa: habitation, abode.
Trîn: to handle, to do one's buſineſs, to dreſs or order, to tend or nurſe.
Trippa, y perfedd, coluddion: the Entrails or Bowels.
Triſtwch, triſtyd: heavineſs of heart, ſadneſs, ſorrow.
Triſlâu: to grow ſad or heavy, to mourn, alſo to make ſad or heavy.
Troi: to turn, to convert, alſo to roll.
Trochi: to dip, to bathe, alſo to baptize.
Troed: a foot, the foot of any thing.
Troediog: having feet, alſo a Footman or Page.
Troedfedd: a foot or twelve Inches.
Troedog: any thing wherewith the foot is tied, a ſnare or fetter.
Troedlath, troedlas, troad bren gwŷdd: the Treadle of a Weaver's Loom.
Trogen: a Vermine called a Tyke that annoyeth Dogs, Sheep and Oxen.
Troſglwŷdd, dygiad neu bwtiad troſodd: a carrying over, a tranſportation.
Troſglwŷddo, dwŷn neu bwrw. troſodd: to carry over or tranſport.
Troſi: to turn, tumble or diſquiet.
Troſtan: a long Poll or Spear.
Trotterth, tuthiwr: a Trotter, or he that trots.
Trothwŷ, rhiniog: a Threſhold or Groundſil.
Trû, truan: poor, weak, helpleſs, miſerable.
Truaf, truanaf: moſt miſerable, moſt wretched.
Truenŷn, dŷn truan: a poor miſerable man.
Truanu, truanhau, trugarhau: to have pity or compaſſion.
Trugarhau: to have mercy, to take pity.
Trul, rholbren i lyfnhau tîr, neu rhol garreg: a Roller.
Trullio, gillwng dîod: to draw drink.
Trum, brŷn, pen brŷn: the top of a Hill, alſo a Hill.
Trum, grwn, cefn, o dîr: a a Balk or Ridge between two Furrows or Reens.
Trummain, trimiog, yn llawn cefnau fel tîr llafur: ridged as plowed Land.
Truthio, gwenheithio: to fawn or flatter.
Trwccio, methu, gwŷfo, ſyrthio: to fail, to flagg, alſo to fall.
Trŵch, toriad, agen, fôs: a Cut, a Trench, a gaſh.
Trŵch, torredig, drylliedig, clôff, anafus: broken, maimed, lame.
Trychu, torri trwodd: to cut aſunder, to gaſh.
Trŵch, dŷn annedwŷdd, neu aflwŷddianus: an unhappy or unfortunate man.
Trychni, trychineb, drychinneb: miſhap, misfortune, calamity.
Trwm: heavy, weighty, alſo ſad, ſorrowful.
Trymder: heavineſs, weightineſs, alſo ſorrow, ſadneſs.
Trymhâu: to wax heavy or burdenſom, alſo to be ſad, or to make ſad.
Trwmluog, trymluog, ſwrth, lludded: dull, heavy, ſluggiſh.
Trwſa) (bwndel,) (ffardel:) a Truſs, a Pack or Fardel.
Trwſio: to dreſs, alſo to amend or repair.
Trwſiadu: to cloath, to trim, to deck.
Trwſiadus: well cloathed, decked or trimmd.
Trwŷadl, parod, hylaw, deheuig: ready, quick, dexterous.
Tryſtio: to make a noiſe or ſound.
Trwŷdded: licenſe, liberty, freedom, alſo a Leaſe, alſo a hot Iron to bore holes.
Trwŷddedawg, a ryddhawŷd, a gafodd rydd-did: one that is made free, alſo one having free admiſſion.
Trwyddew, ebill: a Wimble or Piercer, an Augre.
Trwŷno: to ſmell with the Noſe cloſe to a thing.
Trwytho: to lye or waſh with Lye.
Trybaeddu: to be daubed with dirt or blood, &c.
Trybelid, trybelydr, parod, bŷan, pryſur: ready, quick, alſo buſie.
Trybeſtod, pryſurdeb, trafferth: buſineſs, great travail or buſie work.
Trychu, tori trwodd: to cut aſunder, to gaſh.
Trychŵŷdd, tramgwyddus, ſerfŷll, brau: like to ruine, decay or periſh, frail, brittle.
Trylar, ſibrwd, ſingrig: to chirp or chatter as a Bird, alſo the chattering of Birds.
Tryfer: a Trident or three forked Dart or Spear to take Eels or Fiſh.
Tryfrith: garniſhed with divers Colours, full of ſpots or blots, plenty or numerous.
Tryleu, glythau, ſypiau, Cidu: Heaps, Bundles, Faggots.
Trylew, cryfa, gwreiddiaf: moſt ſtrong or valiant.
Tryliw, o'r un lliw: of one and the ſame Colour.
Trymbar, trwm baſtwn: a heavy Lance or Spear.
Trymder: heavineſs, weightineſs, alſo ſorrow, grief, ſadneſs.
Trymdde, trymbyrddig, trwm, trîſt, prûd: weighty, heavy, ſad, melancholy.
Trymfrŷd prudd-der: ſorrow or heavineſs of heart.
Trymyniad, baedd: a Bore, a Bore-pig.
Trywanu, brathu trwodd: to pierce, or ſtab.

div.head: TU.
div.p: Tuedd: a Coaſt, alſo an Inclination.
Tueddu: to incline, to draw or levil at a thing.
Tuchanllŷd: given to repine, or groan.
Tudfach, yſtrŷdfach, yſtrŷdfachan: a Stile, Stilts.
Tudwedd, tudwed, daiar, tîr: Land, or Soil.
Tudlath, llathen dîr, neu troſtan o bum llâth a haner o hud i feſur tîr: a Perch or Pole.
Tudded, cwrlid, hŵs, hiliad: a Cover or Coverlet.
Tuli, amdo, hŵs ceflŷl: a Shroud, a Horſe cloth.
Tunnell, 2000 o bwŷſau'r ewŷr, hefyd (meſur) gwlŷb yn cynwŷs 252 (galwŷn:) a Tun.
Turio: to root up the Earth as Hogs, alſo to land or come aſhore.
Turn:) a Turn that Turners uſe.
Turnio:) to turn the Turners work.
Turnen,) lleſtr neu degan o waith (Turniwr:) a turned Veſſel or piece of work.
Turs, durun: a Noſe or Bill.
Turtur, mâth ar golomen garedig, yr hon pan fo farw ei chymhares ni chymhara bŷth mwŷ agun arrall: a Turtledove.
Tuſw: a gripe or handful, alſo a Painter's Penſil.
Tuth, tuthiad: the trotting of a Horſe, &c.

div.head: TW.
div.p: TWcca, (cwllewr:) a Coulter, a Knife, a Tuck.

Twddf, attwf, tyfiad: a growing,
a thriving.
Twlc, tŷ bychan: a little Cottage.
Tylciau, tai bychain: Cottages, Booths, Sheds.
Twll: a Hole, a Cave, a Den.
Twlly llumman, twll y mŵg: the Trunk or paſſage of a Chimney.
Tyllu: to pierce or bore a hole.
Twn, tonn. toriad: a rend, a cut, a breach.
Twnn, drylliog, candrell: broken, rent, torn.
Tyngu anudon: to forſwear or perjure.
Twngc, twng, than o ŷd yn perthŷn i (feiſter) y tîr: a certain ſhare of the ſtanding Corn due to the Landlord.
Tyrru: to heap or pile together.
Twred, tŵr bŷchan: a little Tower.
Twrf, twrdd, trŵſt, taran: a noiſe, a ſtir, a thunder.
Twrf, tyrfiad: a wreſting of a Sinew, a ſprain.
Twrlla, llygoden fawr y mynudd: a Hill Mouſe.
Twrn dâ: a good turn, profit, benefit.
Twrn drŵg: diſprofit, harm, a bad turn.
Twt, twtti, tewch: hold your peace, ſilence.
Twtnai, lliw llwŷd, llwŷdrudd: an Iron gray colour.
Twtnais, tacclus: neat, handſom, well decked.
Twŷg, gwîſg, dilledŷn: a garment, apparel.
Twyll-gynghanedd, cân anghywir: a falſe Concord in a Verſe.
Twyll-odl, odl anghyſon: an improper meeter.
Twŷmdwŷro, twŷmno: to make hot or warm.
Twŷſg, than, rhŷwfaint: ſome, part, or ſome portion.
Twŷſgen: a ſmall part or portion.

Twŷſgo, cynill, hel, pentyru:
to gather or heap together.

div.head: T. Y.
div.p: Tŷaid, tylwŷth tŷ, llonaid tŷ: a family, a houſe full.
Diletrŷb, heb lêd tybio: free from ſuſpition.
Tybiaid, tybio, tybygu: to eſteem, to think, to ſuppoſe, to ſuſpect.
Tŷle, lle ty, llawr tŷ: Ground whereupon a Houſe ſtood, alſo a convenient place to build on.
Tylwŷth: a Family, a Tribe, alſo Kindred.
Tylwythog: that has a great Family, or many Kinſmen.
Tyluŵr, telu-ŵr, pen teulu: the Father or Maſter of a Family.
Tymmig, pigiad, pigo, ſymbylio, myned ymblaen: a pricking or ſlinging, alſo moving or ſailing forwards.
Tymmhigo: to prick forwards, to pinch.
Tymmer: a temperate meaſure, a due proportion.
Tymmor: a ſeaſon or time convenient.
Tymmhoraidd: ſeaſonable, alſo meet, decent, convenient.
Tymmhoreiddrwŷdd: decency ſeaſonableneſs, fitneſs of time, conveniency.
Tymp, amſer pwŷntiedig, cyfamſer: a ſpace of time, a certain time, an appointed time, a Term time.
Tŷnn: ſtretcht, tite drawn, alſo ſtubborn, ſullen.
Tynnhau: to make ſtrait or tite.
Tynn, tyniad: a draught, a pull.
Tynniar, clŷch ſuddas: a kind of Bells called Judas Bells.
Tynghedu gorchymmŷn yn enw Dnw: to adjure, to command in God's name.

Tyno, llanercho dîr, pant o dîr:
a little Valley, a green plat of ground.
Tyrfu: to ſprain, to wreſt a ſinew.
Tyſmwŷ, Cyſtudd, Cryndod: affliction, trembling or ſhivering.
Tyſmwŷo, crynnu: to quake or ſhiver.
Tyſtio, tyſtiolaethu: to teſtifie or bear witneſs.
Tytmwy, derbyniad, pen Cengel, modrwŷ yn dal pwrs wrth wregys: a Buckle, a Claſp.
Tytmwyo, (bwcho, clyſbyſu:) to tye, to buckle, to claſp.
Tywarch: green Turfs or Clods of Earth.
Tywarchen: a green Turf or Clod of Earth.
Tywarchawr, ŷch, buwch, eidion: an Ox, a Cow, a Neat.
Tŷwâs, gwâs tŷ: a Houſhold man ſervant.
Tywyn, tywŷniad, goleuni: brightneſs, or ſhining.
Tywŷn, glan y mâr: the Sea Shore, or Sea Land.
Tywŷs, twyſenau ŷd: Ears of Corn.

div.head: UB. UCh.
div.p: UBain, uban, udo, gweiddi: to howl or make a noiſe.
Uen, uwch, uchach: above, higher, ſuperiour.
Uchafiaeth, penaduriaeth: ſupremacy, height or top.
Uchedd, wŷneb, croenen: the top or ſurface.
Uchelfa, lle uchel: a high place.
Ucher, yr hwŷr, Prydnhawn: the Evening.
Ucheru, hwŷrhau: to grow late, or draw towards the Evening.

div.head: UD.
div.p: UDo: to howl like a Dog.
Uddudd, iddŷnr: to them, unto them.

div.head: UF.
div.p: UFel, uwel, ufeliar, Tân: a fire.

div.head: UN.
div.p: Unoliaeth, cyttundeb meddwl, unfrud: unanimity, concord of heart and mind.
Unben, Unbŷn, penadur, llywŷdd, Brenin: a Monarch, an Emperour, a Prince.
Unbennes, Brenhines, &c. an Empreſs, Queen or Princeſs.
Undrâs, undylwŷth, drydu: of the ſame kindred or family.
Unddull, unfâth, yr un fâth: uniform, alike.
Unffurf, yr un fâth, fel en gilŷdd: uniform, all alike.
Ungor, heb gyrdeddu: ſingle or untwiſted.
Edeu ungor, edeu-ddi gyhydedd: untwiſted Thred.
Uniawni: to rectifie, to direct, to ſtreighten.
Unlliw: of one and the ſame colour.
Unoed, o'r un oed, cyſoedion: of the ſame Age.
Un-tri, trî unwaith: one time three.
Untuog, a fo yn pleidio: partial.
Untyrch, entyrch, uchder, brigyn: the height, the top.

div.head: UR.
div.p: URael, mâth ar lîn: a kind of Flax.
Urdd, Urddau, urddas, grâdd eglwŷſwr: Order; holy Order.
Urddo: to admit into Orders, to ordain at Vniverſities.
Urddol, parchus, graddol: honoured with ſome Degree or Order.
Urddedig, parchedig: that is in honour, honourable.
Urdden, urddain, urddŷn, urddol, parchus, graddol: honoured with ſome Degree or Order.
Uriad, henuriad, hên-ŵr, heneddwr: an Elder, a Senator, an Old man.
Uſt, ys taw: hold thy peace, ſilence.
Uſuriwr, Occrwr, Llogwr Arian: an Vſurer.
Uſwŷdd, yn ddarnau, yn ddrylliau: to pieces.

div.head: UT.
div.p: Uwd Peilliaid: Pap, or meat made of milk and Wheat flower.
Uwd Sugaethan. uwd a Rodder wrth friw iw ſugno: a Poultiſe.

div.head: WE.
div.p: Weithian, bellach: now, now at length.
Welducho, gwelwch i fynn: behold above.
Wfft, herr: a word of difiance, or ſometimes upbraiding.

div.head: WI.
div.p: WI. dâ iawn: heiday, well done!
Wibwrn, Rhŷw ydafedd glas: Coventry Blue.
Wihi, gwyryriad Ceffylau: the Voice of Horſes when they neigh.
Y Wilammeg, huchen ar Lygad: the Web in the Eye.

div.head: WN.
div.p: WNs,) yr unfed ran ar bymtheg or pwŷs: an ounce.
Wng, yn agos: near, hard by.
ŵo, llais bytheied yn helŷf. the voice of Hounds a hunting.
Wrlŷs, Rhŷw Lyſiau: a kind of Herbs.

div.head: WT.
div.p: Wttres, chwant y Cnawd, anlladrwŷdd, afradlonrhwŷdd: Luxury, Prodigality.

Wttreſwr, gŵr afradlon, gŵr
mllad: a prodigal man, a luxurious man.
Wŷbr, wŷbren, awŷr: the Firmament, the Air, the Sky.
Wŷlo: to weep or ſhed tears.
Wŷlofain, gwŷlofain: to lament, to weep bitterly.
Wŷlofus, a wŷlo ac a gwŷno lawer: that weepeth or bewaileth much.
Wŷll, yr hunllef: a Hag or Night-mare.
Wŷnebol, golygus: beautiful goodly to behold.

div.head: Y.. Ch.
div.p: Ycha, gwelwch, dyma, dyna wele: to, behold.
Ychryn, dychryn, crynfa, achreth: fear, trembling, quivering.
Ychidigyn, y lleiaf a all fod: the leaſt that may be, a Mote.

div.head: YD.
div.p: Ydlan: a Yard made for Ricks of Corn or Hay.

div.head: YF.
div.p: YFed: to drink, alſo a drinking.
Yfettri. llymmeittian: to tipple or drink often.
Ylltŷr, man-geni, dyfaden: a Mole or Wart.

div.head: YM.
div.p: YM, myn: an Adverb of ſwearing, by.
Ymachlud, ymachludd, cuddio, ymguddio, cuddiedig: to hide, to hide himſelf, alſo hidden.
Ymadolwŷn, atolygu yn fynŷch, dymuno yn daer ag yn aml: to beſeech or intreat earneſtly and often.
Ymaes, allan: without, out of doors.
Ymafael: to lay hold, to wreſtle.
Ymaith: away, hence, out of the way.
Ymandaw, gwrandaw: to hear, to hearken.
Ymannos, annos: to ſet on or encourage.
Ymannos, ymannog, ymgynghori: to exhort one another mutually.
Ymarddelw, gofŷn am eu heiddio eu hun: to claim.
Ymbil, erfyn, dymmuno: to implore, to beſeech.
Ymchwelŷd, dymchwelud: to turn away, to turn aſide.
Ymdiro, ymdwymno with y tân: to warm one's ſelf by the fire.
Ymdrafodi, ymryſſon: to fall out, to ſtrive.
Ymdynnu: to ſtrive, to contend alſo to pull at each other.
Ymddangos: to ſhew one's ſelf, to appear.
Ymddibynnu wrth, crogi wrth, diſgwŷl wrth: to hang by, alſo to depend upon.
Ymddifadu, dwyn oddiar: to deprive, to bereave one of a thing.
Ymddifregu a Duw, attolygu i Dduw: to beſeech God.
Ymddiffŷn: to defend, alſo a defence.
Ymddihafarchu, ymdrechu: to ſtrive or contend.
Ymddihattru, ymddioſg: to undreſs or ſtrip one's ſelf.
Ymddiodi: to guzzle or drink laviſhly.
Ymddioli, Dilêu, crafu ymmaith yr ôl traed: to blot out the tracks or footſteps.
Ymddiried: to truſt or confide in.
Ymddiriedgwbl, flyddlona: moſt truſty, moſt faithful.
Ymddirgelu, ymguddio: to hide one's ſelf.
Ymddiwad, gwadu, gwrthod, hefyd cyhoeddi: to deny, to refuſe, alſo to report.
Ymddwŷn: to behave one's ſelf well or ill.
Ymddwŷn, beichiogi: to conceive or go with young.
Ymddyfoli, cegu, ymrythu: to devour or ravine gluttonouſly.
Ymddywedŷd, cŷd-ymddiddian: to diſcourſe or diſpute.
Ymegnio: to endeavour, to ſtrain or ſtrive hard.
Ymeirio, ymremmial: to quarrel in words.
Ymmennydd-dro, pendro: a Diſeaſe called a Vertigo.
Ymgael, cymwŷs gymharu: to be well met, or well matcht.
Ymgattewrach, ymladd: to fight, to skirmiſh.
Ymgeleddu: to cheriſh, to take care of or look after.
Ymgeleddwr: an Overſeer, a Tutor, a Guardian.
Ymgroeſt: to mark with the ſign of the Croſs, and ſo to bleſs one's ſelf.
Ymgyllellu, ymladd â chleddŷfau neu gyllill: to fight with Swords or Knives.
Ymgynnal: to help or ſupport one another.
Ymgynnal, diweirdeb, dianlladrwŷdd: continence, chaſtity, forbearance from luſt or pleaſure.
Ymgreinio: to roll or tumble one's ſelf on the ground.
Ymgyfarfod: a meeting, alſo to meet together.
Ymgyhydu: to joyn or twiſt together.
Ymgŷrch: a coming together, an aſſault.
Ymgyrchu: to come together, to make an aſſault.
Ymhonni, taeru, ficcrhau: to aſſert, to vindicate.
Ymlâdd, i lâdd ei hun: to commit ſelf-murder.
Ymladdgar: much given to fighting, quarrelſom.
Ymlaeſu, diffygio, pallu: to fail, to decay.
Ymleflef, ymſennu, ymremial: to contend in words, to ſcold.
Ymlŷferŷdd: to rave or talk madly.
Ymlŷniad, erlidiwr, ymlidiwr: a Perſecutor, a Purſuer.
Ymiachau, jachâu eu gilydd, cymerŷd eu cennad: to heal one another, alſo to take their farewell.
Ymnoddi, cymerŷd noddfa, llechu: to take a Refuge.
Ymodwrdd, terfyſgu, cyffroi: to make a tumult.
Ymogelyd: to take heed, to beware.
Ymogor, tŷ, trigfa: a Houſe, a Habitation.
Ymorchuddio, ymguddio: to hide one's ſelf.
Ymorneſt, ymladd: to fight a Duel.
Ymorwſt, ymaelŷd codymman: to wreſtle, to ſtrive.
Ymrain, hâdu, enill plant: to bring forth ſeed.
Ymread, ymrewŷdd, cymhariad y gwrŷw a'r banŷw: copulation.
Ymrwyllo, ymddiffŷn: to ſhake off or deliver one's ſelf.
Ymſang, ymwâſg: a preſſing, a ſtraining.
Ymſwrn, gwaſgfa: a preſſing or ſqueezing.
Ymſwyno, ymgroeſi: to bleſs one's ſelf with the ſign of the Croſs.
Ymſywŷn, ymſennu: to ſcold, to cavil.
Ymſwan, ymaelyd codymmau, ymryſon: to ſtrive, to wreſtle.
Ymwaſgn: to embrace, to hugg or clip cloſe.

Ymweddu, cyttuno: to agree
together, to accord.
Ymwngc, agos, cymydog: near, a Neighbour.
Ymwneuthyr, cyttuno i ddyreidi: to conſpire together.
Ymwrio, ymryſon, ymladd: to ſtrive, to fight.
Ymwrdd, ymhwrdd, ymhyrddio: to ſtrive, to contend, to thruſt or puſh againſt.
Ymwŷbod, cydnabod, yſtyried: to acknowledge, to conſider.
Ymylgŷlch godre dilledŷn: the Borders or Fringe of a Garment.
Ymynhêdd, ymbil, dymmuno: to implore, to intreat.
Ymyſgar, ymyſgaroedd, perfedd, coluddion: the Entrails or Gutts.
Ymyſgrain, ymoſgrain, ymoſgrŷn, ymgreinio: to tumble upon the ground.

div.head: YN.
div.p: Yn awr, yr awron, yrowan: now, at this preſent.
Yncil, encil, ffo, cîlio: a flight, a retreat.
Ynfydu: to grow fooliſh or mad.
Yngan, yngenŷd, ſôn: to ſpeak, to mention.
Ynglef, ynglais, gwaedd, crî, bonllef: a great cry or noiſe, a ſcreik.
Yngwrth, yngyrth, yn ddiſymmwth, chwŷppŷn: ſuddenly, preſently.
Ynial, anial, rhyfeddol, hefŷd gwedi ei adel, anghyfanedd: wonderful, alſo forſaken, unhabitable.
Yn lleigys, tua'r hŵŷr: towards the Evening, in the Evening.
Ynni, nerth, gwrŷm, pybyrwch, gwroldeb: courage, ſtrength, valour.
Ynnill: gain, profit, alſo to gain or profit.
Yno: there, in that place, then.
Yrf, Eirf, Arfau: Weapons, Arms, Tools.

div.head: YS.
div.p: YS, yn wîr, yn wîrionedd: truly, verily.
Ys êf, ſêf, hynnŷ ydiw: to wit, that is.
Yſbaid, ennŷd, ehengder lle, hefŷd peidio: a ſpace, a while, alſo to ceaſe or leave off.
Yſbâr,) ffon fawr i ryfela: a Lance, a Spear.
Yſbonge: a joſtle, a jerk, a ſpurt.
Yſbrigŷn,) blagurŷn: a ſprig, a twig.
Yſbrychu, llychwino: to freckle, to break out into Pimples, alſo to ſoil or beſmear, to mildew.
Yſbwrial, y perhau a fwrier ymmaith: Sweepings, Reffuſe, Rubbige.
Yſbwrn, mwſwgl y môr: a Spunge.
Yſbydŵr, Lletteuwr, a dderbynnio ddiethred: an Hoſt, an hoſpitable man, that receives ſtranges.
Yſcenn, marwdon, mardwn y pen: the Dandroff of the head.
Yſgafael, yſgafeth, yſgafell, yſglyfaeth, a ddyccer oddiat eraill: a prey.
Yſgafala, yſgyfala, diofal, diogel: careleſs, negligent, ſafe.
Yſgafalhawch, diofalwch: careleſneſs, leiſurely, vacancy, negligently.
Yſgafn o ŷd ueu wair: a heap of Corn or Hay piled up and trodden hard.
Yſgafnu: to heap or ſet up Corn or Hay.
Yſgal, (Cwppan.) cawg: a Cup, alſo a Baſon.
Yſgâr, rhan, hefŷd (Taſg:) a part or portion, alſo a Task.
Yſgardde, gwaſgarfa. chwalfa: a diſperſion a ſcattering.
Yſgarm, gwaedd, bloedd: a clamorous noiſe, an out cry.
Yſgarmes,) curo ymaith, trechu: a Skirmiſh.
Yſgeler, diried, echryſlon, barus: wicked, villanous, ungratious, leud, miſchievous.
Yſgerbwd, Burgŷn: a Carrion, a dry Carcaſe.
Yſgewŷll, blagur, twf blwŷddŷn: young ſprigs or twigs.
Yſgidogŷll, Aderun tebig i linoſen: a Bird called a Siskin.
Yſgien, cyllell, cleddŷf: a Knife, alſo a Sword.
Yſgîn, gwiſg-laes: a long Gown or Robe.
Yſginyddiaeth, (Taelwriaeth:) Tayloring, or the Taylors Trade.
Yſglem, clemm, (blottŷn,) naid ŷn ol: a blot or ſtain, alſo a rebound.
Yſglen, yſtlen, rhywogaeth, rhîth: a kind, a ſex.
Yſglent, neidiad yn ol: a rebounding.
Yſglentio, naidio yn ôl: to rebound.
Yſglodioni: to chip or cut into Chips.
Yſglŷf, yr hyn a ddyger oddiar eraill: a prey, a ſpoil.
Yſglyfio, dwŷn oddiar eraill: to ſpoil, to make a prey.
Yſglyfaeth, yſbail, trais: a ſpoil, a rapine.
Yſglywŷn, eſglywŷn ymdiffynnu, gwared: to defend.
Yſgod, Cyſgod, hefŷd ŵŷll: a Shadow, alſo a Hag.
Yſgodigaw, bod mewn dychrŷn, gwingo o ddychryndod: to be frighted, to winch and kick as a frighted Horſe.
Yſgoi, oſgoi: to lean or yield unto, to go aſide.
Yſgol, yſgoldŷ: a School, a School-houſe.
Yſgolp, Aſeth. a Lath to faſten Thatch.
Yſgor, eſgor: to bring forth, to be delivered.
Yſgoren, Yſgorawg, Cwrwgl: a Boat made of Twigs and Horſe-hide.

Yſgorddion, eſtronion, eſtroniaid:
ſtrangers, people not related.
Yſgort, twrf, trŵrſt: a noiſe, the report of a Gun.
Yſgothi, yſgythi, cachu: to go to ſtool.
Yſgothfa, gau-dŷ, cach-dŷ: a Houſe of Office.
Yſgraffinio: to ſcratch, alſo to lance a ſore.
Yſgrawen, crawen: a cruſt, a rind or skin.
Yſgrawlingo, yſglowringo: to glue or faſten with Glue.
Yſgrî, Cri, gwaedd, bloedd: a great Cry or Noiſe.
Yſgrogell, pont godi, pont windio: a Draw-bridge.
Yſgrubl. enifail gweithio: a labouring or working Beaſt.
Yſgrŷd, crynfa: a trembling, a quivering.
Yſgrydu, crynnu: to ſhake, to tremble.
Yſgŷb o ŷd: a Sheaf of Corn.
Yſgybell, yſgŷb: a Sheaf of Corn, a Broom or Beeſom.
Yſguttyll, Cudyll, Barcŷd: a Kite, a Glide.
Yſgŵd, gŵth: a joſtle, a thruſting, a puſh.
Yſgwfl, yſbail, anrhaith: a prey▪ or ſpoil.
Yſgwier, Arfog, (Harneiſiog:) armed, harneſſed, alſo an Eſquire.
Yſgwr, rhuthr: violence, an anſault, a force.
Yſgwthr, Argraffiad, yſgythriad: an Engraving or Carving, alſo a Lopping.
Yſgwŷdd, Bronddor, tarrian: a Shield, a Buckler.
Yſgwŷddo: to joſtle or ruſh with the Shoulder.
Yſgyfaint: the Lungs or Lights, alſo a Diſeaſe in Horſes called the Glanders.
Yſgyfeinwſt, triſtwch, cledi, clefŷd: grief, ſorrow, affliction, ſickneſs.
Yſgyfarllynig, brithion gluſtiau: having ſpeckled Ears.
Yſgyflu, cippio ymmaith, difetha: to take or ſnatch away, to devour.
Yſgyflgar, rheibus, awŷddus, cybbyddaidd: greedy, ravenous, covetous.
Yſgylfu, rheibio, cyppio ymaith, difetha: to devour, to ſnatch away.
Yſgymmun: excommunicated, accurſed, alſo quarrelſome, moroſe.
Yſgymmundod: an Excommunication, a curſing, alſo frowardneſs, or peeviſhneſs.
Yſgymuno: to excommunicate, to curſe, alſo to provoke unto anger and fury.
Yſgymmodi, cymmodi: to reconcile▪ to re-create friendſhip.
Yſgyren: a Shingle, a Plank, a Board, a Splinter.
Yſgyrioni: to cleave into Shingles or Splinters.
Yſgythru: to lop or cut the Branches.
Yſleppan, (Trap,) magl: a Trap, a Snare, a Gin or Pitfall.
Yſmachd, dryg-waith, twrn drŵg: an ill deed, an ill turn, malefaction.
Yſmalhawch, yſmaleidd-dod: levity, lightneſs, inconſtancy, careleſneſs.
Yſmalhau: to wax careleſs and ſlighty.
Yſmwccan, cwmmwl, mŵg: niwl: a Cloud, a Smoak, a Fog.
Yſnid, cyffylog bychan, (Sniten:) a Snite or Snipe, or a little Woodcock.
Yſnoden, (Lâs, Rŷban:) a Hairlace, alſo any Lace, or Ribbon.
Yſpagau, edŷn olwŷn, hefyd ewinedd aderŷn: the ſpoaks of a Wheel, alſo the claws of a Bird.
Yſpailio:) to ſpoil, to make a prey.
Yſparduno:) to ſpur or prick forwards.

Yſpelwi, bildino, cael y bildin:
to gall, to chafe.
Yſpêr,) ffon Ryfelu: a Lance or Spear.
Yſpienddŷn, yſpiennŵr, yſpîwr:) a Spy, a Spyer.
Yſpodol, cleddŷf dwylaw, (yſglis) i danu eli: a two-handed Sword, alſo a Spatula that Chirurgeons ſpread their▪ plaiſters with.
Yſpodoli, curo a ffon: to beat with a Staff or Cudgel.
Yſpred, a wrthodwŷd, a fwriwŷd ymaeth: that which was caſt away, or worth nothing.
Yſpûr: a ſhort poſt or pillar to ſet things upon.
Yſpurlâth, pren cynal: a rafter, alſo a prop.
Yſpwrn, mwſwgl y môr: a Spunge.
Yſtâd,) cyflwr, a State, Condition, or Conſtitution.
Yſtagiad, tagiad: a ſtrangling, or choaking.
Yſtagu, tagu: to choak or ſtrangle.
Yſtalwŷn,) a ſtone Horſe, a Stallion.
Yſtâng, troſtan, paſtwn: a perch or long rod, a pole.
Yſtels, croen llwŷnog: a Fox's skin.
Yſtîd, Yſtidwm, tîd, cadwŷn: a Chain.
Yſdiferion, diferion bargod tŷ: the dropping of the Eaves of an Houſe.
Yſtig. yſtigrwŷdd: Diligent, Inouſtrious, alſo Luſty.
Yſtîl, dull ymadrodd neu yſgrifen: a Stile or Method of Speaking or Writing.
Yſtle, perthynas, ceraint, cyfathrach: Kindred, Affinity.
Yſtlen, Rhŷwogaeth: a Sex, a kind.
Yſtlommi, pîbo: to have thin ſtools by looſeneſs.
Yſtlyſu: to go aſide, to make a ſide.
Ystof: the warp of a Cloth.
Yſtod: a lay of Hay or Corn laid with a Sithe, a Swath.
Yſtoriaŵr, a ddywedo neu a yſgrifeno hên chwedlau: a Hiſtorian.
Yſtrad,) heol, dyffryn rhwng bryniau: a Street, a Valley between two Hills.
Yſtrangc, cyfrwŷs ddichell mewn Rhyfel: a Stratagem or Policy in War.
Yſtref, cartref: a Habitation or Dwelling.
Yſtrîn, ymryſon, Ymrafel, ymladd: a Battle, a Fight, alſo Contention.
Yſteŷd,) heol, priffordd: a Street, a High-way.
Yſtrodur: a Pack-ſaddle, a Horſe Cart Saddle.
Yſtrŷw, dichell: Induſtry, Diſcretion, Skill, Wit.
Yſtrywgar, yſtrywus: Crafty, full of Tricks or Inventions.
Yſtrywiaw, myfyrio caſtie: to think of or deviſe ſome Tricks.
Yſtummio: to bend, to ſhape, or figure, to frame or form.
Yſtuno: to vex, trouble or move, to drive away, to beat away.
Yſtwcc, crwcc: a Bucket, a Pail.
Yſtwffwl, mwrthwŷl drŵs: the clapper of a door.
Yſtwytho: to make limber or pliable, alſo to wax limber or pliable.
Yſtyffylog, cîſt yſtyffylog: a great Cheſt with a round lid like a Trunk.
Yſtŷn, eſtŷn: to reach, or lengthen.
Yſtywanu, digio, cythruddo, blino: to vex, to trouble.
Yſwilio: to be aſtoniſhed, to bluſh.

div.head: YT.
div.p: YTewŷn, etewŷn, pyntewŷn o dàn: a Firebrand.

div.head: Henwau (Phyſygawl) Lyſiau 'r ddaear, Coed, a Ffrwythau Coed, yn Gymraeg a Saeſnaeg.
The Names of the Phyſical Herbs, Trees, and Fruits, in Britiſh and Engliſh.

div.p: YR Adafeddog, llwŷd y ffordd, llwyd bonhedig: Cudwort, Chaſweed, Petty-cotten, ſmall Bomebaſt, o kind of Cotton-weed, Bloody-flux-wore or Cadweed.
Afal y ddaiar, Bara yr Hwch, round Birt-wort, or the Apples of the Earth, Swine's-bread.
Afal peatus, Eirin gwlanog: a Peach.
Afal melŷnhîr; a Limon or Lemon.
Afan, mafon, afanwŷdd: the Hind-berry-brambles, Framboys, Raſpis, great Brambles.
Alan bychan, Gwrthlys, Carnyr Ebol, y beſychlys: Foal-foot, Colts-foot, Horſe-foot or Ball-foot, Ale-hoof, or Horſe-hoof.
Alan mawr, Dail y tryfan: Lugwort, Butter-bur.
Alaw, y fagwyr wenn, Lili'r Dwr: the water-lilly, a Water-roſe, the white Lilly.
Aliſantr, y Ddulŷs: a Loveage, Aliſander.
Amranwen: St. Peters-wort, Mother-wort, White-wort, Tanſey, a kind of Camomile.
Arian Gwion, Arian-llŷs: Flux-wort or Lask-wort, Baſtard Reubarb.
Aurbibau: Arſenick, Orpine, a kind of Oker of the colour of Gold.
Aurfanadl, Corrfanadl, Banadlos: Broom, a Dyers weed.
Balog y waun, y felſugn, y felen gu, llyſiau 'r eglwŷs, y weddlŷs, mêl y cŵn.
Banadl, Balaznen: Spaniſh-broom, Wood-waxen, Baſe-broom, Whin or great Furrs.
Banadl pigog: a kind of pricking broom.
Banadlos, Aurfanadl: Broom, a Dyer's weed.
Bara 'r hwch: Berthwort, round Birtwort, Swine's-hread.
Barf yr Afr, barf y Bŵch: Goat's-beard, or Burchin-beard.
Bawm, gwenynddail: Turkey-balm, with purple and white flowers.
y Bengaled, y glafellŷs, y grammennog, y Benlaswenn: Blew-bottles, Scabious.
y Ben goch, yr Ellnog gôch, y dinboeth, llyſiau 'r dom: Arſemart or Lulerage.
y Benlas wenn, y Bengaled: Blew-bottles, Scabious.
y Berthlŷs: Pellitory of the wall.
Berw'r dŵr, mintŷs y dŵr, myntŷs y meirch: Water-creſſes, Water-mint, Lady-Smock or Cuckow-flower.
Berwr y dŵr melŷn, Perſli 'r dŵr: water Parſley, Belders, Bell-rags, yellow Water-creſſes.
Berwr y fam, berwr y fammog, berwr y torlanau, berwr caerſelem, berwr gauaf: Buck-wheat, Charlock or Chadlock.
Berwr ffrainge, berwr ffrengig, berwr y garddau: French Creſſes.
Berwr yr iair, canclwm: knot-graſs, Blood-wort.
Blaen y conŷn ar y mêl, drydon: wild Liverwort, Agrimony.
Blaen y gwaŷw, y boethfflam: the leſſer Spearwort.
Blodau ammor: Everlaſting, a flower that never fadeth.
Blodau 'r gôg: the wild Gilli flower.
Bloneg y ddaiar, Rhwŷmŷn y coed, llyſiau 'r twrch, eirin gwion, grawn y perthi, paderau 'r gâth, y winwŷdden wenn, pŷs y coed: Briony.
Breſŷch ben-gron: a kind of Coleworts, Cabbage.
Brigau 'r twŷnau, y felynllŷs, llyſiau 'r cower: Cheeſe-runnet, Ladies Bed-ſtraw.
Briw 'r march, câs gan gythraul, llyſiau 'r hudol, y dderwen fendigaid, (y ferfaen:) Vervain.
Briweg y cerrig, llyſiau 'r muroedd, puppur y fagwŷr: Prick madam, Worm-graſs or ſtone-crop, Handed-kouſe-leeks or Sengreen.
Brymlŷs. y freflŷs, llyſiau 'r coludd, llyſiau 'r pwding: Penny-royal, Pudding-graſs.
Bulwg, y drewg: Millet or Hirſe, Cockle, Baſtard Grommel, Salfern.
Bulwg rhufain, llyſiau 'r bara: Gyth or Gith, Roman Night-ſhade.
Buſtl y ddaiar, y genrhi goch: Centory.
Bwŷd yr hwŷaid, llin hâd y dŵr: Water-lentil, Ducks-meat.
Bwŷd y llyffaint, caws y llyffaint, bwŷd ellyllon: Toadſtool or Muſhroom.
Bwltws, deurŷw ſŷdd o honynt, y gwŷnn ŷw 'r alaw, a'r melyn ŷw 'r bwltws: Water-lilly.

div.head: C
div.p: CAcamwcci, cribau 'r bleiddiau, cyngaf mawr: the greater Burr-dock.
Cacamwcci lleiaf, cyngaf: Burr-dock the leſs.
Caill y ci, y galdrîſt: Dog-ſtones.
Callod y derw, cluſtiau 'r derw, llyſiau 'r yſgyfaint: Lung-wort.
Canclwm, y glymmog, y garhewin, y waedlŷs, berwr yr iair: Knot-graſs, Blood-wort.
Canrhi gôch, buſtl y ddaiar: Centory,
Carn yr ebol, alan bychan: Foal foot, Colts-foot, Horſe-foot, Ball-foot, All-hoof or Horſe-hoof.
Canwŷll yr adar, y dewbanog: Dioſcordis. Higtaper, Mallein.
Càs gan arddwr, Hwp yr ychen: Reſt-harrow.
Cedor y wràch, Rhawn y march: Horſe tail, deadly night-ſhade.
Cennin y brain, eſgidiau'r gôg, hoſanau'r gôg: The Purple Hyacinth Flower.
Cennin y Gwinwŷdd, cennin pedr: Narciſſus, Wild-leeks.
Cibog, am fod i hâd mewn cibau: Panick, Indian Oat-Meal.
Clais y moch, Clari dwbl, y gôch-las, clŷch duram: Roman Sage.
Clôr, Cylor, cnau'r ddaiar: Smallidge, Earth-nut or Ear-nut.
Cluſt ŷr Arth, yr olcheuraid, yr olchwraidd: Sannicle.
Cluſt yr Aſſen, Cynghlenŷdd yr afon: Lawrel, Spurge-lawrel.
Cluſt yr Ewig: Spurge Lawrel, Lowry.
Cluſt y fuwch, Clûſt y Tarw, y Dewbanog: Dioſcordis, Higtaper, Mullein.
Clûſt yr Iuddew, Cluſtiau 'r Derw: Lungwort.
Cluſt y Llygoden: the herb Mouſe's Ear.
Cluch y cerrig: the herb Stone Bells.
Cnau'r ddaiar, clôr: Smallidge, Earth-Nutts, Ear-Nutts.
Comffri, llyſiau 'r culwm: great Walwort, Comfrey or Bugle.
Corr-fanadl, Aurfanadl, Broom, a Dyers weed.
Corr-yſgaw, yſgaw mair: Wall-wort, Dane-wort, Vdder-wort.
Corn yr Afr: a herb called Goats-Horn.
Corn y carw môr, y Godog: thorny Samphire.

Corn y carw mynŷdd, Corn
yr Hudd, corn yr lwrch, corn y bŵch, Paladr hir: Broom-rape.
Coſtog y Domm: Herb St. Barbary.
Crâch eithin, Eithin yr Iair: Reſt-Harrow.
Crafangc yr Arth, treed yr Arth, tafol y môr: Black Hellebore, brank-urſin.
Crafangc y frân, chwŷs mair: Craw foot.
Crafangc yr Erŷr: the herb called Eagle's claw.
Cribau mair, yſgallen wenn: Wild Artichoak, or Lady's Toiſtle.
Cribau St. Ffraid, Dannogen, llŷs dwŷfawg: Betony.
Cwlŷn y mêl, Drydon: Wild Liverwort, Agrimony.
Cwlm y gwŷdd, cwlm y coed, y gynghafog: Pellitory of the Wall, Great bind weed.
Cyfrdwŷ, yr yfrdwŷ: Waterfern, Polypody in Cardiggan-Shire.
Cynghlennŷdd yr aſon, y llefanog, Llyſiau 'r afu, Llinwŷdd yr afon, cluſtyr Aſſŷn: Liverwort.
Cynflon y Cabwllt, y falerian: Wild Spikenard.
Cyngaf, cyngaw, Llyſiau 'r hidl; great burdock.
Cynghafawg, cwlm y Gwŷdd: Pillitory of the wall, great bind-weed.

div.head: CH.
div.p: Chwerwlŷs yr Eithin, y fedwen chwerw, llyſiau 'r Byſtwm, ſaeds Gwŷlltion: Clown's All-Heal.
Chwŷs Arthur, Llyſiau'r Gwenŷn, Erwaint: Goats-Beard.
Chwŷs mair, crafange y frân: Craw foot.

div.head: D.
div.p: Dail y cwrwf, diowdwŷdd, pren y gerwŷn: Lawrel.
Dannogen y Dŵr: Broom-wort, Saracens conſound.
Dail y fendigaid, dail y twrch: Tutſan or Park leaves, Agnus Caſtus.
Dail ffion flrwŷth, byſedd ellyllon, menŷg ellyllon, byſedd cochion, Llwŷn y tewlaeth, dail ffiol ffrwŷth, ffiol y ffridd: Fox-glove nulleine.
Dail y gloria, gellheſg, cleddyflŷs, yr hŷlithr: Glader or Sword-graſs, Water-gladiole.
Dail y gron, bogail y forwŷn, y gron doddaid: Venus navil, pennywort.
Dail y tryfan, alan mawr: Lugwort, Butter-bur.
Dail y twrch, Dail y fendigaid, yr holljach: Tutſan or Park leaves, agnus caſtus.
Dant y llew, clais dant y ci: Lions tooth, wild Cichory.
Dant y llew lleiaf: Swines Criſſes.
Danhadlen ddall, danhadlen farw: dead Nettle, Archangel.
Derwen gaerſelem: wild Germander, Jeruſalem Oak.
Derwen y ddaiar, y dderwen fendigaid: Vervain.
y Dewbanog, y banog haner pan, tapr dunos, tapr mair, Sircŷn y melinŷdd, dail y melfed, Clûſt y fuwch, cluſt y tarw, canwŷll yr adar: Mullein.
y Dewbanog fechan, llyſiau 'r parlŷs: Cowſlip.
y Dewbanog wenn wrŷw, gwŷnddail, rhôs campau: Stock-gilly-flowers.
y Ddilwŷdd felen, llyſiau 'r wennol, llŷm y llygaid, gwell nâ'r aur, llyſiau 'r llaw, y ddiwythl, y ddiwlith: great Celandine.
y Dinboeth, y Bengoch: Arſe-ſmart, Lulerage.
y Dinllwŷd, llwŷd y dîn. y dorllwyd, tanſi gwŷllt, gwŷn y merched: wild Agrimony, wild Tanſey, Cudwort, Starewort.
y Doddedig rûdd: Roſa Solis, or roſe Solis, Sun-dew, red Roſe.
y Dorfagl, golwg chriſt, llygaid chriſt, goleiddrem, golŷwlŷs, effros: Eye-bright, Mouſe-ear, Scorpion-graſs.
y Dorllwŷd, y dorllwŷdig, y dinllwŷd: wild Agrimony, wild Tanſey, Cudwort, Starewort.
Drain yſpinŷs, pren melŷn: the common Barberry-tree.
Dringol, ſuran yr ŷd: ſoure Dock.
y Droedrûdd, llyſiau 'r llwŷnog, mynawŷd y bugail, pig yr aran, llyſiau Robert: Crane's-Bill, Stork's-Bill.
y Drydon, troed y drŷw, llyſiau 'r drŷw, cwlŷn y mêl, cychwlŷn, blaen y cohŷn ar y mêl, y felvſig, llyſiau 'r fuddau: wild Liverwort, Agrimony.
y Dduglwŷd, eithin yr jair: Reſt harrow.

div.head: E
div.p: EBolgarn; alan bychan: Foal-foot, Colt-foot, Horſe-foot, All-hoof or Horſe-hoof.
yr Eglŷn, tormaen: Saxifrage, Hemlock, Dropwort.
Egroes, aeron mieri mair: the Berries of ſweet Briers.
Eiddew, eiddiorwg: a Climing or berried Ivy.
Eiddew 'r ddaiar, y feidiog lâs: Ground-Ivy.
Eirin y ci, y galdriſt: Dog-ſtones.
Eirinllŷs, eurinllŷs, yſgol fair, yſgol fair ochrog, yſgol griſt: St. Peters-wort.
Eirin mair, perth-eurddrain: dryed Figgs, Gooſeberrys.
Eithin ffrengig: white Brambles, Buck-thorns, great tall Furrs.
Eithin yr jair, câs gan arddwr, hwp yr ychen, tag-aradr, crach-eithin, y ddyglwŷd: Reſt-harrow.
Eleſtr: a Lilly, alſo the Flower de Luce.
Erfin, maîp: branched Broom, Rape, Turnips.
Erfin y coed, bloneg y ddaiar: Briony.
Erllyriad, llyriad: great Plartain or Way-breed.
Erwainr, erwain, erchwaint, chwŷs Arthur: Goats-beard.
Eſgidiau 'r gôg, (bwtties) y gog: Purple Violet.
Evad, yr un a'r ddeilen ddu: The ſame with the black leaf.
Euod ddu, euod gôch: Toe black and red Yles.
Eurddrain doun: Raſpiſes, black Buck thornes.

div.head: F.
div.p:
Y Fabcoll, afans, llyſiau bened, llygad yr yſgyfarnog,
f'anwŷlŷd: Bleſſed Thiſtles, Aſarum, the Herb Benet.
y Fagwŷr-wenn, alaw: The Water Lilly, a Water Roſe, the White Lilly.
y Falerian, cynffon y cabwllt, llyſiau Cadwgan, gwell nâ 'r aur: Valerian, wild Spikenard.
F'anwŷlŷd, y fapcoll: The Herb Benet, Bleſſed Thiſtle.
y Fedwen chwerw, y fedddon, y fedon chwerw: Baſe Hore-bound, wild Sage.
y Feddygŷn, (y fioled,) Violet, the Herb Trinity.
y Feiddiog lâs, mantell fair, mantell y corr, palf y llew: Ground-Ivy, Lyon's Claw.
y Feiddiog lwŷd, y ganwraidd lwŷd, llyſiau jevan, llyſiau llwŷd: Mugwort.
y Feiddiog rudd, The leſſer ſpear wort.
y Felynllŷs, Brigau 'r twŷnau: Arſe-runnet, Ladies Bed-ſtraw.
y Filfŷw, mîl, ŷd gwŷllt, y fronwŷs: wild Wheat, wild corn, Pile-wort.
y Fioled, crinllŷs, meddygŷn, llyſiau 'r drindod: Violet, the Herb Trinity.
y Fioled felen auaf, melŷn y gauaf: Gilliflower.
y Fioled fraith, y fronwŷs wild Wheat, wild corn, Pilewort.
y Friweg, briweg: Prick. Madam, Worm-graſs or ſtone-crop, handed Houſe-leek or ſengreen.
y Fronwŷs, y filfŷw, mîl, melŷn y gwanwŷn, y fronwſt, gwenith y ddaiar, y fioled fraith, llygad ebrill, llygad y diniwed: wild Wheat, wild-Corn, Pilewort.
y Fyddarllŷs, y fywlŷs fwŷaf, y fywfŷth, llyſiau pen tŷ: Great Houſe-leeks, Sempervive, Herb Jupiter, Stone-crop, wall-pepper.
y Fywlŷth leiaf, llyſiau 'r fagwŷr, llwynau 'r fagwŷr, cynffon y llygoden, y ddiloſg, y glaiarllŷs: Tree ſtone-crop, an herb that flowers thrice a year.

div.head: F.
div.p: Ffenigl y môch, pyglŷs: Swine Fennel, Roſemary, Sulphurwort.
Ffenigl helen luyddog: Mew or Spignel.
y Fflamgoed fechan, llaeth y cythraul: Devil's Milk, Petty-ſpurge.
Fflŵr dylis,) eleſtr: a Lilly, alſo the Flower de Luce.
Ffynwewŷr y plant, ffynwewŷr ellyllon, hêſg melfedog, pen melfed, tapr y dŵr, cynffon y gâth: Cat's-tail, Reed-maſe.

div.head: G.
div.p: Y Galdriſt, eirin y ci, llyſiau 'r neidr, ceilliau 'r ci, tegeirian: Dog's Stones.
Y gamamil,) milwŷdd, y gamri, camri: a ſhe Buck-horn, ſweet ſmelling Orches, Camomile.
Y ganrhi gôch, buſtl y ddaiar: the herb Centory.
Y ganwraidd lwŷd, y feiddiog lwŷd: Sea Mug-wort.
Y garddwŷ: herb Carret or Caraways.
Garlleg.) cra 'r gerddi, triagl y tlawd: Garlick.
Yr arllegog, troed yr aſſen: Jack of the Hedge, Sauce alone, having a taſt like Garlick.
Garlleg gwŷllt: wild Garlick, Serpent Garlick.
y Gedowrach leiaf: Chidra, a kind of Balm.
y Gin-groen fechan, llin y forwyn, llîn y llyffaint: wild Line, or Toad-flax.
Glaſwellt y cŵn, llygad y ci: the bob Dog's eye.
Gleſŷn y coed, yr Olchenid: middle Conſound, Bugle, Saracen's Conſound.
y Gloria, dail y gloria: water Gladiole, Glader or Sword-graſs.
y Godog, corn y carw môr: Thorny Samphire.
y Goedrwŷdd, y Goedwŷrdd, neu Godrwŷth: Winter-green, Melilot, Sea Lavender.
Gold,) (gold mair,) rhuddos: the herb Marigold.
Golwg Chriſt, y dorrfagl: Eye-bright, Mouſe-ear, Scorpion-graſs.
Grâs duw: a kind of Hedge Hyſſop.
Grawn paradwŷs, grawn paris, Llyſiau paradwŷs: Cardamum, Grains of Paradiſe, Lady-ſmock or Cuckow-flower.
Grawn y perthi, bloneg y ddaiar: Briony.
Greol, grevol, grevolen, bloneg y ddaiar: Briony.
y Greulŷs fenŷw, llychlŷn y dŵr, llyſiau talieſin, yr henŵr: Groundſel.
y Gromandi, hâd y gromandi: Saxifrage, Hemlock, Drop-wort.
Gromil, torrmaen: The ſame with Gromandi, or Gramandi.
Gruglwŷn: A little Shrub of Heath or Ling.
Gwalchlŷs, llyſiau 'r hebog: Wild Lettice, Hawkweed.
Gwâllt y forwŷn, brige'r gwener, gwâllt gwener, gwâllt y ddaiar: Venus-hair, Maiden hair.
Gwrthlŷs, alan bychan: Foal-foot, Colts-foot or Horſe-foot.
Gwell nâ 'r aur, falerian: Wild Spikenard.
Gwenith yr yſgyfarnog: The Herb Hares-wheat.
Gwenynddail, y wenynog, llyſiau 'r gwenyn: Balm Gentle, or Mint.
Gwimmon, gwmmon: Wrack, Relts, Ore-wood, a Sea-weed.
Gwlŷdd mair, llyſiau 'r crymman: Herb Pimpernel.
Gwmmon, gwimmon, gwŷg y mor, dylŷſg y môr, yfnoden y môr, goumon: Riets, Orewood, a Sea-weed.
Gwrddling, gwrling, helig mair, gwŷrdding, neu gwŷrddling: Wild Myrtle.
Gwrthlŷs, alan bychan: Foal-foot, Coalts-foot, Horſe-hoof.
Gwŷddfid, gwŷddwŷdd, tethau 'r gaſeg, llaeth y geifr, ſugn y geifr: The Lilly of the Valley, Bind-weed, or Honey-ſuckle.
Gwŷg, pŷs y llygod: Mice-peaſe or Pulſe.
Gwŷn y merched, y dinllwyd: wild Agrimony, wild Tanſey, Starwort, Cudwort, Starewort.
Gwŷros, Rhyſwŷdd, yr ŷſwŷdd: Privet or Prim-Mint.

div.head: H.
div.p: Hâd y Gramandi, torrmaen: Saxifrage, Hemlock, Dropwort.
Helyglŷs, y waedlŷs: Looſe-ſtrife, yellow Willow herb.
Hoccŷs bendigaid, hoccŷs y garddau: Garden-Mellows.
Hoccŷs morfa, môr-hoccŷs, hoccys y gors: Marſh-mallows, Sea-mallows.
Hoſanau'r gôg, cennin y brain: the purple Hyacinth Flower.
Hwp yr ychen, eithin yr jair: Reſt-harrow.

div.head: L.
div.p: Lili 'r mai, gwŷddfid: Lilly of the Valley, Bindweed, Honey-ſuckle, May-lilly.

div.head: LL.
div.p: LLaeth y cythraul: Devil's-Milk, petty ſpurge.
Llaeth y geifr, gwŷddfid: Lilly of the Valley, Bindweed, Honey-ſuckle.
Llaeth yr yſgyfarnog, llyſiau 'r cyfog: Garden-ſpurge.
Llaeth yſgall, yſgall y môch: Venus Lip, Sow-thiſtle; alſo wild jagged Lettice.
Llefanog, cluſt yr aſſen: Lawrel, Spurge lawrel.
Llewŷg yr iâr, y bele, ffonn y bugail, crŷs y brenin, ffâ 'r môch: Henbane, Sow-bean.
Llin y forwŷn, llin y llyffaint, y gingroen fechan: Wild-Line or Toad-flax.
Llinhâd y Dŵr, bwŷd yr hwŷaid: Ducks-food.
Llus: Blackberries growing or the ground amongſt Moſs, Wineberries.
Llwŷd y cŵn, môr ddanadl gwŷnn: Horehound.

Llwŷd y din, y dinllwŷd: wild Agrimony, wild Tanſie, Starwort.
Cudwort, Starewort.
Llwŷd y ffordd. llwŷdŷn y ffordd, llwŷd bonheddig, Adafeddog, llyſiau'r Gynddaredd: Cudwort, Chaſeweed Petty-Cotton, a kind of Cotton weed, bloddy Flux wort, Cadweca.
Llwŷnhidŷdd, yſgelynllŷs, pennau'r gwŷr, Traeturiâd y Bugeilŷdd, Aſtyllenlŷs: common Cinguefoile or five leav'd Graſs, Ribwort or Ribwort Plantain.
Llwŷnau'r fagwŷr, y fyddarllŷs: Stone-Crop, Wall-Pepper.
Llychlŷn y dŵr, y Glaiarllŷs: Woad.
Llydan y ffordd, Erllyriad, llyriad, ſawdl Chriſt: great Plantain or Waybreed.
Llygaid y dŷdd, yr Aſpygan. Senſigl: Dayſies, the little Dayſies.
Llygad Ebrill, y filfŷw: Pilewort, wild Wheat, wild corn.
Llygad, y Diniwed, y fronwŷs: Pilewort, wild Wheat, wild corn.
Llygad y cî, Glaſwellt y cŵn: the herb Dog's Eye.
Llygad yr yſgafarnog, y fapcoll: Bleſſed-Thiſtle, Avens, herb Bennet.
Llŷm y llygad, y Ddilwŷdd felen: great Celandine.
Llyriad, llydan y ffordd: great Plantain or Waybreed.
Llyriad llymion, llyriad llynnau, Dyfrllŷs: baſe Horehound, wild Sage Shepherd's Pipe, Fontinel, Pond-weed.
Llyriad y mor, llyſiau Efa: Swine's Creſſes.
Llŷs Dwŷfawg, cribau St. ffraid: Bettony.
Llyſiau'r Afu, cynghlennŷdd yr Afon: Liverwort.
Llyſiau'r Blaidd, Bleidd-dag: Wolf-bane, Monk's Hood.
Llyſiau 'r fam, y bengoch, yr un a llyſiau 'r din: The ſame with Arſmart or Culerage.
Llyſiau 'r drŷw, cwlŷn y mêl: Wild Liverwort or Agrimony.

Llyſiau 'r ddidol: A Turnip, or
Naven, Sow-bread.
Llyſiau efa, Llyriad y môr: Swines creſſes.
Llyſiau 'r erŷr, Llyſiau eryri, y fandon: Wood-Roof.
Llyſiau'r fam: The greateſt handed Satyrion.
Llyſiau 'r fuddau, drydon: Wild Liverwort, or Agrimony.
Llyſiau'r geiniog, dail y gron leiaf: Baſtard Navelwort, a Herb growing in ſtone-walls with ſmall leaves ſomewhat like Ivy.
Llyſiau 'r gwaedling, y wilffrai, milddail: Milſoil or Thouſand leav'd Graſs.
Llyſiau 'r gwenŷn, gwenynddail: Palm gentle or Mint.
Llyſiau 'r gwrda: The Common Mercury, or all-good.
Llyſiau 'r hebog, gwalchlŷs: Wild Lettice; Hawkweed.
Llyſiau 'r hedŷdd, Tafod yr hedŷdd, Troed yr hedŷdd: Herb Cummin.
Llſiau Jevan, y feiddiog Lwŷd: Sea-mugwort.
Llyſiau 'r cribau, Llyſiau r pannwŷr, Venus-lip, Maiden-lip, Shepherd's-Rod, or Teazle, Fullers Thiſtle, Venus Thiſtle.
Llyſiau 'r crymman, gwlŷdd mair: Herb Pimpernel.
Llyſiau 'r cŵſg, pabi dôf: Adonis's Flower, Poppy.
Llyſiau 'r cyfog, fflamgoed, llaeth yr yſgyfarnog: Tithemal, Aſarabacca, Garden Spurge.
Llyſiau 'r cywer, brigau 'r twŷnau: Cheeſrunnet, Ladies-Bed-Straw.
Llyſiau 'r cwlwm, comffrei: Great Walwort, Comfrey or Bugle.
Llyſiau 'r chwain, chweinllŷs: Slive's Acre, Looſe Graſs, Fleawort.
Llyſiau 'r llaw, y ddilwŷdd felen: Great Calandine.
Llyſiau 'r llau, llyſiau 'r poer: White-Rattle, alſo Fern, Louſewort.
Llyſiau 'r llin: Flos Tinctoris, a Flower to dye with.
Llyſiau llwŷd, y feiddiog lwŷd: Mugwort.
Llyſiau'r llwŷnog, y droedrudd: Crane's Pill, Stork's Pill.
Llyſiau Llywelŷn, gwrnerth, rhwŷddlwŷn: Great ſpeed-well or Flewellin, Fluellin.
Llyſiau mair, Gold-mair: The Herb Mary-Gold.
Llyſiau mair fadlen: Eupatory, a kind of wild Carret.
Llyſiau 'r muroedd, briweg y cerrig: Stone-crop.
Llyſiau 'r neidr, eirin y cî: Dog's-Stones.
Llyſiau 'r panwŷr, llyſiau 'r cribau: Venus-lip, Maiden-lip, Shepherd's-Rod, or Teazel, Fuller's Thiſtle, Venus Thiſtle.
Llyſiau 'r pared: Pellitory of the Wall.
Llyſiau 'r perfigedd: A Herb commonly us'd for a Remedy againſt the Griping or Gnawing in Cattle's Guts or Bellies.
Llyſiau pen tai, y fyddarllŷs: Stone-crop, Wall-Pepper, Herb Jupiter.
Llyſiau 'r pwding, y freflys: Pennyroyal, Pudding-graſs.
Llyſiau Robert, y droedrudd: Crane's-Pill, Stork's-Pill.
Llyſiau 'r twrch, bloneg y ddaiar: Briony.
Llyſiau'r wennol, y Ddilwŷdd felen: great Celandine.
Llyſiau'r ychen, tafod yr ŷch: Borage, Bugloſs, Ox-Tongue.
Llyſiau'r yſgyfaint, llyſiau'r Angel: herb Angelica.

div.head: M.
div.p: Maſon, Afan: the hand-berry Brambles, Framboyes, Raſpis, great Brambles.
Maip: a Rape, Turnip or Navew.

Mantell fair, Mantell y corr,
y feiddiog-lâs: Ground Ivy, Lion's Claw.
Marchfieri: The Blackberry Tree or Buſh.
March-yſgall y gerddi, March-yſgall Dôf: Artichokes.
Meddygŷn, y feddyges, y fioled: a Violet.
Mêl y cŵn, Mel y Gweunŷdd, Balog y waun: the herb Woad.
